I first saw this game on Cry’s Channel and immediately was baffled with the concept. Something so serious (alcoholism and abuse) was handle with such care and respect that it melted my heart!!

As Quico goes on this adventure, I went on an emotional roller coaster. What’s even sad is that this is the story of countless homes. 
Brilliant concept, breath-taking visuals, immersive soundtrack and a very unique gameplay. This game is a must buy and deserves a lot of praise!

10/10

39382406.review:
Papo and Yo is an absolutely beautiful experience and if you are a puzzle/platformer fan, or if you like serious stories, this is the game for you. this is a wonderful game. (however, if you are sensitive to stories about child abuse/abusive parents, i give you a warning to be warry of that)

pros:
-graphics are pretty even if their not the best
-amazing and well written serious story from the point of view of a child, you feel the genuine emotion coming from both the writer and the characters
-great soundtrack, i almost want to listen to some of the music while i take a nap
-the game is never too hard and never too easy, i never had to search up a walkthrough, but i also never easily made it through each puzzle either. its the perfect balance of challenge and non rage inducing difficulty
-i was entertained throughout 100% of the game and never bored


cons:
-sometimes it can bug out a little bit (mainly with monster, he got stuck sometimes and i had to quit to main menu and go back to the game to reset him, but this was rare and only happened about once or twice)
- unless if you have a really good computer, the framerate really isnt that good. my computer is only a little bit over a year old and it kept dropping to around 17 framerate (however it always recovered to around 50-60 a little bit afterwards)
-sometimes crashes (especially during cutscenes, at one point i completed a stage and it crashed, forcing me to play that stage all over again)
-not much replay value

i absolutely recommend this game, you wont regret buying it. but i do suggest waiting untill theres a sale for around 10$ and not  not 17$, since the game really isnt that long

39282964.review:
Papo & Yo - это не просто игра. Это в первую очередь трогательная история. Разработчики в своей игре подняли тему, которую обычно все обходят стороной. Я говорю о теме насилия в семье. 

Квико - мальчик, отец которого вечно пьёт и дебоширит. Не имея сил выстоять, мальчик отстраняется от реального мира. Выдуманный мир безумно красивый,  и речь даже не о графике. 

Целью игры является поход к шаману, спообному вылечить монстра, под личиной которого скрывается отец Квико. Для этого нам придётся много бегать, прыгать и решать несложные головоломки.

В общем Papo & Yo справляется с главной целью, она вызывает эмоции и заставляет задуматься. Papo & Yo - шедевр в игровой индустрии.

39193389.review: Produire un jeu plaisant avec une réalité aussi cruelle était un pari risqué ; cela a donné, comme souvent, une belle aventure. Jouer, au sens propre du terme, avec un décor urbain est une belle trouvaille qui donne un intérêt esthétique certain au jeu.

本作游戏难度较低，解密很容易，在游戏性打折的情况下剧情和音乐的作用就会凸显出来。整个游戏的场景都很梦境化，会蹦跶会飞的房屋，用粉笔画出来的机关，最后如盗梦空间一样的布景，玩起来很梦幻。
游戏大意一个被家暴的孩子在自己的幻境中试图拯救父亲的故事。
父亲的角色也不都是邪恶，其实大部分都是温和的。但是父亲消沉的原因我没法理解，是因为撞死人后内疚到沉迷酒精么？
大部分场景从预告片中可以看出其实是他住的相对富人区的街区，至于为什么住富人区的孩子会幻想出贫民窟来我还没玩懂。
整个故事玩起来最后还是悲伤的，救不了的还是让他走吧。

38027052.review:
このゲームは、ゲームタイトルやバナーを見ても分かる通り、父と子と酒の物語です。
女々しくて何が悪い。暗くて何がいけない。常に冷静沈着で感情の起伏無く平穏無事に生きられる人間などいるわけ無いし、もしいたとしても俺はそんな人間など許さない。
Papo & Yoは間違いなくロックだった。
幼少期に父親から受けた仕打ちを、後に表現というパワーを手に入れた作者がアドベンチャーゲームの舞台に叩き上げ、決意とけじめを内包したひとつの作品へと見事に昇華したのである。
大槻ケンヂも言っていたではないか。
コンプレックスを舞台に上げればそれはロックになると。
無責任にカラ元気を出させ、根拠の無い希望を押し付ける絵空事の様な底の浅い世迷い言をニコニコしながら並べ立てても本当は誰も救えはしないのだ。
バンダー・カバレロがやってのけたのはロックだった。
確かに女々しくて情けなくて根暗だったが、それらは全て美しく、攻撃的であった。
キコがファベーラ（スラム）を歩き、少女のアレハンドラがキコを導き、おもちゃのルーラが飛び、モンスターとサッカーボールで遊ぶ。
これだけで全てがわかる。
誰もが切実な思いになるんだ。何もかもが嫌になり、悩み、腐り、屈折し、死にたくなる。
でもそんな時に、Papo & Yoという物語はいつも隣にいてくれる。
晴れやかな気分にさせてくれる。
しばらく他のアドベンチャーゲームはもういいかな？
そんな思いにさせてくれる素敵な世界感。
出来るだけ多くの方に体験していただきたいですね。

37959605.review: Ce jeu est tellement... atypique qu'on peine à le décrire. Pas franchement long (3h de jeu), ni réellement difficile, il mérite cependant le détour, de par son univers si particulier et son histoire prenante.

37936570.review:
Just misclicked and navigated away from my review a minute ago, so this is abriged from what I intended...

Great game! The theme, story, setting, and soundtrack set it apart. This is not dialogue driven.

Pros:
Easy controls (played on Xbox 360 controller)
Fun puzzles and challenges
Fun world
Story has powerful symbolism
Soundtrack is great

Cons:
On occasion, some movement controls were clunky, which felt like artificial difficulty. But nothing too out of the ordinary.
Some aspects were needlessly easy, for example sending Lula out to the 'Lula switches'

All in all would recommend to most players. No 'adult' content per se, but the theme and symbolism are a little heavy for some younger players I would imagine.

Recommend purchasing on sale since it is such a short playthrough. It is completely linear with no player 'choices' in terms of story progression, so replay value is limited.

37671985.review:
Vander Caballero quería desarrollar un videojuego que aportara una experiencia al usuario que trascendiera a las horas de juego. Además, tenía una historia personal que quería contar.

Mezclando estos 2 elementos nace PaPo & Yo, un juego que toca (de manera somera, todo hay que decirlo) un tema serio, complejo y profundo en un universo que rebosa personalidad y originalidad, excelente diseño y OST inmersiva.

El juego invita a explorar un entorno carismático con un control sencillo y pragmático.

Muy recomendable para aquellos que busquen videojuegos que quieran ser más que eso. Duración breve, aunque cada euro vale la pena.

37594017.review:
Pros:
* Level design is beautiful in its simplicity.
* I found myself grinning madly, several times, as the world warped to a childlike surreal take on reality.
* Puzzles were decent, w/o being too tough.
* Plotline was easy to follow.
* Only a few of the platforming parts were of middling difficulty. (I dislike tough platformers in casual games)

Cons:
* The plotline is, essentially, given away in the intro movie - so the big reveal at the end is just silly.
* One achievement is impossible to obtain via the 1st playthrough - the collectibles are disabled until the 2nd one.
* Opinion: The plotline is a bit heavy-handed regarding the "monster"'s affliction.

TL;DR: 8/10 - beautiful, surreal environment w/ mildly challenging puzzles.

36777589.review: I first played this small game 5 years ago. Since then, I've been playing it at the beginning of every single summer. It has a distinct warm, summery feel about it. Its story is sad, but the world you play in is so vibrant it ends up making you happy. And to call its soundtrack beautiful would be an understatement. 36670658.review: Historia y animaciones excepcionales, puzles divertidos y fluidos (no dificultosos). Un juego que logra con creces acercar la naturaleza adulta a la infantil, haciendo uso de una aproximación respetuosa y dispuesta a comprender, la cual olvidamos los adultos por menospreciar la cosmovisión de los niños. Al mirar a Quico, podemos entender cómo su realidad, indiferentemente de la carencia intermitente de leyes físicas o causales, logra expresar de manera perfecta sus experiencias, pensamientos y sentimientos. Dicho mundo, aunque fantasioso para los adultos, ante los ojos de Quico, cobra una seriedad y una importancia comparable a la que sentimos nosotros por nuestro mundo "real", al que nos hemos adaptado con los años. El mundo de Quico es un escondite, pero también un lente que le permite interpretar y reaccionar a sus experiencias, todo basado en un razonamiento que se acopla perfectamente a su persona. Tres preguntas que valen la pena hacernos son: ¿Como adultos, qué mundos utilizamos nosotros?, ¿Son mejores nuestros mundos? y ¿Somos realmente tan diferentes?

36581476.review: this game is very cool and has a very sad story, dont drink and drive guy, no alcohol and vehicle plz

36421939.review:
El argumento, y cómo la música, las imágenes, y todas y cada una de las mecánicas del juego lo acompañan, es una auténtica obra de arte.

Para mi, este juego supone la demostración de que se puede crear arte con un videojuego. Merece la pena comprarlo, y merece la pena comprarlo sin descuento (ahora mismo vale unos 15€).

AVISO: este juego descansa bastante en las mecánicas de puzle, aunque yo sin ser un gran fan de este tipo de mecánicas, he disfrutado mucho el juego.

Hasta aquí la valoración, a partir de aquí mi historia: compré este juego hace varios años en unas rebajas de Steam, cuando estaba a 1,5€ (sobre un precio original de 4 a 5 €). Lo compré con lo que había sacado a lo largo del año de especular con cromos. En aquel momento lo probé, me gustó, pero como tenía poco tiempo (supongo que por algún trabajo o examen) y lo desinstalé.
 Me gustaron las mecánicas (a pesar de ser puzle, no tenían mucha complicación al principio) y el aspecto del juego, por lo que me dije que cuando tuviera más tiempo, debía intentar llegar hasta el final del juego.
Años más tarde, lo he vuelto a descargar, y he llegado hasta el final. Si antes me gustaba, ahora tras pasármelo, lo considero uno de los mejores juegos a los que he jugado en mi vida. 


Me parece una pena haber podido perderme este juego si no lo hubiera encontrado tan barato cuando lo compré.

36408694.review: Well, what i can say ??? I just started playing this game with zero expectations, I had no idea what this game was about and the best thing in a game for me is coming in without expectations and being blown away, impressed, by how good a game you never had a idea about is, Papo & Yo is one of those games that ''Over-Impress" you, I was completely amazed by how much i was into it, the game has a beautiful art design especially because i live in those areas you see in the game, you know the slums you see in the game ??? we have a lot of them here on Brazil, the place where i live and seeing them being portrayed so well with an amazing and creative level design, cute characters, imaginative puzzles and a deep, metaphorical story about overcoming a problem that doesn't fix itself, i don't know man, I almost cried in the end, the masterful soundtrack, the puzzles, the art, this is definitely a masterpiece for me, its a bit short, it's 4 hours long but it's one of those games that you can replay easily over and over because it never gets old, i  recommend this game to everyone, every single people, because this is a experience that i feel everyone should have, considering i was about to quit gaming because i have been dedicating too much time to this hobby for all those years and those latest games never hit me hard or even made me get into them, seeing those hidden gems like this is what keeps me having passion for this hobby of gaming, papo & yo is definitely one of my favorite indie games of all time and I am glad that i experienced it, with its different and kinda innovative approach to narrative, it changed a bit how i perceive stories on those types of games and by the end of the day i want to thank the developers so much for this beautiful ride, Papo & Yo is a beautiful game on every aspect and you should definitely buy it and experience it if you have the chance.

Papo & Yo takes on some serious themes and presents them to you from the viewpoint of a young boy named Quico. Inspired by the childhood of the lead developer this is clearly a labour of love, a unique story driven title with some outstanding visual design and a stellar soundtrack.
The gameplay here is somewhat puzzle platformer but there is almost no challenge in either the puzzle elements or platforming sections, which is fine since the main focus of this game is it narrative. Although at just a few hours long the story is short but it is compelling throughout.

35938789.review:
I like games that aim to be more than mere entertainment (not that there is anything wrong with that). A game like this that tackles a serious issue can only have my approval. 

The medium has been used in such a way that it delivers its intentions very well. Your relationship with Monster (representing an alcoholic parent) is mixed: sometimes, he serves as an ally and helps you move forward, but sometimes he is a threat and should be avoided. Here, I described the mechanics as well as the narrative in one sentence. That is the strenght of this game: it reaches elegance. 

With its few dialogues, it still manages to tell a tragic story that hooked me. I loved everything about it, but the ending in particular really spoke to me. 

While I do appreciate how the message was handled, I think the parable stagnates after a while. It does come back in force in the end, but I think somewhere in the middle, nothing new is brought to the table.

Furthermore, the gameplay is a bit lacking here: the puzzles are very straightforward, and the platforming poses no difficulty. Most of the gameplay sequences consist of pulling levers, which would have worked if the game was thought as a "walking simulator" (I don't like that term), but is a bit unsatisfying here. 

The mechanics of moving around big houses by moving a paired box was quite inventive though, and is where the puzzle-solving shines. I know pushing boxes is one of the oldest mechanics, but this was used in a pleasant and new way. Near the end, the level design in general gets better. 

All in all, I do recommend it: The minimalistic story-telling was well handled, the simple gameplay can entertain you if you're in the mood for an easy game, the characters and environment designs are great and distinct, and its theme is the kind of serious narratives that is still far too rare in video games.

35664364.review:
Quico est un gamin des favelas qui déambule dans les ruelles baignées de soleil, qui escalade les pittoresques cabanes accrochées à la montagne en compagnie du petit robot volant Lula, qui partage des jeux d'enfants avec sa petite camarade et qui fait connaissance avec un gentil monstre amateur de noix de coco.

Papo & Yo, c'est d'abord de magnifiques images d'un monde coloré et idéalisé associées à une musique somptueuse qui donne au jeu une ambiance poétique qui invite à la contemplation.

C'est aussi une dimension fantastique où des grafittis s'animent pour faire apparaître des portes lumineuses, surgir un escalier ou dévoiler des mécanismes faisant s'envoler les maisons ou transformer une partie du décor.

C'est ensuite un jeu composé d'énigmes originales et de phases de plate-formes sympathiques mais qui privilégie toujours l'ambiance et l'histoire qu'il raconte plutôt que proposer un défi aux joueurs avec un gameplay difficile.

C'est enfin un univers mélancolique en partie onirique qui aborde par des métaphores touchantes un thème grave sur la base de souvenirs difficiles de l'enfance d'un des développeurs du jeu.



J'ai adoré la direction artistique, j'ai été touché par la poésie de ce jeu que j'ai fini d'une traite jusqu'à l'émouvant final.

L'expérience fait appel à la sensibilité des joueurs sans jamais chercher à freiner sa progression ou le mettre en échec. Il y a même des aides in-game pour les moins perspicaces afin que chacun puisse se concentrer sur l'essentiel et atteindre la fin de l'aventure en moins de 4h.  

Contrairement à ce qui a été évoqué dans d'autres commentaires, ma partie n'a pas été perturbée par des bugs. Je n'ai remarqué que de très rares et insignifiantes erreurs d'affichage à la jonction entre deux murs qui n'altèrent en aucune façon la beauté du paysage.

Enfin, j'ai apprécié l'expression tout en pudeur de la souffrance qui est exprimée à travers les péripéties vécues par Quico. Je trouve dommage qu'on puisse trop en lire sur le thème lourd abordé par ce jeu avant de le découvrir et le comprendre soi-même en incarnant le jeune garçon.


Oeuvre qui ne laisse pas indifférent et à recommander sans réserve.

35617948.review:
1. I found this looking through the ancient dregs of Humble Bundles past in my Steam library. I was like, hey, a 3D puzzle game that is not trying to be Portal and I hit the download button posthaste. Turns out, it is really more of an adventure game. I'm still glad I played.


2. This actually even veers toward walking sim territory but avoids the "wow, look how atmospheric this game is" while you do absolutely nothing trappings of the genre by having a  plot you are directly involved in and also having actual gameplay challenges.


3. There is no character in the game called either Papo or Yo. I guess the title means something like daddy and me in Brazilian Portuguese. This is story relevant. You'll figure it out as you play.


4. The atmosphere of this game quite reminds me of the 2006 movie Pan's Labyrinth. It is set up as a child's fantasy but it is clear that this fantasy is rooted in very real danger to its protagonist, Quico. It is charming on the surface but the unreal sheen to it is slightly unsettling from the very start.


5. Having read many reviews of this game, I feel obliged to join in in saying that it is set in a Brazilian favela--as if any of us knew what that word meant before playing this game. It is s third-world type slum w/ lots of warm orange and brown tones, terracotta and stucco. It serves as a perfect background for the fantastical elements of Papo & Yo. Having a giant monster going through a more modern looking city gets a bit too King Kong if you ask me.


6. This monster looks intimidating but the main character, Quico, regards him w/ easy familiarity and initially he seems harmless enough. The gameplay here revolves around mild puzzle solving and platforming to help Quico let the monster his way through the favela.


7. This is not exactly Mario 64 as far as the platforming nor is it Portal as far as the puzzle solving but neither is it completely trivial. Nobody is going to have much trouble getting through this but everyone is going to have to try some sections more than once.


8. This is story focused to be sure but the story is mostly told through gameplay so it never feels like you are just there. There are a few expository cut scenes but almost every step of the way, you are directly involved in everything that happens.


9. You are not given really any choice in how you handle things but this is because the developers have a very clear and well-developed story they want to tell. The purpose of the gameplay is to draw you into it.


10. Quico really scampers up ladders, making this the one game in existence where climbing ladders isn't interminable.


11. The in-game narrative is allegorical in a way that is eventually explained to you completely but the plot would stand on its own even if the fantasy world was not so strongly tied into real life.


12. I recall liking the music while playing but can't for the life of me remember a strain of it shortly after playing. I'd say this makes it adequate for the game's ambition but perhaps nothing exceptional.


13. If I were to teach a course on designing narrative-focused games, I'd have my students play through this game before the first day of class. It is accessible but not so easy you lose interest. The story is compelling w/o being heavy handed. The narrative gives you plenty to think about w/o sacrificing the moment to money joy of gameplay. Even years later, I find many games of this genre to still be struggling w/ getting all of these elements to fall into place consistently.

35603747.review: Very simple gameplay, linear (but not so repetitive). The light narrative is super efficient and moving. Level design and animation are really cool in an Inception kind of way. 35473813.review:
在Steam上玩的第二款游戏，类型偏解密冒险类，非常适合新手玩家。关卡难易程度适中，有难度的环节会有hint box跳出来提示，所以不会出现不知道如何通关的场景。而且关卡推进画面很有想象力，一切都是可折叠、可延展、可堆叠的，喜欢这个设定。

游戏有两点非常抓人，一是剧情，二是BGM。剧情挺致郁的，大结局的Chapter名字叫《Growing Up》，But is the only way to free the Monster is to kill it? Well I still believe the real growing up is to accept oneself instead of forgetting.但开发者应该也是想证明addiction本身的可怕，所以才会写了这么悲伤的结局吧。

然后就是BMG，不仅和当时的场景呼应，而且很有南美当地的音乐特色。怪不得会单拉出来在steam上出售呀！

操作上有点晕，视角360°转，刚开始玩的时候完全找不到北；而且一直需要操作不同幅度的跳跃，或者在规定时间内跑位；怪兽发狂的时候也很揪心，而且会被各种攻击各种扔，耳机里都是喊叫声，画面都是火焰，卡着过不去就很急OTL有几关可能反复跑了几十次……惹……某位同学说我灰常木有操作天分，哼就不承认！

最后！游戏画面好精致！可以看到阳光照出的光影，以及场景内的壁画都超级酷，色彩也很艳丽，和背景强烈反差，好多幅都忍不住截图留念，游戏设计非常走心了呀

35238612.review:
網誌無音樂圖文好讀版 http://wowtomato.blogspot.tw/2017/09/papo-yo.html
玩的時候發生的趣事，剪成了精華w https://youtu.be/epfuRjzVw1s

【遊戲介紹】
這是一款第三人稱視角的動作冒險解謎小品遊戲
音樂好聽，雖然多數時候只有自己的腳步聲陪伴
場景設計的有趣，尤其是是色調上的安排，我很喜歡牆壁上的塗鴉
場景、配樂、人物都很有民族風的特色
操作簡單，推薦使用手把遊玩！不過用鍵盤應該不會差異太大
解謎屬於輕鬆型，如果還是過不了也有提示箱在附近可以看 (雖然提示箱我也有看不懂的
劇情短，這遊戲只是為了傳達概念而做的

【心得】
其實開頭遊戲就直接說這遊戲的主軸了XD
所以比較像是在體驗遊戲想要訴說著什麼其他看法
而這部份我覺得它在遊戲中並沒有表達好.... 
解謎的關卡沒什麼難的，解開過程設計的很有趣
大多數我卡關的時刻反而是它要求的"微動"操作我做不到
ex.跳躍到另一個平台上但一直失敗..
關卡的設計上有許多地方讓人覺得只是拖延時數用，覺得很可惜
劇情的部份處理的很粗操，前面有像是在鋪梗，結果後面什麼都沒說，感到一頭霧水
人物之間的情感我無法連結起來，作者想傳達的概念我也沒有從這遊戲中感受到
所以我覺得只是玩了一款畫面不錯、風格特殊、音樂好聽的解謎小品
以遊戲體驗來說並沒有很好玩，如果有耐心、想試試特殊的風格或一些有趣的過程再購入玩吧
順道一提，有些成就要第二輪才能解的到

【短評】
適合有耐心毅力、喜歡輕鬆解謎、喜歡特殊風格、喜歡冒險類型的玩家遊玩

【備註】
特別推薦使用CodeBay.in正體中文模組
https://www.codebay.in/2013/12/papoyo-cht-mod.html
*注意* 安裝完後請執行Steam收藏庫內的Papo & Yo
我是執行CodeBay.in的捷徑，而Steam沒有判定到，所以時數及成就都沒有增加

Historia.

Un niño se oculta de un monstruo en un armario y de repente se abre una puerta mágica a otro mundo.

-Sobre las 3 horas de juego
-En muchas partes del juego tendremos que lidiar con un monstruo haciendo que nos siga o que no se enfade.

-La música.
-La historia y el final, ya que te hace recapacitar. 


Lo que no me ha gustado:

Conclusion:

Si te llaman la atención juegos como ICO o Rime, ese tipo de  juegos plataformas contemplativos con una historia que te haga recapacitar, este es un juego muy entretenido y bonito.

33874921.review:
I was looking forward to playing this game, and ultimately feel disappointed. The music was wonderful, some of the scenes were beautiful, a few of the puzzle mechanics were fresh and interesting, and ultimately I think the game tried to tackle some important topics.

However I felt it all fell flat. The puzzles were ultimately not cognitively challenging and devolved to being largely a basic platformer. Music was largely a rare island in a sea of mostly silence. The possible emotional hooks and cultural importance of the game failed to connect with me personally, although this may differ based on personal experience. The levels felt on-rails with no actual rewards for exploration or attempting alternative solutions to puzzles (so much as the game rewards exploration, there is a hat collection mechanic that is completely unavailable your first playthrough, with no apparent other incentive to play through again.)

Having played through the game start to finish I could not in good conscience recommend the game when there are so many other artistic puzzle games out there these days offering more consistently compelling experiences.

Практически отсутствующий сюжет, едва раскрытые персонажи, которых меньше, чем пальцев на одной руке, однообразный дизайн, глюковатость. На славу удались только пазлы и музыка. В каждой следующей локации, пусть она выглядит точно как предыдущая, принципиально новые механики и возможность удивиться.
Если вас как таковой интересует сюжет с родителем-алкоголиком и восприятием его ребенком, попробуйте Among the sleep. Если хотите инди-платформер-головоломку с бОльшим вниманием к раскрытию персонажей и истории, попробуйте Contrast.

33477568.review:
Giocare a Papo & Yo è quasi un'esperienza catartica se si tiene conto delle metafore che i due protagonisti del gioco si portano dietro. La fuga del piccolo Chico in questo splendido mondo di fantasia e visionarietà diventa così lo specchio dei demoni personali dell'autore del gioco Vander Caballero, che non si è però limitato a creare un mondo solo bello da vedere. Il gameplay a metà strada tra platform e puzzle-game funziona e diverte sebbene sia un po' limitato come varietà e situazioni, ma alla fine è soprattutto il rapporto tra Chico e Mostro a rendere Papo & Yo un titolo a suo modo unico e quel finale da brividi vale da solo l'intero gioco.
Esorcizzare i propri demoni personali creando un videogioco non è cosa di tutti i giorni, soprattutto se si proviene da un colosso come Electronic Arts e si ci si butta anima e corpo su un nuovo progetto indipendente, rischioso e decisamente fuori dagli schemi. Eppure è proprio questa la strada seguita da Vander Caballero, game designer di successo che dopo aver dato un contributo fondamentale alla serie di Army of Two ha fondato un proprio studio (Minority), realizzando in poco tempo Papo & Yo
Di piattaforma in piattaforma
Parlavamo di demoni personali perchè alla fine le avventure fantastiche e visionarie di Papo & Yo vanno a scavare nella difficile infanzia di Caballero segnata dall'alcolismo del padre. Così Chico, il protagonista del gioco, non è altro che un Caballero bambino; per fuggire alla violenza del padre, il piccolo si rifugia in questo mondo immaginario raffigurato da una favela dove i palazzi crollano, si muovono e si ricostruiscono, scale a chiocciola compaiono dal nulla e disegni sui muri prendono vita diventando dei meccanismi per modificare l'ambiente esterno. Una simile location, che nel corso del gioco lascerà spazio ad ambientazioni ancora più sognanti, visionarie e bizzarre immerse in  un "nulla" bianco di grande impatto figurativo, non può che essere uno dei punti forti di un gioco, soprattutto se la natura del gameplay è basata su un mix di platform e puzzle-game. Chico infatti esplora la sua favela saltando da una piattaforma all'altra, attivando meccanismi sui muri e cambiando continuamente la conformazione di ciò che lo circonda, quasi fosse lui il deus ex machina di un sogno in modo non dissimile da certe esplosioni visionarie di Inception. L'elemento platform di Papo & Yo, potenziato anche dal robottino Lula che agisce da jetpack e permette di attivare meccanismi altrimenti irraggiungibili, non va però visto in un'ottica di competizione o di stimolo "hardcore", visto che se cadiamo nel vuoto torniamo immediatamente sull'ultima piattaforma senza alcun tipo di penalizzazione. Alla base di tutto c'è quindi il piacere per l'esplorazione e per la risoluzione di puzzle via via più impegnativi, anche se su questo versante il gioco non sfocia mai in passaggi troppo complessi o frustranti.
Emozioni al potere
L'altro elemento cardine del gameplay è il rapporto tra Chico e Mostro, una creatura rosa di grandi dimensioni che, proprio come il padre del piccolo, passa da momenti di calma e di quasi tenerezza a tremende e incontrollabili sfuriate. Se infatti Mostro se ne sta per gli affari suoi per la maggior parte del tempo dormendo e mangiando noci di cocco fornite da Chico, quando ingurgita una rana verde (e ce ne sono parecchi nei livelli di gioco) diventa una furia, va letteralmente a fuoco e insegue Chico come un ossesso, tanto che l'unico modo per calmarlo è dargli da mangiare un frutto azzurro piuttosto difficile da trovare. Se sulle prime questa interazione tra Chico e Mostro pare solo un simpatico espediente di gameplay per variare un po' il gameplay, in realtà più passa il tempo e più il rapporto tra i due muta e si fa sempre più stretto per poi sfociare in un finale tra i più commoventi mai visti negli ultimi tempi. Non è un caso se la cifra stilistico di Papo & Yo va intesa più in senso emozionale che non videoludico. Il gameplay è certamente piacevole e il mix di generi funziona bene, ma si ha come la sensazione che certe meccaniche e certi puzzle siano stati inseriti con una certa superficialità e in fondo, con l'eccezione di Mostro, il gioco tende a ripetere bene o male a ripetere la stessa struttura dall'inizio alla fine senza grandi cambiamenti. Spiace inoltre che la longevità si limiti a circa quattro ore e che, a parte le bellissime ambientazioni, il comparto grafico soffra di difetti non proprio trascurabili come animazioni legnose, modelli poligonali un po' scialbi e vistosi cali di frame-rate quando Mostro diventa un'incontrollabile torcia umana. Nonostante ciò Papo & Yo rimane un titolo di buon livello. E' toccante, fa riflettere, ha una splendida colonna sonora, trasporta il giocatore in un'atmosfera bellissima e unica, si gioca con piacere dall'inizio alla fine e vale tutti i 14,99 euro richiesti. finisce malissimo il capitolo che ci rimani male

33204774.review:
这游戏哪有隐喻啊简直全是明喻。

游戏是讲一个被酗酒父亲家暴，躲进自己幻想世界的小男孩的故事。标题 Papo & Yo 显然就是 Papa & You，父亲与你。这不算剧透因为商店页面的介绍视频自己就讲了。

虽说游戏背景是南美贫民窟但其实主角小男孩的家庭并不贫穷，至少是相对富裕的。身上的校服品质很好，家里房子很大还有车，只是穿过了传送门到了贫民窟。所以这其实是一个南美上层中产阶级家庭的独子承受不住家长的期望，幻想自己能像贫民窟小孩一样自由自在的故事。听起来是不是有点像那种万事都是『我这是为你好』的中国家庭了？

墙上的粉笔涂鸦变成机关推动环境变化这个逻辑，很有新意却也合情合理。解迷难度很低，每个谜题边上还有提示箱，生怕你解不出来故事没法往下讲。加之游戏本身是线性述事，并没有分支剧情，甚至连岔路都很少，一切就是为了让你安心看故事。听说二周目会有一些收集要素，但不是真爱党或者成就党大概没什么必要再通一遍了。虚幻引擎发挥了应有的作用，游戏的画质还是相当不错的，尤其是阳光打在贫民窟杂乱的建筑上时，形成的光影斑驳都能很好地体现出来。缺点也是有的：晕。虽然没有半条命那么强烈，但一些场景下强烈的光照对比，较小的 FOV 以及镜头移动时的奇怪加速度还是让我玩了一个多小时后就得躺上一会了。



关于游戏的隐喻，看了下旧讨论，好像意见还不是很一致。说说我的：

1. 结局的 Let it go，将怪物推下虚空的解读。我不认为在现实中主角谋害了其父亲，十岁少年很难有能力杀害一个成年男性，即使确实成功了，后续的社会机制也是他无法应对的。Let it go 更像是呼应商店页面的游戏简介。即 Quico 本来还是把怪物当朋友，即使遭受暴力也不放弃，寻求治愈它的办法。但最终发现无法治愈以后，终于彻底放弃这种幻想，放弃用幻想精神逃避来保护自己。不再对父亲抱有改善的期望，意味着怪物朋友不复存在。

2. 父亲性格的转变的直接原因是车祸，但受害者是个成年男性，不是剧中的小女孩。这有明确的场景特写。该场景同时也第一次明示了父亲是怪物（主角坐车后座，父亲下车查看被撞者，车灯在墙上映出父亲的影子是怪物的剪影）。

3. 去找萨满遇到回忆之火那里，四个雕像中怪物吞掉小女孩切换后成了父亲抓着该女孩的手腕。意味着小女孩与父亲确实是有直接接触的，并且是很不友善的接触。这有两种解读，一种是结合前面小女孩复活玩具 Lula 时说的 Now we are one [strike]巫妖王登基[/strike]，女孩大概是主角的相好妹子，但因为 [strike]早恋影响学习[/strike] 各种原因被父亲抓到后训斥强迫分手滚蛋了。另一种比较黑暗，吃掉、吞下这类行为本身就有一定程度的性隐喻。

4. 肤色问题是个大问题，父亲的肤色和 Quico 的肤色差别很大，大到很难用 Quico 贪玩晒黑来解释了。所以是领养的，或者是隔壁老王？从其良好的校服所反映的教育条件来看，领养大概更实际一点。父亲确实有家暴，但游戏也说了，在清醒时怪物还是很温和的。老王家的孩子不去挖煤挣钱就不错了。

33161408.review:
Apesar de ter permanecido um tanto esquecido em minha lista de jogos e de não ter criado grandes expectativas devido a sua nota no metacritc, devo dizer Papo & Yo me impressionou de inúmeras maneiras diferentes.
	Esperava encontrar um adventure/puzzle bonito, mas genérico, com resoluções e lógicas já manjadas. O que realmente tive como experiência foi um jogo criativo, profundo, imersivo e marcante. Ao enumerar as qualidades do jogo, a que entra em primeiro lugar é sua história. Não por se tratar de uma história nunca antes pensada, em verdade a história pode até parecer simples demais, mas o que torna ela incrível é o quão real os sentimentos são passados ao jogador. A trama não é apenas fluída, cativante, como também é baseada na infância do escritor e designer do jogo, Vander Caballera.
	Como se não bastasse o excelente enredo, o jogo conta com uma trilha sonora surpreendente, e acho que este realmente foi o ponto que mais me impressionou. Como o jogo se passa no Brasil, estava esperando uma “carnavalização” das músicas, tendo apenas baladas clichês para ouvir, mas o que tive o prazer de ouvir foi uma trilha sonora envolvente, poderosa, e perfeita. A música por si só já faz cada minuto do jogo valer a pena, e o pessoal da Minority Media, desenvolvedora do jogo, fez questão de encaixar de modo a enfatizar da melhora maneira possível o sentimento de cada cena.
	Por fim, o único problema que encontrei com o jogo, além de um outro glitch que ocasionou por tentativas falhas de parkour em lugares inusitados, foi o seu preço. Realmente, como citei acima, o jogo é maravilhoso em inúmeros aspectos, e não me arrependo de tê-lo adquirido em uma promoção, contudo… Trinta reais é um preço exageradamente salgado para um jogo de, no máximo, 4 horas de playthrough. Eu fechei o jogo duas vezes, uma pela história e a segunda pelos achievements, e tudo isto totalizou 6 horas (e vou ter que jogar uma terceira vez porque esqueci de um achivement, então talvez apareçam 9 horas neste review), e isto fez valer um pouco mais o dinheiro investido. Mas para alguém que venha a jogar uma vez apenas, pagará um preço caro demais se não o comprar em promoção. Este é um grande ponto negativo, em minha opinião, mas certamente não impactará o amor que peguei por este jogo (mas impactará um pouco a nota, heh).

[h1][i]TL;DR:[/i][/h1]
[list]
[*]Arte: 10/10
[*]Música: 10/10
[*]Jogabilidade: 9/10
[*]História: 10/10
[*]Originalidade: 10/10
[*]Preço: 5/10

[b][h1]Overall: 9/10[/h1][/b]

Certamente um jogo que vale a pena ser incluso em sua futura lista de jogos, seja agora ou em uma próxima promoção, o que não vale é deixar de jogar esta obra de arte.

Music and sound design
Story

Easy puzzles
Unique puzzles
Puzzles' difficulty increase in a timely manner

Cons
Short game although the price is quite fair for it
Easy puzzles if you were looking for more difficult ones
The story might not resonate with everybody even if it is a good one in the end

32344591.review:
6小时二周目全成就。因为收集元素（帽子）只在二周目出现，因此二周目是必须的。成就相对好拿，可以作为不花大力气刷全成就的一个游戏。如果二段跳的手感别那么艹蛋的话，还能更快一些通关。
说说画面，色彩和光感的控制完全弥补了模型细节的不同，不同场景的氛围非常到位。关上游戏后看看自己的截图，其实并没有特别漂亮特别震撼啥的，但是就是那一刻光线和BGM给你带来的感动让你情不自禁截了图。就这点来说，这游戏的代入感没得说。
音乐点赞，不多不少，恰到好处。配音，成功给你一种“虽然我不懂但是很厉害的样子”的感觉，这种独立游戏用这类哇哇叫的原住民语言真是好取巧的办法啊（茶）
说说剧情。[spoiler]这游戏讲了一个“救个毛啊，回家等死吧”的悲伤故事。（我没说错）[/spoiler]
[spoiler]生长在贫民窟的小男孩Quico，被收养（从肤色来看我认为是收养的可能性更大一些），但是这个养父不是什么好货，他酗酒，而且酗酒之后打人，也许在某次酗酒后对那位小女孩造成了不可弥补的伤害。Quico也是受害者之一，也许是目睹了养父打小女孩，也许是目睹了一次养父雨天不小心撞到人的车祸（个人认为这个可能性更大），Quico精神受到了刺激。在那场车祸里，养父停下车查看被撞到的人，车灯照着养父的身影投在墙上，看起来就像个巨大的怪物。Quico从此沉溺在自己的幻想世界里，在他的幻想中，养父平时是个温和的大怪物，平时不会害人，但是在吃了青蛙（喝了酒）之后，就会变成浑身冒火的脾气暴躁的猛兽。Quico有个玩具，一只黄色的机器人，是他最好的伙伴，在他的幻想世界里，机器人也是他最得力的冒险助手。Quico在寻找一个神圣的力量能治愈养父身上的诅咒。[/spoiler]
[spoiler]而到了冒险的终点，Quico才发现并没有什么神圣的力量，养父的堕落是由他自己造成的，没有什么方法能够挽救他。于是，他想吃青蛙，就给他更多的青蛙吧；他想喝酒，就让他喝个够，让他浑身着火，直到把自己烧着。最后由玩家亲手将怪物推下深渊，仿佛有一种仪式感……游戏的结局是我最喜欢的部分，因为不是HE，有一种淡淡的无力感，让人觉得这就是现实。然而小机器人一直固定住电梯的绳索，目送着Quico越走越远的那一幕还是赚了我好些眼泪。[/spoiler]

32271541.review:
Un jeu qui mériterait d'être plus connu ! Doté d'une chouette ambiance visuelle (les tags qui ornent les murs de la favela, les nombreuses trouvailles qui accompagnent la résolution des énigmes...) et d'une formidable bande-son évolutive, [b]Papo & Yo[/b] marque surtout par sa thématique inhabituelle (d'autant plus poignante qu'elle est autobiographique) ; malheureusement pour moi j'en savais déjà trop sur le jeu (entre les articles de la presse JV au moment de sa sortie, et le très réussi court-métrage de 4 minutes qui fait office de [i]trailer[/i]), du coup la révélation finale n'en était pas vraiment une et n'a pas eu autant d'impact qu'elle aurait dû.
Enfin bon, ce petit détail ne m'a pas pour autant gâché mon plaisir : Je vous recommande chaudement cette aventure poétique de 3~4 heures qui, vers la fin, m'a un peu fait penser à [b]Journey[/b] ([spoiler]le passage en téléphérique m'a rappelé l'ascension finale du jeu de [i]thatgamecompany[/i][/spoiler]) !

32218094.review:
A genuine work of art.  It's short; the puzzles are more charming than they are challenging; and the allegory is about as subtle as a belt across the face.  None of that stops this from being affecting and beautiful work.

It put in mind of nothing so much as a playable, Brazilian-flavored Miyazaki film, with all the brilliantly creative imagery and barely-there dream logic narrative that implies.

Hard to recommend for the gameplay; easy recommendation for the experience.  Worth checking out.

32203186.review:
(Beat this on PS3 but played a bit on here for review, no differences seen so I didn't play it through twice.)

As someone who drools over interesting art and architecture in games, Papo & Yo does a phenomenal job by incorporating spanish stylings with some visually fascinating puzzles to give a unique look to an already unique game. The subject matter is no doubt what put it on the map; an allegory for a son trying to maintain a relationship with his abusive father, motivating the father with "fruit" and avoiding him when he's infected with rage via...frogs? It's difficult to critisize, only for the fact that the allegory itself is so well executed, but even within its failings and frustrating moments, I do assure you the game is worth taking a dive into, though I will touch upon the issues regardless. 

Where the game fails most is in those visually grand puzzles I mentioned. While none are beyond solving, what made the experience a bit more than irritating was the constant feeling there were other solutions to them that were often unaccounted for, and the A.I. of Papo did the game no favors. Many of the puzzles involve attracting the hulking red beast to chase frogs or eat fruit to get him on a certain spot, but like the Last Gaurdian several years later, Papo simply just doesn't want to listen. I understand writing A.I, no matter how rudimentary, is difficult, but if your game is going to be built around it make sure you nail that down okay? This, of course, is an indie game, so it is far more forgivable than a previously mentioned game in development for nearly a decade, but just be warned you will not have a smooth time with Papo in this sense. At least it works with the allegory? The camera is also quite atrocious at certain points. Just bad.

The story is of course where the game shines but even then I cannot say I was fully invested. Presented mostly without dialogue, there are plenty of shining moments visually, and any interaction with the MC and his robot buddy are a treasure. The girl who leads Yo across the land to progess the journey and explain the mechanics is welcome when she appears, but all that said, even at the conclusion and the emotional peaks it tries to convey, it never took me far enough to elicit emotion. I could see the message and understood the emotion but something about the delivery or presentation, or maybe just the flawed execution of the puzzles pulled me out the experience as a whole.
 
In all, Papo & Yo is a flawed if touching experience that is mired with a poor camera and elevated with the sensitive subject matter. If you find it cheap or in a bundle, there really isn't anything like it, even if it never fully reaches its own ambitions. Give a try if you need something short with some interesting subject matter.

31954591.review:
[h1][i]"There is a savage beast in every man"[/i]

 George R.R. Martin, A Storm of Swords [/h1]

Da bambini si ha una fervida immaginazione che spesso viene usata per riempire di magia la realtà. Ma c'è un altro uso, più triste, dell'immaginazione fanciullesca: l'evasione da una realtà, dalle paure. 
Sin dall'inizio, il gioco ci fa intendere che è qualcosa di più di un semplice puzzle platform. È una storia autobiografica di un uomo, che da bambino, evadeva dalla realtà per sfuggire ad un padre violento (che qui viene rappresentato come un mostro).
Nel gioco interpretiamo, infatti, Quico, un bambino che per sfuggire dal padre, fugge in un mondo (le favelas, le famose baraccopoli brasiliane) che viene continuamente plasmato dalle sue azioni. Da qui inizierà un viaggio per il nostro protagonista, che con l'aiuto del suo robottino e di una ragazzina, alla ricerca di una cura per il Mostro.

Sebbene dal punto di vista grafico il gioco non è estremamente dettagliato, il comparto artistico d'altro canto... è un qualcosa che più di una volta vi lascerà straniti (in senso positivo!). 
Il comparto sonoro invece presenta buone musiche anche se poche.

Purtroppo il gioco dura poco, massimo un paio di orette e presenta enigmi abbastanza semplici, segno che si sono concentrati molto più sull'aspetto artistico che sull'aspetto ludico (non che questo sia sempre una cosa negativa eh!).

Pertanto non è un gioco che consiglierei a chi cerca stimoli per la mente o sul divertirsi, bensì lo consiglierei a chi invece va oltre il videogioco, oltre l'aspetto ludico (similmente a chi per esempio ha apprezzato Abzu).

Voto: 8

31951915.review:
C'est un jeu personnel, d'une grande qualité artistique, faisant honneur à la métaphore, d'une grande fluidité, pas d'allers retours, faites place à l'histoire.

On avance, on admire, nos oreilles sont aussi sollicitées par une très bonne musique d'ambiance, les décors se transforment, se courbent, s’empilent, c'est magique.

Doublez cela avec un peu empathie et vous vivrez une histoire forte.

Il se joue parfaitement au clavier souris.

un jeu avec une finition d'un tel niveau mérite d'être remarqué.

Pour info il a couté 5% d'un budget triple A.

Il est peut-être court (4h) mais il mérite largement cet investissement.

31935595.review:
Ein ergreifendes Spiel mit originellem Setting, einer wirklich guten Story, die fast ganz ohne Dialog auskommt, toller Grafik und noch besserer Musik, das auch von Gelegenheitsspielern prima gemeistert werden kann, weil weder die Rätsel, noch die Mechaniken oder die Geschicklichkeitseinlagen so schwierig sind, dass man an ihnen verzweifelt oder sich nicht mehr auf die Story konzentrieren kann.

Eben diese Story schlägt einige, die ich in letzter Zeit in Walking-Simulators vorgefunden habe - und letztere leben fast ausschließlich von ihrer Story. 'Papo & Yo' mischt geschickt mehrere Elemente und schafft es, diese zu einem perfekten Ganzen zu verbinden.

Grafik und Musik hauchen dem fiktiven, südamerikanischen Setting Leben ein, ohne dabei aufdringlich zu wirken. Die Charaktere sind liebevoll gestaltet, schlicht, aber keinesfalls zweidimensional. Im Gegenteil. Erst, wenn man das 'Papo & Yo' zu Ende gespielt hat, erkennt man die wahre Tiefe des Protagonisten und der anderen "Wesen".

Fazit: 'Papo & Yo' ist ein kleines Juwel, das man in Ruhe genießen sollte, denn dann wird man mit einem Erlebnis belohnt, über das man gerne noch lange sinniert.

31843479.review:
So, I think there's very little new to highlight here about what's good in here. I guess people don't mention how good the soundtrack is often enough, but otherwise it's mostly up to par for indie 3D puzzle platformers. In the spirit of giving you clues as to whether you consider this worth buying full price or discounted, here's a few of the problems:

[list]
[*]In multiple occasions, if you screw up, getting back on track can take a mildly annoying bit of time.
    [*]Two of the puzzles are basically just busywork, with one mechanic repeated N times. At least in one of them you organically unlock further pieces of the puzzle, but the other one feels like mere padding.
[*]More than a bit of potential timewasting in side platforms when you're looking for puzzle solutions.
    [*]One particular achievement is easily missable in the first run, and getting it afterwards adds essentially no new challenge.
[*]There's little reward for side exploration until you've finished the game.
[/list]

So there's that. None of these are dealbreakers in my opinion, but if the story itself doesn't interest you, you may want to look elsewhere to satiate your platforming needs.

31817221.review:
Papo & Yo non è un videogioco, ma è una storia ed il video gioco è solo un mezzo con cui uno degli autori del gioco, Vander Caballero, ha deciso di raccontarci la sua infanzia, segnata da un padre che lui definisce "Mostro". Il gioco può essere classificato come un puzzle game, ma i puzzle da risolvere sono veramente elementari, il gameplay è molto scorrevole e non annoia mai. Graficamente il gioco non offre niente di spettacolare o innovativo, ma in questo tipo di gioco la storia raccontata, naturalmente attraverso una metafora, basta per appassionare il giocatore e tenerlo incollato allo schermo. La longevità è bassina, si finisce tranquillamente in 3-4 ore, ma se si vogliono prendere tutti gli achievement di Steam allora sono necessarie almeno 2 run.

Voto 8/10

31402010.review: Underrated artistic masterpiece. This game explores themes not usually seen in the medium. Of neglect, child abuse, growing up in a broken household. Without spoiling the game, all I can say is that if you like puzzle platformers like Ico, Lost in Shadow, rain, you will definitely enjoy the clever puzzles and magnificent art direction and sound design. This game will make you feel like a child again, with its creative level design and atmosphere. Reinvigorating a sense of awe, wonder and discovery only a kid could have. The game is fairly short and there is not much replay value except for achievements you may have missed on your first run and optional collectibles. It is rough around the edges and doesn't reinvent the genre in a way we haven't seen before, but it is a nice breath of fresh air in a market needing more 3D puzzle platformers. All in all, if you like what you see in the gameplay trailers, this game will definitely not disappoint, as it offers just enough content without overstaying its welcome. The price may be asking for too much, so I recommend waiting for a sale.

31322291.review:
Papo & Yo es un juego indie de plataformas y puzzles que apareció en ps3 en el año 2012 y que posteriormente llegó a Steam en el 2013, obteniendo un gran aceptación y críticas muy positivas debido a su diseño y belleza artística, un argumento serio contado de una forma muy original, una banda sonora increíble y una jugabilidad y mecánicas simples pero muy bien implementadas.

HISTORIA:

El principal aliciente de Papo & Yo es su temática. Encarnamos el papel de Quico, un niño que comienza su aventura escondido en el armario, temeroso por algo que todavía no sabemos y que iremos descubriendo a lo largo de la aventura. Dentro del armario aparece una especie de portal que nos translada  a un lugar mágico, debiendo atravesar situaciones surrealistas y resolver una serie de puzzles.

Al poco de comenzar la aventura Quico se encuentra con su mejor amigo llamado Monster, una bestia de aspecto terrorífico que resulta ser amigable y bonachón. Sin embargo, pronto nos daremos cuenta de que Monster tiene una adicción a comer ranas venenosas, que le provocan cambios en su personalidad y lo vuelven violento y malvado, pudiendo llegar a atacar a sus amigos. Nuestro objetivo es resolver una serie de rompecabezas y encontrar una cura a la adicción de Monster a las ranas venenosas.

La historia está inspirada en experiencias personales del director creativo y creador del videjuego, Vander Caballero, quien retrató su relación con un padre alcohólico y abusivo a través de los personajes de Quico y Monster. La adicción de este último a comer ranas venenosas y su posterior cambio de personalidad es una metáfora de la adicción de su padre al alcohol, y a los abusos que este le propiciaba cuando era pequeño.

JUGABILIDAD:

Se trata de un juego de plataformas: salta de aquí a allá, recoge este objeto, pulsa esta palanca, haz que pueda llegar hasta allí, etc. El control responde perfectamente tanto con mando (probado con el mando de XBOX 360) como con teclado + ratón. Ambas opciones son buenas. Empecé jugándolo con mando pero finalmente he preferido hacerlo con ratón + teclado, más que nada por la comodidad del ratón para poder usar la vista alrededor y disfrutar de toda la belleza del entorno.

El control es algo impreciso a veces, pero en general es bastante cómodo y sencillo de hacerse con él. Hay bastante variedad de puzzles y situaciones, aunque puede llegar a hacerse algo repetitivo.

GRÁFICOS: 

El juego usa el Unreal Engine y la verdad es que luce muy bien. Está bastante bien optimizado y luce mucho mejor que la versión para consolas. Hay algunos pequeños tirones en momentos muy puntuales, sobre todo cuando llegamos a un nuevo checkpoint y el juego hace autoguardado pero no es algo para nada molesto que afecte a la jugabilidad. 

Más que por gráficos, el juego destaca por su bellísimo diseño artístico. Es sin duda otro de los puntos fuertes de Papo & Yo. Tanto en el diseño de los personajes como en los niveles, con favelas muy bien recreadas con diseños imposibles en la realidad, calles plagadas de espectaculares grafittis de artistas reales, efectos gráficos muy bien hechos como los de luz y sombras o el del agua al movernos sobre ella, etc. 

BANDA SONORA: 

Uno de los mejores apartados del juego, sin duda. La banda sonora es INCREÍBLE. Una de las mejores BSO que he escuchado, dan ganas de seguir disfrutándola después de terminar el juego (yo de hecho la estoy escuchando ahora en Spotify, donde está disponible al completo).

Para no extenderme más, os dejo mi lista de pros y contras:

PROS:

- Su originalidad

- La forma de contar algo tan triste y serio como son los abusos, alcoholismo, traumas, etc.

- La banda sonora es sobresaliente (la tenéis disponible en Spotify)

- El mensaje que transmite

- Gráficamente es de una bellísima factura

- El realista efecto del agua

- El original diseño de los niveles

- Es rejugable, puesto que nos obliga a pasárnoslo al menos una vez antes de poder conseguir alguno de los logros

- Traducido al español

- Se controla perfectamente tanto con mando como con teclado + ratón

- El arte callejero es de una belleza increíble, los grafitis de los escenarios es de lo mejor del juego

- Tiene logros Steam

- Tiene sistema de guardado de la partida Steam Cloud

- Se puede encontrar muy barato en las ofertas de Steam


CONTRAS:

- Algunos de los botones de configuración de las opciones gráficas están al revés, cuando crees que los estás activando, en realidad los estás desactivando y puede resultar algo confuso

- Bajadas de framerate (aunque muy puntuales), con tirones al hacer autoguardado en los checkpoints

- Algunos fallos gráficos leves

- Algunas animaciones son muy robóticas

- Control algo impreciso

- Puede hacerse algo repetitivo

- Es bastante corto

- No tiene vibración en el mando (probado con el de XBOX 360)

- Pocos logros

- Quizá pueda resultar demasiado sencillo

- No tiene cromos Steam


CONCLUSIÓN: MUY RECOMENDABLE, siempre que te gusten los plataformas con puzzles y te interese la temática del juego. Solo ya por su diseño artístico y por la forma de tratar un tema tan serio ya merece muchísimo la pena. Imprescindible esperar a comprarlo en épocas de ofertas de Steam, donde se puede encontrar a muy buen precio.


Si mi análisis te ha servido de ayuda o te ha gustado, agradecería que dejaras tu valoración positiva para que pueda leerlo más gente. No dudéis en escribir abajo si tenéis cualquier tipo de duda. ¡Un saludo y gracias por leerme!

L’ho trovata molto originale l’idea delle chiavi a molla che  danno la carica agli oggetti e vederli spostare dove serve, ricordano un po' i giocattoli antichi fatti di latta.
Le varie locazioni sono stupende ricostruite nei particolari,  le case ammassate una sopra l’altra, non da meno i vari murales sembrano  reali con questi colori forti ,le piazze , e le montagne in lontananza, il tutto corredato da una luce calda di un sole che  sta tramontando .
Fa riflettere il finale che non voglio raccontarvi, ma che fa capire qual è l’unico modo per convivere con tutto ciò .
Consigliatissimo , più che un game è un’esperienza di vita veramente vissuta e che ci porta a meditare su quali sono le cose veramente 
importanti nella vita di ogni giorno.

The platforming was just how I like it; impressively responsive and not relying on testing how finicky you can be in testing its parameters but instead putting you in environments that test your nerves instead.
The story was very delicately told and Papo and Yo is far from a Super Mario game in its setting; exchanging cute and colourful for natural tones, abstract, moody and cinematic its very Alice in Wonder Land at times with loads of resonating character it all very surreal. There are some adorable moments; your interaction with chubby big eyed frogs, the hint boxes were the best execution I have seen for giving a hint to players in game, and the characters themselves have much more depth than I am used in any video game.

Papo and Yo is strikingly original at times and if there is one thing the majority of its reviews agree on its that Papo and Yo's strongest point is its a charming and eloquently told story that is of something the medium desperately needs: something to contemplate and something human.

Qu'on soit bien d'accord dès le début : Papo y Yo n'est pas un jeu compliqué, ni difficile. 
Un jeu de plate-forme et d'énigme, à la troisième personne, sur fond d'Unreal Engine. 
L'univers du genre favelas se prête rapidement à l'onirisme et aux délires graphiques enfantins.
Papo y Yo, ça se termine en 5 heures. 

Mais s'il y a une question importante, c'est "Est-ce que je m'achète ce jeu pour y jouer ?"

Ma réponse est simple : OUI.


Parce que c'est beau. 
Parce que l'histoire est poignante.

Parce que l'on se surprend à sourire quand le décor se découpe comme du papier.
Parce que c'est un univers dans lequel on se perd.

Pour le reste, lisez le résumé fait par Steam.

Papo y Yo est un jeu à faire dans sa vie.

30307240.review:
Holy crap.  I was about to give this a thumbs down, but after the ending and the story, I can't possibly do that.  
This game gets an A++ in environment graphic design, atmosphere, and story.  However, it gets a major D- (not quite failing but pretty close) in gameplay, puzzle design, and gameplay mechanics.  
My favorite thing about this game is the incredibly trippy atmosphere and animations.  Seriously: Think of the Doctor Strange movie, except instead of Benedict Cumberbatch you play as a 10 year old boy, and instead of finding medical help for your hand, in this game you find medical help for your pet monster.
The story is simple. You are a boy (quico) who loves two things with all his heart: His pet monster "yo," and his friend robot "lula."  The problem is, Yo is addicted to poisonous frogs, which turn him into a raging fiery demon when he gets them.  The entire story is really cute and happy-go-lucky.  For a while I thought the writers lived in a bubble of happiness and innocence.  But then in the last 10% of the game, it gets dark.  REALLY dark.  I'm talking "Bridge to Terabithia," childhood innocence-turned trauma status.  And not just because of violence or mature themes.  No, I mean this tackles a very real and serious social issue that ruins the lives of millions throughout the world.  You can't see it coming for a while, but when you realize the true "innocence lost" at the ending, it's incredibly harrowing.  I started tearing up.  For anyone who wants to spoil it, the social truth behind the game is: [spoiler] This game is one big metaphor for kids with violently abusive and alcoholic parents. [/spoiler]  
The graphics, by the way, are top-notch, for 2013 and even for 2017.  It takes place in a south american favela-style environment.  The sunshine, shadow, and texturing effects look stunning.  
There's one major flaw with the game, and that's the actual gameplay.  This game really doesn't have any puzzles whatsoever.  It's mainly just "see something that looks weird, go up to it, notice it moves a platform, jump on that platform and repeat."  I think there might have only been one or two times where I actually had to think about what to do and comprehend the situation, which should be a given for every single puzzle in any adequate puzzle game.  They're bland and straightforward.  There even came a point near the end of the game where the solutions *LITERALLY* showed up directly in front of your character as they arose.  That's ridiculous.  The game and its controls run very fluidly, but your movement sometimes feel stiff due to its seeming exception from the laws of physics.  Parkour-esque movement would have been KEY to this game, but it felt more like a literal platform-hopping game.  
In conclusion, lemme repeat my original grading:
Story: A+
Environment: A+
Atmosphere: A
Puzzles: F
Gameplay: D
Graphics: B++

For 15$, I'm shrugging.  It's definitely not worth the money, but I don't think it would disappoint that badly.  I got the game in a massive humble bundle, so it was somewhat free for me (though not technically), so I am not complaining either way.  It took me nearly 4 hours to beat, which is definitely on the much shorter end as others have complained, but I'd say 4 hours is hearty enough for me to feel a little disappointed; but not shocked or ripped off.  It's an "ok" value for the content.
However, if you're one for emotionally gripping stories and innocence-lost narratives (I feel like the vibe of Bridge to Terabithia is actually a very accurate analogy to the emotions I got from this game), this is an absolute golden nugget.

30087220.review:
Papo & Yo is pretty decent puzzle platformer. It is also a very touching tale about a child dealing with an abusive father.

The story is clearly the highlight here. The game deals with a difficult subject matter in an excellent way. Most of the storytelling is done through actual gameplay too instead of long dialogues or endless cutscenes. This is certainly one of the stronger game narratives I have ever experienced.

The South American setting, the art style inspired by magical realism and the great soundtrack are all superb fits for the game too.

The game does have a number of issues, however. The puzzles and the platforming both tend to be on the easy side and the puzzles in particular feel like an extended tutorial for the actual game that never materializes. The game also suffers from a number of minor glitches and bugs.

Despite the somewhat weak gameplay I found Papo & Yo a great and touching experience. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys good stories.

The good:
- Superb story
- Great storytelling
- Fitting art style
- Nice soundtrack

The bad:
- Rather easy
- Little short (I finished the game in little over 3 hours)

The ugly:
- Quite a few bugs and minor glitches

30073868.review: In what might be a controversial opinion, I didn't love Papo & Yo, but could appreciate its message. Particularly the dream like sequences, and dream-infused interpretations of the character's father, his rebirth in an imaginary monster, were standouts. Papo & Yo approaches narrative excellence with its devastating final message, which will no doubt resonate with anyone who has had similar expereinces. An extremely moving, thought provoking game that masks an inordinate amount of pain. Well done.

30056689.review:
Oh man, this game.

This game started off as just a fun ride for me. I liked the puzzles a lot, and the gameplay mechanics. I love how you have to change the world around you to continue. Very good.

Before getting through the game, I got curious as to what the meaning behind the monster is so I looked up the game and found an interview with the man behind the masterpiece.

I've got to say, knowing how he felt, and what he went through made this game a far more emotional experience the entire way through. Maybe it would have felt shocking at the end if I hadn't looked into it first, but knowing the details before really playing it made it hurt me.

There were times when I hated the monster, and times when I loved having the monster around. There were times when the girl annoyed me, and pain when she (for reasons I will not spoil) had to leave. The loss of Lula after just getting her back was so painful I started to tear up. This game devastated my emotions, and was a very real experience for me because my brother has a very similar and real problem (again, don't want to spoil it for readers who haven't played) that so far hasn't been remedied, and much like the Quico I've felt like no matter what I do I can't save him.

Complimented by a beautiful soundtrack, I really felt this game was one of the best I've ever played, guaranteed. 

Really recommend playing it if you haven't, and really look forward to games from Minority in the future.

29895807.review:
Papo & Yo is a puzzle adventure game where you play as a Brazilian boy named Quico, who is hiding from his alcoholic father in the beginning of the game. While hiding in his closet during one of his father's drunken rages, clutching his favorite toy, a robot doll named Lula, Quico discovers a strange chalk mark on the wall, and touching it, finds himself taken to a dream-like world.

The dream world is incredibly whimsical and fascinating, and it turns its Brazilian environments into a dream where Quico can manipulate objects, enter portals, and use special panels. With special panels on objects, he can push, pull, and move objects with ease, moving houses in place and pulling staircases out of houses. Lula also becomes animated and helps guide Quico through the world.

Quico eventually meets a young girl named Alejandra, who doesn't understand him or his intentions, and attempts to slow him with puzzles.

Quico eventually comes across a creature known as Monster, a massively strong beast with razor-sharp teeth. Quico sees it as his friend, although the creature is powerful and has strength unknown to him.

Throughout the game, Quico sometimes has flashbacks of things that have happened, and bad memories of his father. These can be very haunting and sad, but are quite the wake-up call to what addictions can do, and the damage that an addicted parent can do to one's child.

Papo & Yo is an incredible game so far. The game is very whimsical and detailed, and the gameplay so far is quite fun, although certain puzzles can be a bit difficult. Its visuals and graphics are very nice as well, and breathtaking to see. Its exciting and beautiful soundtrack suit the game very well, and I really like how they often kept the theme true to traditional Brazilian music. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who enjoys puzzle games and anyone who enjoys whimsical game worlds. ^.^

29587685.review:
"Tam, gdzie jest nies­pra­wied­li­wość, gdzie jest prze­moc, zakłama­nie, niena­wiść, nie­sza­nowa­nie ludzkiej god­ności, tam bra­kuje miej­sca na miłość, tam bra­kuje miej­sca na ser­ce, na be­zin­te­resow­ność, na wyrzeczenia." - ks. Jerzy Popiełuszko

Papo & Yo, to gra przygodowa z elementami logicznymi. Wcielamy się w chłopca zwanego Quico, który usiłuje znależć sposób na odczarowanie swojego ojca, który zamienił się w bestię. Na jego drodze stanie wiele trudnych zagadek. Bohaterowi będzie towarzyszyć Alejandra ora robocik Lula.
Świat, który przyjdzie nam zwiedzić jest pełen magii. Nieustające zmiany otoczenia, pogody. Jednym pociągnięciem drążka możemy z budynku zrobić schody, czy podzielić nasz świat na pół.
Na wyróżnienie zasługuje również piękna muzyka, która towarzyszy nam przez cały czas. Nadaje ona niezwykłego klimatu.

Potwór, po zjedzieniu żaby, zmnienia się w straszliwą bestię, która pragnie nas dopaść. Nie kontroluje się. Niespodziewanie zjada naszą przyjaciółkę.
W toku gry, chłopiec przypomina sobie najgłębsze wspomnienia. Wspomnienia, które ukazują jego ojca jako egoistę, ojca, który bije i poniża własne dziecko, ojca który ceni sobie alkohol bardziej, niż własnego syna.

Papo & Yo, to produkcja, która niesie za sobą głębsze przesłanie, produkcja, która ukazuje prawdziwe problemy ludzi, produkcja, która skłania do refleksji, dlatego też naprawdę warto przyjrzeć się temu tytułowi bliżej.

29384364.review:
Sometimes, things which are completely unexpected work really well together. For example, peanut butter and jelly (jam). When you think about it, those things couldn't really be any further apart and yet they work very well. Why am I going on about sandwiches? Because Papa & Yo's developers took two very different things, put them into this game and.... found out the hard way that they don't work together.

In short, the concept was to tell a tale about a boy trying to cope with an abusive and drunkern father. Not a bad concept to tackle for a game which attempts to be a bit like Alice in Wonderland, but sadly they chose to make this a very dull and largely uninteresting, uninventive platformer. To begin with, how is platforming considered the best approach to a topic as deep and complex as child abuse? It's like trying to paint the Sistin Chapel mural with a ballpoint pen and call it a masterpiece. For the gamers considering to buy the game let me explain what you are going to be doing in Papa & Yo.

In general, the levels are linear with a clear start and finish. They are actually best described as arenas since they are usually single room puzzles made to look like the shanty towns in southern america. There is some surreal scenary later on which adds some appeal but this Alice in Wonderland-style is only put to good use in a handful of levels, the rest are just dull. It is almost as if there were two level designers, one who was talented and one who was very inexperienced and you have to put up with content from both but the majority is from the inexperienced designer. I don't even think the game could be considered a puzzle-platformer as the 'puzzles' consist of running or jump to a spot and pressing a 'button' then doing this over and over and over. I'm not kidding when I say that you will not be challenged by any of the content in this game. A few twists occour here and there like pushing a trolley with monster sleeping on it to a specific spot.. so that is basically pushing a button too when you think about it. And there are invisible walls everywhere in this game and not to mention that when monster gets mad and throws you around, it is possible to be flung outside of the map and glitch into the void or end up unable to get back into the map again and forced to restart from your last checkpoint. The QA in this game really was terrible at ensuring it was bug free. On the one hand they use invisible walls to stop you walking off a cliff in one part of the map but within the same map on the opposite side you can fall to your doom. Consistancy people!


In the end, Papa & Yo is just a simplistic platformer that attempts to bite off a complex narrative that is unsuited to the style of game used. It's incredibly short (less than 3hrs long) and not very entertaining at all. If you want to have a game with an interesting narrative and some good puzzles then I'd recommend alternatives such as Master Reboot or if you want platforming with storyline I'd highly recommend Contrast. Both of which are very entertaining games with far more duration, quality and content than this junk.

29276795.review:
Papo & Yo è un messaggio, anzi una testimonzianza, dell'autore, veicolato attraverso il linguaggio videoludico di un comune platform 3D basato su enigmi ambientali. Il gameplay, benchè non memorabile, risulta comunque godibile e facilmente accessibile, così come gli enigmi da risolvere dalla difficoltà tutto sommato irrisoria.

Notevole invece il comparto artistico (davvero belli i paesaggi, le ambientazioni simil-favelas, e gli splendidi murales ripresi dal mondo reale) e quello sonoro, con musiche accattivanti che vi proietteranno nel Paese di origine dell'autore.

Riguardo la trama, anch'essa assolutamente lineare, ciò che viene raccontato è il dramma di chi è nato nel posto sbagliato probabilmente. La sottile linea che separa l'amore incondizionato per Mostro e la necessità finale di doverlo lasciare andare. Ho trovato lievemente criptici alcuni passaggi finali, ma in un titolo del genere forse è anche naturale che sia così.

In conclusione Papo & Yo è uno di quei titoli che, a mio avviso, è facile consigliare in quanto raccontano qualcosa che merita di essere ascoltato, diverte (pur senza eccellere sotto questo aspetto) nel farlo, e vi regala una ottima esperienza artistica. Il tutto in una durata estremamente breve (lo si porta a termine in 2-3 ore al massimo, salvo poi rigiocarlo per gli achievements), cosa particolarmente importante per chi, come il sottoscritto, vorrebbe poter giocare i moltissimi titoli in libreria ma ha poco tempo per farlo.

Forse faticherei a consigliarne l'acquisto a prezzo pieno, ma in sconto o in bundle non pensateci un attimo.

29193556.review:
SE PASSA NAS QUEBRADAS DA FAVELA 

10/10 - TUPINIQUIN´S MAGAZINE

29173919.review:
Pros: young black male protagonist, beautiful world to explore inspired by Brazilian favelas, In-game graffiti graphics licensed from real Brazilian street artists, meaningful narrative of addiction, violence, and child abuse. 
Cons: frequent unit clipping, the finicky camera can be frustrating to wrestle with at times when trying to solve a puzzle, a few puzzles were overly tedious and drawn out
Overall: 5/5

From authentic storytelling to delightful puzzles, Papo & Yo does so many things right. An innovative narrative game by Minority Media, Papo & Yo captured my heart and tore it apart. Though the puzzles themselves may not be exceedingly difficult, this is no easy game to play. It puts us in a whimsical world while exploring the emotional depth and complexity of loving and fearing a father who is an abusive addict. 
Set in a fantastical recreation of the favelas of Brazil, this game follows a young, black school boy as he escapes into this magical world. Throughout the game, the environment is adorned with street art licensed from real street artists in South America, placing us in the veritable sublimity of magical realism. Inspired by the lived experiences Vander Caballero (creative director), this game tells a story of survival, imagination, and love. 
The development of this game is inspiring; from the diversity of the team itself, to the shoestring budget, to the heart in getting the characters just right, this game earnestly taps into the power of the video game medium as a highly engaging, emotional, and intimate form of storytelling. Papo & Yo unapologetically makes things personal, painful, and profound.

Story & Characters

In the game, we play as Quico, a young, black boy who escapes from his alcoholic father by running away into a magical, wonderful world full of stacked, boxy buildings and urban oases of fruit and waterfalls. In this world, we meet Alejandra, a master of magic and whimsy, and Lula, our treasured toy come to life. Quico finds mystery and curious puzzles around every corner, but even here, his abusive father haunts him—in the form of Monster. 
Monster is a simple, soft, towering creature that loves the glowing fruits that are found throughout the world. He is easily led around the map, enticed by the giant fruit, and he helps us open doors and portals alike. His fatal flaw is his addiction to poisonous frogs. Whenever he eats a poisonous frog, he is overcome with a fiery rage, transforming this whimsical setting into a hellish nightmare. Metaphor? Check.
As we venture farther and farther into this fantasy, we face the inevitability of destruction that Monster brings and learn to juggle the usefulness, selfishness, and recklessness of his rage. Together, Alejandra and Lula help Quico navigate his complex relationship with fear, care, and hope. 

Violence as a Mechanic for Empathy

When encountering violence in video games, the physicality of violence is often used in a sensational and/or desensitizing way. Beat-em-ups and shooters typically try to make violence fun, funny, and/or repetitively dull. Papo & Yo manages to frame violence differently. This is not a nonviolent game; in fact the violence in Papo & Yo is one of the most gut-wrenching I have ever experienced, even though there is no blood, gore, or kill shots. Still, whenever the enraged Monster attacks and tosses Quico, his screams and ragdoll body convey the most powerless and hopeless feeling that would sink right through my stomach.
Papo & Yo successfully employs violence as a mechanic for empathy by depicting it as inevitable, abusive, and complicated. Instead of awarding acts of violence to the player for shows of power, this game puts the player in the shoes of someone who survives and lives on after acts of violence are committed towards him and his friends. 
Hyper-violent games often claim to be portraying the events and violence of real-world happenings. However, more often than not, this excuse only glorifies and desensitizes the brutal and graphic slaughter of women and people of color, rather than actually shedding a light on the reality and widespread problem of femicide and the dehumanization of black and brown bodies. In contrast, Papo & Yo uses violence to humanize and illustrate the trauma and complexity of abuse. 

Monster

I always have a soft spot for dimensional and well-designed villains. 
Monster is a hard creature to hate. His tall stature makes him physically intimidating, but his sleepy demeanor and warm color tones also make him cuddly and lovable. Cartoonishly bouncing on his tummy is delightful and funny, but each dawning of his fiery drunkenness makes my stomach sink.
It’s also hard to hate him because he’s such a critical part of our success in each puzzle, even though he is also the source of many our problems. One minute, he’s trying to kill us. The next, he saves us from a crushing death when we don’t get a puzzle quite right. The cycles of support, rage, abuse, and calm mimic so closely the experience of living with and loving an abuser. 
Often, in fiction and fantasy, villains are flat caricatures of evil and cruelty. However, in reality, people are rarely so singular. Abusers are often charming, kind, generous, caring, and even vulnerable individuals. After all, they need as many ways as they can to keep their victims attached to them. Positive characteristics never preclude a person’s ability to be manipulative and harmful to others. 
This dimensional portrayal of an amiable abuser successfully captures and brings to life these complicated and entrapping behaviors that are all-too-familiar for survivors. It’s an honest and validating representation, and a rare example of a well-translated metaphor of abuse.

Gameplay & Puzzles

The puzzles in this game are not exceedingly challenging. While solving each puzzle remains satisfying, and interacting with pieces of the world around Quico is enchanting, the logistics of each level are not particularly ingenious. It doesn’t help that the camera is finicky and the frequent clipping of characters sometimes makes it difficult to discern what is and isn’t intentional. A large number of the puzzles can really be distilled down to a lever being pulled here revealing another switch to be turned there. As the game progresses, the puzzles don’t become more difficult—just more tedious. 
And boy were some of these levels tedious. Watching a building or water tank fly into place with cartoonish wings can be delightful only so many times.
For me, the environmental interactivity partly makes up for the repetitive puzzles, and I found the progression of the game to be a worthwhile study of what difficulty can mean in a game. Emotional pressure, as it turns out, is an exceedingly effective way to raise the stakes.
The journey and fulfillment of this game does not come from its puzzle solving. The challenge is not in the puzzle but rather in concentrating on the problem as a fiery Monster chases after Quico and flings his small body mercilessly until we find a way to calm him down. The duration of the game isn’t spent gearing up for a boss battle but rather evolving an understanding of Monster’s condition and fate. 

Conclusion

Papo & Yo reimagines the ways in which a video game can challenge its players, tell stories of pain and love, and create a world of whimsy and light. This game blends magical realism seamlessly into this narrative of abuse, hopelessness, and trauma. How wonderful and natural it is that this game, directed and written by an abuse survivor, with the art of real Brazilian street artists incorporated into its favela-inspired world, developed by a team made up largely of POC and women, would blossom into such a resonant and powerful work of art.

るらしい。

28886745.review:
Papo & Yo é um daqueles games que muitos chamam de psicológicos ou filosóficos. Uma viagem em um mundo criado pela mende de uma criança atormentada, onde seus medos são representados por ummonstro e sua coragem se mostra como amgios em sua jornada. Porém, eu já me decepcionei muito com este estilo de jogo, pois apesar de você ter que interpretar tudo para aproveitar ao máximo a história, esses jogos geralmente são parados, com poucos puzzle e/ou ações que geralmente são chatas ou extremamente difíceis.
Papo & yo surpreendeu ao mostrar que além de apresentar o drama da história, pode sim se ter um jogo com cara de jogo. Onde vc resolve puzzle complexos porém divertidos e que possam te trazer para dentro da história, fazendo uma ligação direta com o psicológico do personagem.
Tecnicamente é um game que demonstra o baixo investimento, mas que consegue superar essa barreira. O gráfico não é nenhuma obra de arte, mas a produtora soube trabalhar com a falta de recurso e apresenta algo, que apesar  de não estar no nível de games AAA, utilizou-se de  um trabalho mais voltado par ao desenho, algo mais fantasioso e muito colorido. 
A jogabilidade não é fluída, mas não chega ao ponto de atrapalhar a diversão, as tais paredes invisíveis existem, o esmero com os detalhes não foi grande, e a camera as vezes se atrapalha. 
Msa todos os defeitos (que ao meu ver não são tão grandes) são facilmente esquecidos pela história (que requer sua atenção para comp´reensão, mas é muito boa) e pela diversão dos puzzles apresentados. Sua curiosidade é grande para saber o que acontecerá a cada nova fase.

28465679.review:
[b][i]"NO QUOTE TO ADD FOR REAL"[/i][/b]

Pretty little indie game from unknown or let me say lesser known developer Minority. They're in making of Time Machine VR Indie that so far looks pretty average however recieved best indie of 2015 E3 award. And how does this indie from 2013 stands out? Even better.

Papo & Yo is basically adventure puzzle jumping running hiding game. Story is about brazilian boy goes by name Quico who is running through the favela, stacking buildings and shacks like puzzle, while hiding and also interacting with the Monster. Lot of people saying that story Vander Caballero created was beautiful but I feel like it was more weak than actually good.

The whole gameplay is really repetetive and always about same thing. Me personally, I didn't really like Quico, I didn't really like his yellow little friend, I didn't even like his girlfiend Alejandra (GF really?) and also I didn't really like the Monster. So what else was any good for me to give it thumbs up? Favela. Puzzle. Music. I like the interacting and manipulating of the buildings and shacks so much, and also whole puzzle concept and the way you make out those puzzles was really good. Music is matter of personal taste so all I'm saying is I've liked that.

The whole game lasts about 2-3 hours depends how you play it, additionaly few minutes if you want to collect all the hats. I did play it through calm and enjoyable way back in 2014 now I've finished speedrun but to be honest it's not that type of indie game you would replay. At least for me.

To sum it up, if you can get it during sale for 2-3 bucks then definitely go for it. If you like soft stories and calm gameplay then also go for it. In the worst case it'll be less enjoyable but certainly it won't be bad.

[b]Bonus Point: Favela[/b]
[h1]Rating: 6/10[/h1]

Papo & Yo ist ein kleines Indiegame, das aber vollkommen begeistern kann. Wie viel Indiegames ist es in einer gewissen Art und Weise besonders. Auch die lustigen Hüte im Spiel die man sammeln kann find ich durchaus nennenswert.
Kurz gesagt ist Papo & YO ein fantasticher Indietitel, der mit ca. 3 std. Spielzeit und reichhaltigem Rätselspaß, sowie Story mit interessantem Bezug einen Abend lang definitiv begeisern kann. Für Fans solcher Titel, unteranderem mich, ein wahres Meisterwerk, den ich jedem empfehlen kann.
