28332596.review:
A very artistic and intereting game. You play the role of Quico, a little brown boy who hides in the closet to avoid the wrath of a raging monster, presumably his father. Metaphorically, the story is about a who escapes into the realm of his imagination to escape the vicissitudes of his life. In his world, his father is a giant monster who loves to eat and sleep. Monster loves his food and is quite amicable until he finds and eats frogs. Once he eats a frog, monster turns into a raging uncontrollable beast.

The game reminds you of Psychonauts and how you enter the dreams of people to save them from their deepest darkest fears. I've yet to finish the game and will add more when I'm done. You will realize that near the end, the game begins to break down and you will see more hastily put together pieces.

My conclusion? Try this game. It is worth it.

[b]PROS[/b]
1. Very Imaginative
I love how the everything was done. So imaginative, especially how you moved the buildings and stairs.

2. The Story
Probably about an abused child, who turns on his abusive alcoholic father who hurt the child's girlfriend and forces the child to kill the father in the end. 

[b]CONS[/b]
1. Repetitive puzzles
Press the gears, turn the key, call Luna, stack the boxes, cut the scissor, toss the fruit. The variety is kind of limited.

2. Repeat of Assets
The last few levels felt cheap. Like the game run out of time and budget and they hastily put together whatever things they could make.

28332334.review: Very light and linear puzzler. A fine storyline, but the gameplay is not an engaging enough wrapper for the plot. Not terrible, but not fantastic.

28322329.review:
Papo & Yo is not the first game developed in the story direction of childhood abuse or parental issues, though it is understandable that people with such experiences want to make stories with that focus.

And that in a sense leaves me feeling uneasy about what I want to say for this game. It is the awkward borderline of judging a game for it being a game, and judging it for the overall intentions.

Now, I know the review began with giving away the premise of the game, but the reason I was fine with doing so is because of an immediate flaw in the game. Within the actual first minute of Papo & Yo, right after starting a New Game, there is a dedication and following scene which give away the game's purpose. That destroys any surprise completely. I definitely think that the game should have been set up differently for an even stronger impact of the parallels/metaphorical world.

Despite that, the game moved along properly story-wise with what the characters represent. And the general events that occur as well as the world's environment are very strong and unique because of how surreal things get. The graphics of the game are mostly well-done, with interesting setup of the favela you traverse, nice color for the world as it morphs around you. Towards the end of the game, some of the physical effects that happened to the map genuinely made me dizzy, which, while not exactly enjoyable, gave me the idea of how strongly I was grounded in the distorted world.

As I said towards the beginning of the review, though, how I want to judge this game is not exactly balanced. Though I became quite invested in Quico (the main character) throughout a short game that took me less than 4 hours, that does not mean that the game was perfect by any means.

In fact, the majority of the flaws were from its technicality as a game. The game is platforming and puzzle-solving. The puzzles as a whole were all extremely easy to find the solution to; but many were made simply annoying due to how you get around as well as the Monster's interactions. For instance, there are some places where the Monster is literally in rage, trying to hurt you, which is understandable for the story. However, due to your limitations, some of the puzzles with that end up taking a long time because the Monster easily catches you, can block your path and throw you around over and over, and so on. It's meant to be a challenge for some of the puzzles, but the ones where Monster is permanently angry tended to waste a lot of my time, instead of making me more sad for the child.

Most of the puzzles for a good chunk of the game require the same repeated actions. Flip a switch here; run somewhere else and flip a few more; return to your original spot and flip the switch back. Grab this item; run away from the monster; throw it somewhere. The game didn't get that unique until some of the extremely surreal areas of the game, or the puzzles that allow you to move or attach favela houses to one another to create bridges and platforms.

The platforming aspects of the game are also rather disappointing and need lots of cleanup. There are a lot of invisible boxes blocking you all over the place. Whenever I was climbing around or jumping across rooftops, for instance, I would very often find Quico hitting some invisible edge of the roof. Despite seeing his whole body being above it all, I would fall down and have to go back around. Or there were certain puzzles where I saw a way to physically reach an object or switch, but there was an invisible box floating in the air, intentionally preventing me from getting there. There's also graphical issues such as clipping, where Quico's body would be inside of a wall or through some object on the ground.

There was also horrendous lag during certain puzzles, and also any time I would enter a new area or a checkpoint occurred. Literally, everything would just freeze up and move choppily for several seconds, until the game got itself together again. The frequency of this was quite bothersome, usually being every handful of minutes.

In the end, there was a lot of disappointment for me in how Papo & Yo was a "game", in its playability. There is lots of frustration with technical glitches and certain bad puzzle layout to the point where it got me angry (which isn't common for me), when it should have only been the story evoking my emotions.

Thus, I am on the fence in how to end this review. The point of the story is not exactly new, though the visual aspects and uniqueness of the world are interesting. The idea of the gameplay using Monster is also intriguing, though there are many issues as mentioned above.

Since there is only a "Yes" or "No" in Steam, I guess I will give "Yes" a slight edge due to the world.

28247260.review:
[quote=商店页简介] Quico 的好朋友 Monster 是一只有着一口剃刀般锋利的牙齿的巨大怪兽，但 Quico 并不害怕他，反而和他玩得很好。然而 Monster 有一个很危险的习惯：嗜吃毒蛙。只要看到有毒蛙跳过，他就会冲过去吃掉它，然后变得异常暴躁。每当这个时候，他身边的所有人都会受到威胁，包括 Quico。不过 Quico 很喜欢 Monster 这位朋友，总是在想方设法拯救他。 
在游戏中，玩家扮演的 Quico 将与 Monster 一起在超现实的魔幻世界中游历冒险，并齐心协力破解迷宫，以此建立并巩固彼此之间的友谊。要想找到治愈并拯救 Monster 的方法，玩家需要学习对 Monster 的各种情绪善加利用，包括温和以及暴躁的情绪。[/quote]
嗯，看这简介，我还以为这是一个很治愈的游戏。果然，我被“治愈”了。

查了一下，关于本游戏的名字，网上有两个翻译，《小巷幻想曲》和《贫民窟历险记》，这两个名字大概都是译者根据游戏具体内容想出来的。不过我觉得其原名papo & yo应该是用的“爸爸与你（papa and you）”的谐音，也真正勾连了游戏背后想表达的含义[spoiler]这款游戏讲的其实反映了一个关于家暴的故事[/spoiler]。
游戏本身是一款解谜冒险游戏，整体上来说谜题的难度是颇低的，游戏流程也偏短，我大概6个小时一周目无攻略通关+二周目对着攻略找齐帽子+刷完成就。虽然内容相对较少，不过价格也是相当便宜，史低7元。不过打折频率貌似不高，上次打折是黑五，再上次是夏促了。

其实刚进入游戏时，我对于主角形象的感觉是相当不舒服的。不过玩了一段时间后也觉得，奔跑在这贫民窟风格的小巷中，这样的主角或许确实颇为合适。而再想想游戏背后想表达的那些东西，顿时觉得这样的主角确实比一个萌妹子或是小帅哥合适多了。
场景与机关的设计确实是有如童话般梦幻，也难怪翻译会为其冠以“幻想曲”的称号；而相对的，这幻想世界与现实的联系、与现实的反差也令人触动。

[h1]不过，虽然认为这游戏值得一玩，但在我个人看来还是有不少缺点的。[/h1]
虽然简介中说着“Quico与Monster是朋友”，但整个游戏进程中，几乎只是主角Quico引导着Monster的全部行动，两者之间除了用柠檬吸引Monster以及Monster吃下毒蛙后，几乎没有任何互动（嗯……某个拔钥匙的关卡中Monster倒是会把差点被墙壁压住的Quico救上来）。或许是为了在之后展现出的现实关系做铺垫，但是感觉上……你们毕竟写了这么个简介不是么，结果他们之间完全没有互动？
其次就在于幻想世界与现实的对应。一切几乎全部只是在最后一章揭示的（当然，在前面的内容中也或多或少有所暗示了），但感觉上结局的瞬间翻转还是显得略为突兀与平淡。或许就像我上一点提到的，Quico和Monster两者之间缺乏互动，他们原本的“朋友”身份仿佛只是停留在设定上，而其作为反派的给人的感觉也只停留在暴怒状态下干掉了另外两个伙伴；另一方面则来自于前面的内容在看到最后一章前也很难看出其对应的含义。这样的结果，导致的是即使在揭露了幻想世界对应的真实含义时，也并未对我产生太大的触动。
（PS：其实每个人的感动点都有所不同，就像有些触动我的故事会有人觉得“根本不催泪嘛”，这部作品的这一表现或许能触动很多人，但我写评测的原则一向是：我只跟从我自己的感受。）
第三点的话，我个人其实觉得这游戏的结局算是烂尾：我觉得这款游戏的结局可以说是强行Bad End。“没有治愈Monster的办法，只有让他走（大意如此）”。当看到了现实的真相后，明明在旅途中已经共同走过了无数谜题，即使在小机器人被失控的Monster毁掉的时候也依旧决定带着Monster继续走的Quico瞬间放弃了他，然后直接把Monster干掉了！干！掉！了！
老实说我确实可以找出一些理由。或许在之前的梦境里Quico还能欺骗自己说或许有治愈Monster的办法，直到他发现梦境就是现实的衍伸；家暴的压力即使在幻想的世界也会以另一种形式展现出来，于是Quico对于“治愈”父亲彻底绝望。但很可惜，这些理由无法说服我自己。Monster在梦境中的行为与Quico在现实中的经历其实没有多少区别，准确来说就是其现实中经历的映射；当然我们或许可以认为Quico对Monster的愤怒（或者是仇恨什么的）是在不断累积的；但无论如何，这个结局与其说是让我感到“致郁”，不如说是喂屎。
（呃，其实说实话，也没有喂屎那么严重。而且略作思考后，我觉得若是结局改为成功治愈了Monster后幸福快乐的生活在了一起，烂尾程度更是高得多。或许这个结局不算那么差，但我依旧觉得和游戏的整体素质相比，这个结尾实在是有些差劲。）

感觉大半篇都在讲我眼中这款游戏的缺点啊23333。但说回来，我还是认为这款游戏是十分优秀的。以上的缺点与其说是批评，不如说更接近于对于这款游戏没能更好的调动起我的情绪的一点小抱怨。总体上来讲，这款游戏称得上是佳作，尤其是在打折时价格还能降到7元的低价。无论是谜题还是关卡、场景，都远超这个价值。而且从评测的整体上来看，大部分玩家也都是很欣赏其剧情的。
（其实刨去结局，前面的故事也称得上一波三折，流程虽短，却也足以令我满意。但老实说大家都看得出来，结合了结局，这个故事才算有了核心，而因为我对于结局的不满以及认为这个结局插入的颇为生硬，我反而要为其剧情略作扣分。但还是那句话：我的评测全都是个人看法。）

总评价：佳作；若是在打折时入手，绝对的物超所值；原价购买也能算物有所值。

28080077.review:
There are some games that I consider both entertainment and art. Papo and Yo is one of those games. I was researching short games that I could complete in a relatively short amount of time. This game came up during my search, and I happened to own it from a previous Humble Bundle purchase. I decided to install without having any idea what the game was really about  aside from it being a metaphor for the creator's troubled childhood. I found that as I began playing I couldn't put it down, and I didn't exactly know why. This review is a summary of why I believe I kept playing and why you may find yourself wanting to give this game a try:

Graphics:

Created with the Unreal engine, the game looks good. The graphics aren't amazing in comparison to some other games created with the same engine, but they serve the purpose well and draw you into the South American inspired world.

Sound:

This is a soundtrack that I would purchase and listen to over and over. You will get lost in the atmospheric tracks as you guide Quico on his journey. Even if you decide not to play the game at least go listen to the music! You won't regret it.

Controls:

I used an XBOX 360 controller to play. Not much to say here. Controls are simple and the world easy to navigate. There's a basic jump and float mechanic that you will find yourself using throughout most of the game making the game feel somewhat like a 3-D platformer at times.

Story:

*Minor spoilers ahead*

This is where the game's primary focus lies. The game tells a dark tale of a boy and his relationship with his alcoholic father. The story evoked a wide range of emotions from me as I played. I felt myself smiling at times, but there was one moment in particular I remember. It was when the monster ate a frog for the first time, and it evoked some genuine fear and panic in me. I won't say much more than that in order to avoid any major spoilers, but the game does a great job of telling the emotional story that the game's creator set out to tell and bringing you (the player) along for the ride. 

Puzzles:

I made this a category, because this game is technically a puzzle game. I found the puzzles to be fairly simple with only one or two that made me have to give any thought aso to how I would solve them. I was ok with the simplicity, because the game really is more about the story than it is about solving puzzles. However, if you are a player looking for deep puzzles and gameplay, then Papo and Yo may not meet your expectations in these areas.

Overall experience:

I genuinely enjoyed playing Papo and Yo. While it may not be the type of game that I'd typically find myself playing, I was pleasantly surprised how it drew me in and kept me engaged until the very end. While the story may not be the happiest story, I felt the ending fit the tale well and didn't leave me unsatisfied. The game's soundtrack also delivered, and will be one I listen to periodically when I'm in the mood for a great game soundtrack. The graphics and puzzles aren't the strongest, but they didn't detract from my experience at all. I recommend you give this game a shot! You might end up being just as surprised as I was!

TLDR;

I recommend you play Papo and Yo for the story and soundtrack, but don't come for the puzzles or any deep gameplay.

28009315.review:
Voy a escribir de un videojuego que fue publicado en el 2012 por la empresa Minority y diseñado por Vander Caballero y que recién el domingo lo termine, su nombre "Papo & Yo".  Un videojuego que gano muchos premios y muchos fans en el mundo entero por que Papo & Yo realmente es un arte surrealista con un mensaje denso y común en nuestra sociedad. Aquí mi experiencia de juego.

El videojuego

Para empezar, Vander Caballero diseño Papo & Yo basándose en su experiencia personal cuando era un niño y era vejado por su padre. Así pues, manejaremos a un niño llamado Quico en un mundo surrealista lleno de favelas para tratar de curar a Papo, un monstruo dormilón que gusta de comer y que cambia de temperamento (Su padre).



Papo & Yo es un videojuego de aventura con elementos fuertes de rompecabezas y para resolverlos debemos trabajar con Papo y con un robot llamado Lula. También estará una niña llamada Alejandra que nos guiará por el mundo para llegar al Shaman que posee la cura que quitara toda la ira del monstruo.

El modo de juego es con una visión en tercera persona que le falta un poco de trabajo porque la cámara se colocará en posiciones que dificultan demasiado la visión de nuestro personaje. Correr a ciegas mientras Papo te persigue es una pesadilla.



Papo es un monstruo muy tranquilo y amable que cambiará de actitud cuando coma una rana venenosa, cuando esto ocurre Papo se torna en llamas y el mundo se torna rojo, aquí debemos huir de él hasta conseguir una fruta podrida que calmará a Papo.

Quico fue no puede morir, un elemento añadido por Caballero porque él piensa que morir puede arruinar el juego para los jugadores, lo que no sabe es que uno se frustra mucho cuando Papo molesto te lanza por los aires muy seguido.



Sin embargo Papo & Yo es una maravilla artística, el surrealismo se vive en cada objeto que manipulemos, algunos creados con tiza y lo más especial, interactuar con las favelas es demasiado sorprendente. El final es algo que me sorprendió de grata manera, no me lo esperaba. Llegarás al final muy rápidamente ya que el videojuego es corto, en cuatro horas lo habrás pasado.

El apartado gráfico

El motor de Unreal se hace presente en el videojuego que deja ver algunas costuras (como superposiciones de favelas, Quico caminando sin tocar el suelo, etc.), el apesto es sobrio y lóbrego dominado por el color marrón a Dios gracias de hermosos murales llenos de color. Algunas tomas de cámara son geniales y puedes quedar atrapado por sus belleza.



El apartado sonoro

De lo mejor de Papo & Yo, el sonido aunque repetitivo no llega a molestar en lo absoluto y es ayudado por la magistral composición musical que aporta Brian D'Oliveira, D'Oliveira busco en todo momento incluir en sus composiciones varios instrumentos de tal manera que la música fuera familiar y a la vez fuera de este mundo. Una delicia auditiva.

Conclusión

Muy pocos videojuegos son como Papo & Yo, donde prevalece la historia y el arte para contarlo dentro de un tiempo de juego razonable. Los rompecabezas no son un reto ya que lo que busca Caballero es contar una historia. Una historia que no es difícil conectarse con ella (en mi caso me identifique con Quico porque viví lo mismo). Recomiendo jugar Papo & Yo para los que no lo han jugado, verán algo muy diferente. El final te sorprenderá.

27716921.review:
Le jeu type où j'aimerai une option plus neutre que recommander ou non. Derrière cet aspect enfantin, Papo & Yo nous raconte un drame familial très imagé. Rien que pour son thème, il est à recommander aux amateurs d'oeuvres plutôt "oniriques". Pour les autres, je reste plus sceptique.

Les plus :
[list]
[*]son thème original et bien imagé
[*]une ambiance (esthétique & musicale) réussie
[/list]

Les moins :
[list]
[*]un gameplay un peu imprécis
[*]des petits bugs de collision pas gênants mais qui nuisent un peu à l'effort artistique à mon sens (un ballon de foot, quand je rentre dedans il bouge voire je peux tomber, je ne passe pas au travers... pourquoi mettre des ballons en plein milieu s'ils ne sont pas gérés techniquement !?)
[*]des énigmes bien trop simples... dommage ça aurait pu allonger un peu le temps de jeu
[*]très court (4h sans se presser)
[*]trop linéaire, aucun challenge... on regarderait une vidéo, ça ne changerait pas tellement l'expérience
[*]une narration peut-être un peu trop absente
[*]je ne suis pas sûr d'adhérer à la conclusion... [spoiler](ça a beau être une histoire personnelle, terminer le jeu en disant qu'il n'y a pas de remède, je trouve ça assez pessimiste et pas forcément véridique dans certains cas... une mention "'inspiré d'une histoire vraie" dans le menu permettrait de rappeler qu'il s'agit d'une conclusion personnelle, propre à l'histoire vécue et non une conclusion "universelle"... mais ça reste mon avis.)[/spoiler]
[/list]

Je l'avais acheté en solde, donc pour le prix je ne regrette pas mon achat ; ça reste une expérience intéressante. Par contre, au prix fort... pour 4h de jeu et un résultat qui n'est pas exceptionnel.... je ne me précipiterai pas dessus.

27652435.review:
Lembra um pouco The Last Guardian e Ori and the Blind Forest, porém com puzzles bem tranquilos e uma ótima trilha sonora para acompanhar a receita. A história não é envolvente e nem apresenta reviravoltas ou coisa do tipo, mas seus personagens mesmo falando o mínimo possível mostram um carisma excepcional e isso é um dos pontos mais fortes do jogo. Infelizmente a campanha é curtissima, levei pouco mais de duas horas para finalizar o jogo, o que deixa muito a desejar. Outra coisa que deve ser levada em conta em conta é o fato dos seus puzzles serem muito simples, por isso acredito que não seja a melhor escolha para jogadores que buscam desafios e dificuldade.

Mesmo pecando em diversos aspectos, Papo & Yo é um game muito bonito, com um gameplay interessante e mecânicas um pouco inovadoras, seus puzzles são fáceis porém bem inteligentes e por isso eu recomendo sua compra.

26745948.review:
Super organic use-switches-to-move-blocks puzzler (this is a serious over-simplification) that is a metaphor for a man's story of how he dealt with a troubled childhood. The clue is in the dedication right at the start of the game. I don't want to explain too much about what is actually going on with this game because it takes the form of a "reveal" story that you see more of as it progresses. I can only say that the game mechanics and asthetics are very original and unique and that you feel a sense of wonder from the start. I would recommend it purely on merit of its originality but aside from that it's actually fun to play and thoroughly absorbing. If you are on the fence about getting it I would suggest a very quick look at a let's play or just someone who is playing it to see how interesting the mechanics are but, of course, it would be better if you don't resort to this and just jump in and experience it firsthand.

*edit* in fact you can see some of how it works on its store page videos - which I luckilly didn't look at until after I played the game.

26732032.review:
Die Idee hinter Papo & Yo bekommt meine vollste Beachtung. Ich finde es von dem Entwickler sehr mutig diesem Thema ein Spiel zu widmen. Ich hoffe auch, dass er während der Entwicklung ein bisschen von seiner Kindheit für sich selbst verarbeiten konnte.

Das Spiel an sich kann ich leider trotzdem nicht empfehlen. Das Gameplay sowie die Steuerung lösten bei mir meist nur Wut aus. Fast alle Rätsel empfand ich als unlogisch. Fast nie kann man vorher erkennen welche Auswirkungen es haben wird, wenn man mit dem Spiel auf irgendeine Art und Weise interagiert. Falls dies die Hilfslosigkeit gegenüber Alkoholsüchtigen darstellen soll, kann ich dies akzeptieren. Das es aber immer nur eine Lösung für eine Situation gibt verstehe ich dann trotzdem nicht.

Immerhin hat das Spiel ein grandioses und gut inszeniertes Ende.

3/5

26723408.review:
TL;DR A nice atmospheric game but the simplistic puzzle-work and paper-thin storyline leaves a lot to be desired. Still kinda glitchy on *nix too, nothing gamebreaking though.
---
Overall if you don't want to think too hard and play a very linear game that'll handhold you through most all puzzles then this game is for you. The enviroments and the music are nice but the gameplay is pretty lacking. Nothing really novel here in story or gameplay best as I can tell. From a performance point of view things run mostly OK on *nix, it does hitch pretty badly at times and the lighting effects can look a bit iffy at times but overall nothing gamebreaking. My biggest nitpick is that despite the large environments there really isn't any incentive to explore from what I can tell. Sure you can look around and see stuff but short of exploring a fairly unpopulated, albeit beautiful, environment for the sake of exploration I don't see much to hold me. From what I've seen this game isn't worth an evening of my time.

26718928.review:
Gyerek főhősünk egy lepukkant latin amerikai gettóban bóklászik, amikor megpillantja barátját, ki éppen alszik. Barátja történetesen egy nála többször nagyobb szörny. A barátságukat csak egyetlen dolog szakíthatja meg, ez pedig amikor a szörny kollega elkezd fincsi mérges békákat falni. Ilyenkor megőrül, és kis főhősünk ellen fordul. A srác úgy dönt, hogy eljuttatja a szörnyét a sámánhoz, hogy kigyógyítsa a mérgesbéka evészetből.

Senkit ne tévesszen meg a szép játék grafika, vagy a sok hülye aki a történetet isteníti a review szekcióban. A játéknak nincs története. Az egész egy gyengére sikerült metafóra, amit most nem lőnék le. Menni kell előre és kallantyúkat nyomogatni, hogy feljussunk magasabb helyekre, hogy ott is kallantyúkat tudjunk nyomogatni. Megint egy olyan játék a steam könyvtáramban, ami kisgyerekenek szól, mégis mondanivalója komolyabb akar lenni, valamint érdekes módon spanyolul makognak benne.

A játék igazából nem rossz, de mint ahogy sokan írták, nagyon felejthető. Maga a látványvilág egyébként egyéni és jól kigondolt, de talán több jót nem tudok felhozni a javára. Most az a rész jön amikor azt mondom, hogy "tudom ajánlani az apukáknak hogy a poronty ezzel játszon otthon", de mivel a játék nem gameplay-el magyaráz, hanem sima leírással, ezért nem egy kifejezetten nyerő ötlet.

4/10 megbuggyant kókuszgolyó.

26613790.review:
While Papo & Yo is far from being great, it's unique and interesting enough to be worth checking out. I wouldn't recommend it to everyone though, it's better to know what kind of game you're getting into.

Plot-wise, it tackles a difficult subject very rarely seen in videogames. I'm not an expert, but to me it was portrayed very nicely and what's important was actually tied into the gameplay - a big plus right there. Another positive was the ending. It was quite surprising and to me, much more moving than the kind of conclusion you expect throughout the game. Where the game really shines for me are the visuals. The base of the game is pretty enough, but when you begin to bend the world to your will you come across some really nice things going on. It's probably one of the best applications of blending the reality with fantastic elements that I ever saw. 

Unfortunately, what lets the game down somewhat is the gameplay. There simply isn't much to do in the game - in theory it's a blend of platforming and light third-person puzzles, but neither of the elements really works. Platforming is very basic and frustrating because of being unprecise. The puzzles rarely demand any real thinking and in most cases come down to just activating whatever switches you can get to at the time. What's worse, some are quite dragged out and become a real chore to do. There is no challenge at any point of the game, the levels become more complicated but don't get any less dull. The game could use some more variety but it becomes a minor complaint when you compare it to the bigger problems. 

I could see Papo & Yo aiming to be a relaxing, easy game (at the same time with some important things to say) but to me, it became just a bit too frustrating in the end. That's not to say I didn't like it - one bad aspect doesn't have to ruin the whole game. Judging by the positive reviews the game has its crowd, so I would partially blame my own attitude for my disappointments. If you're coming with the right approach, you could be in for some great time with this game.

26588273.review:
I have always been a fan of single player action/advntures and allegories, so as you can imagine I love this game. The puzzles are unique and the environmental design is creative and functional.
The graphics don't look triple-A obviously, but graphics have never bee a huge facotr for me. I only mention this because I know they could be a bit of a turn off for some people. I'd take a low-budget 3D title over another damn 16-bit sidescroller 8 times out of 10. Don't get me wrong though, that's not to say that the *visuals* aren't great. The environments are pretty and the animation is fluid and cartoony. It looks great, that's all I have to say about that. 
The other great thing I have to say about this game is that the sound design accompanies it perfect;y. It mostly consists of panflutes and other woodwind instruments with plenty of accompanying chorus in what I can only assume is Brazillian Portuguese. It sounds really good.
I only have 2 big complaints, and those are the length and replayability. The game is definitely under 5 hours at the longest (as you can see from my profile) and there's little to nothing to do after beating it. I know length isn't indicative of a bad game it's just something to keep in mind while buying. I still think it's worth a buy, I'd just suggest waiting for a sale (like all steam games). The only replayability to speak of AFAIK is this achievement for collecting all the hats that appear on the doll things after you beat thefirst playthrough (?) or something along those lines. 
The last thing I think needs addressing is that I think the metaphor is a little overpushed sometimes. Like yeah, I got it immediately, you don't have to keep making it more and more obvious every hour.
Great puzzle game, reccomended.

26070817.review:
Papo & Yo est inspiré de l'enfance du directeur créatif de Minority, Vander Caballero. Une enfance qui au vu du sujet et du jeu n'a pas été toute blanche. Il y a dû avoir pas mal de hauts et de bas, tout comme ce jeu d'ailleurs. Le studio prend le parti risqué de traiter d'un sujet fort et engagé dans un jeu de plate forme au gameplay trop convenu et classique. L'enfance maltraitée, le père alcoolique et qui bat ses enfants, voilà un sujet pas vraiment facile à évoquer et à mettre en scène. Et sur ce point les developpeurs ont réussi ce qu'ils ont entreprits, toucher le joueur et le sensibilisé à ces drames familiaux qui se jouent chaque jour. On incarne donc un jeune enfant victime de tout cela qui se réfugie dans un monde imaginaire pour essayer d'échapper à la terrible réalité. Chaque personnage, chaque action, chaque dialogue a donc une signification particulière qui finalement est assez explicite pour dénoncer. La force du jeu réside donc dans son sujet et le traitement de celui-ci qui capte l'attention et implique directement le joueur. Le cadre est aussi peu souvent exploité car l'aventure se déroule dans les favelas brésilienne. Bidonvilles et dépotoirs renforcent aussi l'empathie que l'on fini par eprouver pour le jeune Quico. Cet univers se retrouve sublimé par des musiques aux couleurs locales justes magnifiques qui enchantent les oreilles. 
Après avoir énnoncé tout ces points positifs malheureusement il faut aussi parler de son côté obscur. Malheureusement même si le jeu à eu droit à un relfting pour sa version pc il reste faible techniquement, les graphismes et l'animation n'est pas vraiment géniale mais tout cela reste correct. Le plus gros point noir ici et non des moindre dans un jeu vidéo est le gameplay. En effet, le problème est qu'il est beaucoup trop basique et simpliste pour accrocher et captiver. Il y a des moments où l'on s'ennuie, courir, sauter, activer un mécanisme, bref rien de bien passionnant. Le thème est toujours là en revanche pour nous forcer à continuer. Et ce ne sont pas non plus les énigmes bien trop faciles qui vont nous aider à relever notre intérêt pour le gameplay. Trop faciles mais qui gardent une touche d'imagination bienvenue. Finalement le jeu s'avère très court et pour obtenir les 100% niveau succès demande de retourner dans sa partie pour obtenir 25 chapeaux différents (la plupart ridicules d'ailleurs) qui n'ont pas du tout d'intérêt. Vraiment dommage car on repère les endroits où récupéré ces chapeaux lors du premier run mais ils n'apparaissent qu'après la fin du jeu. Une idée surement juste faite pour rallonger d'une petite heure la durée de vie du jeu. 

En définitive, sur le fond le jeu brille vraiment par son sujet, son enrobage émotif et ses musiques mais pèche vraiment dans la forme par son gameplay trop simpliste, ses enigmes trop faciles et sa courte durée de vie. Voter en mettant un "pouce oui" ou un "pouce non" pour un tel jeu n'est pas suffisant, il en faudrait un entre les dit qui dirait jeu moyen mais avec de bonnes idées. Car c'est ce que Papo & Yo est réellement et il vaudrait un 13 ou 14/20 si on voulait le noter. Alors pour ses points positifs et son sujet il mérite un pouce vers le haut mais ses points négatifs pourraient en ennuyer et en rebuter plus d'un.

25354622.review:
What a charming little game.

I honestly had no idea that there was a game that existed called "Papo & Yo" on Steam, until I saw the extended art games list on Wikipedia. And the premise intrigued me. And, for the most part, this game did not fail to disappoint.

Papo and Yo tells the story of a young boy named Quico, who lives in a world of his imagination with his best friend Lula, a flying robot, his other friend Alejandra, a teleporting girl, and the Monster. The Monster is the obvious focus of the game, as you're introduced to him very quickly on and spend the majority of the game with him.

I picked up pretty quickly that the Monster represents something very personal to the developer of the game. I won't spoil what it means, but it is some pretty obvious symbolism. However, that plays excellently in a very touching, mature, and ultimately satisfying ending.

The Monster has a terrible addiction to frogs that make him angry and want to injure whatever- or whoever- is near him. But when he's calm, he can actually be helpful for you to figure out how to get to the end of a level.

I like that Papo & Yo doesn't outright say, "THIS IS WHAT THIS MEANS!"... well, until the very end, if any of you who didn't pick up on the representations being made needed a clue-in.

Along with that, another complaint I have with the game is that it feels very easy. Like you're just being strung along a path with various challenges thrown in. Even when the Monster gets fiery and chases you, the worst thing he does is just toss you in the air- which is only frustrating at worst.

The game also has a few bugs here and there that made me have to quit the game and restart it. One was where Monster wouldn't follow me down a path, another was where the camera got locked in an angle and wouldn't get unstuck, and another was where a blue coconut was still in an area I had been in before... and I used it to calm down Monster at the end... which makes no sense when you see the rest of the story unfold.

However, what problems I had with the game didn't stop me from being charmed by it. This is an enjoyable game with a surprisingly symbolic and touching story about growing up and letting go of your past. I'm giving Papo and Yo a solid 8/10. It's a definite must-play.

24637395.review:
Papo y Yo, un juego que me llamó la atención en un primer momento por la ambientación que traía consigo, unos escenarios que pocas veces se habían visto antes en los videojuegos. Pero encierra muchas más cosas en su interior.

Llama la atención que la historia relata pasajes autobiográficos de su autor, Vander Caballero; a pesar de la apariencia infantil del juego y sus personajes, el trasfondo es durísimo, la historia solo es apta para público adulto, pues en ella se realiza una metáfora de las consecuencias que conlleva la adicción al alcohol por parte de uno de los personajes, y como el resto sufre de forma directa todo el mal que encierra dicha adicción, hay momentos muy duros dentro del juego, todo elaborado de forma metafórica pero en las cuales si seguimos con interés nos daremos cuenta de qué representa cada elemento. Mucha simbología en todo lo representado en el juego. Exige complicidad aunque a veces puedan existir momentos decepcionantes en la historia.

El juego en sí, se trata de un plataformas en el que manejaremos al pequeño Quico a través de diversos escenarios por el entorno de las favelas brasileñas, nuestro objetivo es acabar con el monstruo (Papo) completando niveles entrelazados. La recreación de los lugares es magnífica, el colorido propuesto en el juego, contrastando con zonas de tonos más oscuros que dan mayor énfasis a la historia, pero todo un conglomerado muy disfrutable para la vista. Las plataformas son sencillas de superar en su mayoría, pero otro de los elementos diferenciadores en el juego será el de los puzzles, originales, los escenarios cobran vida a base de palancas y acciones que realicemos; las casas se desplazan, los entornos parecen animales..., no son en cualquier caso de dificultad alta, aunque ganan en complejidad según avancemos en el juego, pero no llegarán a frustrar, aquí lo que se pretende es disfrutar de la historia. Esto es un arma de doble filo puesto que el juego se hará excesivamente corto cuando lo terminemos.

Sólo hay cuatro personajes en todo el juego, Quico, el pequeño al que manejamos, se mueve con fluidez, sin florituras, Lula, un robot que nos ayuda a acceder a lugares alejados, Papo, que ayuda/entorpece en nuestra labor y Alexandra, nuestra guía, la representación de estos caracteres es normal, con no demasiadas texturas pero movimientos fluidos. El juego sólo ofrece una posible ruta en todas las fases y encontrarla es cuestión de minutos, además de saber lo que se debe hacer a continuación, para los menos entusiastas incluso incluye unas cajas de sugerencias que ayudan, totalmente innecesarias para cualquier jugador curtido.

Un elemento que destaca bastante en el juego es el apartado sonoro, los sonidos son de alta calidad y las voces de los personajes se encuentran en portugués, para no desentonar con la trama. Además la selección de melodías es exquisita, con suaves músicas tropicales que cambian según la situación que estemos viviendo en el juego, todas ellas muy agradables y con amplia selección de instrumentos.

Se trata de un juego que podría haber dado mucho más de sí pues el concepto historia-puzzles es genial, pero se hace excesivamente corto, dura escasas horas, y los puzzles no suponen un desafío a pesar del enorme potencial que habían creado con la mecánica del juego. La historia sí es muy buena y el juego entretenido, pero aportando mayor ambición nos hubiera quedado por delante una obra maestra, se queda en un título curioso con gran trasfondo.

NOTA 7´5/10

24520735.review:
Papo y Yo was a game that came out a while ago that I only now got around to playing despite having it since it came out on Steam. I'd been intrigued by it from the time the creator started talking about it, and interviews I saw on Giantbomb years ago now. The themes of an abusive father and alcoholism are things I am all to familiar with and so I found it intriguing that the creator wanted it to be the cruxt of the game.

Unfortunately, as a game, there is really only one mechanic. It's a really cool mechanic, but there's only one. Terrain deformation. Basically you play Quico, a young boy, and you have to traverse this surrealist world to unfold a story. You move around buildings, change the terrain, create stepoping stones, all in the name of... fairly typical platforming. The game is very easy and never really gets difficult at all.

Since this is the only mechanic there isn't really a time you should get stuck and even if you do it won't be for very long. The puzzles are super simplistic.

Graphically the game is amazing. I have nothing, but praise for the visuals crafted for this adventure. The aspects of moving houses, terrain that bites down like teeth, or even just the backdrop of what appears to be Brazilian streets are all splendidly realized. Even the beautifully crafted murals which serve no purpose, but to make areas look cool. The one good thing I can say about this game is that it looks amazing. 

But a video game is not bought just to look at it. We want to experience it, and in that Papo y Yo fails entirely to create a worthwhile experience. As said previously mechanically the game has little to offer, and while novel for an hour or so it quickly wears thin. On top of that the story is abominable. In parts it's incredibly hamfisted- catering mostly to visual metaphor (the game is never explicit and yet is always entirely implicit) it's never not obvious what the story is talking about, and that is fine. Yet the way it gets to what I would assume is it's moral is entirely questionable and not something I agree with at all. It's telling that you play a child as the platitude at the end is comepletely childish.

-Spoiler for the ending. Do not read further if you don't want to know.-

I understand being abused as a child, and having a father who is an alcoholic, but to imply that there is nothing you can do about it, and you should just let them go forever is something you believe when you are a child but is not actually true. That's called giving up, and where I come from you never give up on family.

There are many other aspects of the story I found completely nonsensical: such as monster as it is represented- a visual representation of his father- makes absolutely no sense. I am unsure if the creator understands how people work. There is always a reason people do bad things. They don't just do things. Anyway, I won't continue to go on and on about the creator of this game's world view. I wouldn't recommend believing it, though, as it's a good way to become everything you hate.

I like the visuals in this game. They are often gorgeous, surreal, and amazing to see. Everything else in this game is completely skippable- right down to the terrible moral espoused at the end here. I do not recommend this game at all. If you want to see the cool visuals you can most likely look up pictures of the game and get the same effect. There's nothing else to experience here.

24332579.review:
Segnatevi questo titolo e giocatelo se non lo avete ancora fatto, perché siamo di fronte ad un punto critico e di non ritorno per l'evoluzione dell'arte videoludica. Per la prima volta un videogioco viene prodotto e sviluppato attorno alla drammatica esperienza autobiografica del game designer, che dischiude al pubblico la sua sfera esistenziale e più intima. Vander Caballero è il nome di questo pioniere, coulombiano di nascita ma già in giro per il mondo a 18 anni per scappare dal padre alcolizzato e violento. Approderà dapprima in Italia e poi a Montreal in Canada dove lavorerà come game developer per il colosso EA, mettendo mano a titoli del calibro di FIFA e Army Of Two; fin quando non sentirà la necessità di sviluppare in proprio videogiochi pensati per un pubblico più adulto. 

In numerose interviste Vander esprime la sua insoddisfazione per il mercato dei giochi tripla A orientato ad un pubblico adolescenziale con i suoi triti e ritriti spara e ammazza. Egli rammenta come i videogiochi lo abbiano salvato dalla sua drammatica infanzia, in quanto trovò rifugio e sollievo nella loro dimensione fantastica. Ricorda in particolare i titoli di Miyamoto (il creatore di Super Mario e Zelda) e Fumito Ueda (ICO e Shadow of the Colossus). Più avanti negli anni, Caballero si chiese se i videogiochi avessero da offrirgli qualcosa anche da adulto, visto che non riusciva più a prendere parte alla maggior parte dei titoli sul mercato, costruiti su misura per un pubblico adolescenziale. Il cinema, afferma Caballero, è capace di offrire molto sia ad un pubblico maturo che di ragazzi, perché i videogiochi non dovrebbero fare altrettanto? Da qui lo stimolo a mettersi in proprio e aprire il piccolo studio indipendente Minority Media. 
Egli sentiva il bisogno di  trovare una metafora adeguata a sublimare in un videogioco la sua difficile infanzia a contatto con quel mostro che era il proprio padre alcolizzato. Papo & Yo, distribuito inizialmente come esclusiva PS3 con l'aiuto della Sony, è il risultato di questa ricerca.

SPOILER ALERT!

Il gioco inizia con un  bambino di colore, Quico, nascosto in uno sgabuzzino per sfuggire ad una presenza minacciosa di cui vediamo per un attimo l'enorme ombra e udiamo gli spaventosi passi e grugniti. Una dedica iniziale recita: << A mia madre, a mio fratello e alle mie sorelle con affetto, con i quali sono sopravvissuto al mostro che risiede in mio padre >>. 
Una spirale luminosa appare sul muro di fronte a noi; lo attraversiamo per ritrovarci dall'altra parte sulla strada. Siamo in una delle tante baraccopoli sudamericane, le così dette favelas. Una bambina in lontananza fugge disegnando altri simboli luminosi su una parete; impareremo a starle dietro interagendo con meccanismi luminosi disegnati sulle pareti delle baracche, che a loro volta attiveranno scale e percorsi luminosi che ci consentiranno di esplorare la baraccopoli. In alcune scatole di cartone identificate da un punto interrogativo troveremo suggerimenti e tutorial per affrontare i puzzle ambientali. Una volta raggiunta, la bambina ci getterà da un tetto dicendo che siamo <<maledetti>>. Saremo salvati dal nostro prezioso amico, Lula, un robottino che con i suoi retrorazzi ci consentirà di compiere salti altrimenti impossibili e di attivare meccanismi altrimenti irraggiungibili; Lula ci avvisa che dobbiamo raggiungere nostro padre. Dopo aver attraversato la favela grazie a ponti di baracche volanti e ad altri fantasiosi puzzle ambientali, ci imbatteremo in un enorme mostro rosa, nostro padre, a cui sembriamo essere assolutamente indifferenti. Inizialmente apparirà innocuo e quasi simpatico, intento come un gigantesco Homer dei Simpson unicamente a dormire e trangugiare noci di cocco. Potremo portarlo con noi dove più ci aggrada attirandolo con le noci di cocco, e riusciremo ad accedere a luoghi altrimenti inaccessibili saltando sulla sua enorme pancia. 

La tragica realtà si manifesterà quando il mostro ingurgiterà alcune rane verdi di cui è particolarmente ghiotto (che rappresentano l'alcool), tramutandosi in una feroce e violenta bestia avvolta da fiamme infernali che ci aggredirà e ci sbatterà violentemente per terra. Nonostante tutto il nostro destino è legato al suo e dovremo portarlo con noi per riuscire a proseguire. La bambina, che rappresenta la sorella di Vander, ci aiuterà a raggiungere il tempio dello sciamano nel tentativo di guarire il mostro dal suo male. Durante il nostro viaggio alcune visioni e ricordi di infanzia ci informeranno che nostro padre a causa della sua ebbrezza al volante fu addirittura responsabile di un incidente d'auto di cui fummo testimoni diretti e in cui una persona morì, anche questo un fatto realmente accaduto! Ad un certo punto pittureremo il nostro corpo in una sorta di rito di iniziazione, simbolo di una precoce ma necessaria maturazione e crescita, e dovremo affrontare il mostro per catturarlo e portarlo dallo sciamano. Alla fine la voce dello sciamano ci dirà che nostro padre non può essere curato e che se vorremo salvarci da lui dovremo lasciarlo andare al suo destino. Seguiremo il monito dello sciamano e dall'alto di una torre getteremo il mostro, che finirà inghiottito dalle nuvole. 
Ecco perché a 18 anni Vander Caballero era già in giro per il mondo....

CONCLUSIONE

Che dire? Una vicenda così toccante che ha il sapore di una drammatica e intima confessione catartica lascia poco spazio per una recensione ordinaria!
E' bene sottolineare che tale drammaticità non viene quasi mai palesata durante il gioco, solo in parte nel finale. Infatti il titolo può essere giocato tranquillamente anche da un pubblico di bambini, perché si presenta apparentemente come un allegro, disimpegnato, fantasioso e colorato puzzle game 3D. La qualità del titolo regge anche a prescindere dalla sua lettura autobiografica. Le meccaniche di gioco, il gameplay, le caratteristiche estetiche, i puzzle ambientali, il comparto grafico e sonoro, e tutti gli altri aspetti tecnici sono realizzati con grande maestria e raggiungono un alto livello di qualità, rendendo il titolo divertente e giocabile al di là della toccante metafora. La durata si assesta attorno alle 4 ore di gioco. Il porting per PC non presenta alcun difetto. Gli unici difetti tecnici che ho riscontrato sono alcuni rari bug di trasparenza e di compenetrazione delle texture e dei poligoni, e alcune imprecisioni nelle interazioni fra il personaggio, l'ambiente e gli oggetti, ma nulla di particolarmente evidente. Un ottimo risultato per una produzione indie.

Non possiamo che ringraziare Vander Caballero per il suo intimo coinvolgimento e il suo impegno artistico, che hanno aperto nuove e più profonde strade alla decima arte.

Voto: 95/100

24311022.review:
Papo & Yo is a beautiful adventure about a boy and his monster... but you already did notice that, right?

I'd like to recap this game while trying not to spoil anything for you, since the story is one of the strong points here.

+ Beautiful environments, characters and art style in general.
+ Deep and emotional story.
+ Fun to play in general.
+ The soundtrack is well orchestrated and is placed perfectly when needed.

- The puzzles get a little bit tedious after a while.
- The controls aren't as responsive as they should in some cases (most notably in jumps or camera twists).
- It has almost no replay value, since its second run would be playing the exact same game but collecting some hidden plushies in some places.

As an overall review I'd say that it isn't a good game per se, the controls feel a little bit clunky and the puzzles could have been way better implemented. However, it is a really good story and the way it's told helps to compensate for its technical flaws.

Overall, I'd say that as a puzzle game this barely reaches a 5/10 but as an overall experience I believe it could easily reach a 8/10.

24290599.review:
[h1] Papo & Yo [/h1]
Неожиданно удивительная. Красивая. Шикарная.
Честно, непонимаю я этого, ребят. У меня 130 хороших друзей в Steam и только у троих (!!!) из них имеется в библиотеке прекрасная во всех смыслах этого слова Papo & Yo. Не могу понять, почему столь замечательная игра осталась незамеченной. Ладно, обо всём по порядку.
Нам предстоит познакомиться с тяжёлой судьбой мальчика по имени Квико. Почти всю игру будем проходить плечом к плечу с роботом Лула - лучшим другом главного героя, который может отдать жизнь за Вас. Познакомимся с девчонкой, которая будет только дразнить нас, но без её помощи мы не сможем справиться с трудностями. Ну и, конечно же, встретим Монстра, Монстра, у которого есть страшная зависимость перед лягушками - съев хотя бы одну лягуху, Монстр впадает в бешенство и может уничтожить всё и всех на своём пути. А что же будет дальше, чем обернётся дружба Квико с другими героями, что нам расскажут об отношениях Квико со своим отцом, где параллель между реальностью и этим сказочным миром - ответы на эти вопросы Вам и предстоит узнать.

[h1] Плюсы: [/h1]
+ Глубокий и действительно трогательный сюжет. То, что написано немного выше и не составляет маленькой доли того, о чём нам расскажут сценаристы. Поверьте, игра даст Вам много пищи для размышлений.
+ Великолепная музыка. Советую вместе с игрой сразу покупать Саундрек Издание, ведь музыка в игре действительно прекрасна. Особенно в конце...
+ Отличная графика. Несмотря на относительно большой возраст игры, картинка даже в 2016 году выглядит свежо и сочно. Приятно же :)
+ Огромное спасибо игровым дизайнерам! Вы проделали поистине гениальную работу! Снимаю шляпу!
+ Очень интересные головоломки. Всё проходится как-то интуитивно, лично я даже не пользовался подсказками. Кстати, подсказки в игре есть на случай, если Вы всё-таки застряните.
+ Плюс за отличное освещение и тени. 
+ Анимация и игровая физика сделаны более, чем профессионально.
+ Огромный плюс за геймплей. Извините, но со своим относительно скудным словарным запасом я не смогу описать и части всех ГЕНИАЛЬНЫХ игровых особенностей. Это нужно обязательно увидеть самому. Хотя бы раз, ребят...

[h1] Минусы: [/h1]
К минусам я бы отнёс небольшую продолжительность (около 4-х часов, потом проходил второй раз залпом) и то, что монстр иногда "проходит" сквозь стены. Но эти минусы настолько малы по сравнению с плюсами, что они никак не влиют на оценку игры.

В итоге получаем, ещё раз повторюсь, совершенно гениальную игру с великолепно реализованной идеей, с прекрасными составляющими, работающими как единый механизм. Но несмотря на все похвалы от меня, не могу я поставить высшую оценку. Чего-то совсем крохотного мне не хватает... Чего же?..

[h1] Оценка: 9,5 / 10 [/h1]

モンスターがとても多くの致命的なバグを抱えており、結果として私のプレイ中に何度もゲームの進行が不可能になった
そしてパズルゲームであるため、進行不可能になっているにも関わらず現在の状態が正規の挙動ではない事に気づけずにプレイを続けるはめになった
パズル自体はとても平易でクリアに際してはプレイヤーが主人公を思った通りに操作出来るかどうかが重要でありパズルゲームと捉えているとストレスを感じる事になる
視点の近さや向きが固定される場面がままあり、ある足場に飛び乗りたいのに視点が固定されるため遠近感が掴めないなどといった事がある
終盤には主人公に対する妨害要素が出てくるが、パズルに緊張感を与える要素としては面白い
しかし一度その妨害要素に捕まればただのストレスでしかなくなる

ゲームの面白さとしては独特かつ美しさを感じる世界観、それにマッチした豊富なBGM、マップ毎に配置された楽しげで豊富なパズルギミックなどが挙げられる

ストーリーは私は独りよがりで共感しづらく達成感や爽快さがまったくないと感じたが、作者の意図したであろう内容自体は伝わってくる

24276872.review:
Papo & Yo was one of the best gaming experiences I've ever had. The gameplay, the soundtrack, the story, everything was just wonderful. As many have pointed out, this game deals with heavy themes of abuse and alcoholism told through the imagination of a young boy. 

This is another game that you can beat in one sitting, it takes about 3 hours. The puzzles aren't mind burners, but they're very engaging, varied and charming. It's a bit of an emotional rollercoaster if you're open to it, and I enjoyed every minute that I spent with it.

24273909.review: This simple puzzle platformer masks a deeply symbolic and emotional story.

24236669.review:
Beautiful Dark Turth 

Story 5/10
Gamplay 6/10
Replayable 6/10
Achievement 9/10

Papo & Yo is a beautiful charming game that holds a deep dark secret. Guiding you throughout a dream-scape, parkour-puzzle sort of world is a series of colourful and dynamic scenes and puzzles that change the world around you as it unravels its truth. A calm, soothing, often upbeat and cheerful soundtrack rassures you venture deeper into the  world.
The story of the game is quite short and took you on a slow but increasinly intense journey which really didn't make much sense on the first playthrough, small cutscenes didn't give away much about the story in the gameplay, but then the pieces all rapidly come together to reveal the dark truth which created a much different perspective on the second playthrough. 

You gain attachment to the main character who I believe is Yo, as you explore the urban maze through a childs eyes, and how the smallest things look different to a childlike imagination.
The puzzles are not to difficult and the controls are easy to pick up.

Recommend if you like puzzles, mystery, intrigueing storyline and beautiful imagery.

24236386.review:
Papo & Yo - трехмерный паззл-платформер. Как и в любом паззл-платформере, в Papo & Yo нужно решать какие-то задачки, чтобы пройти дальше, на чем и построен весь геймплей. Игра удивляет своим артом, волшебством локаций, меняющихся и перестраивающихся при взаимодействии с нужными объектами. Через всю игру проходит становящийся к концу совсем явным социальный подтекст, невероятно редкий в компьютерных играх (я точно не видел поднятия этой темы ни в одной игре). К сожалению, у игры есть весомый минус - головоломки в ней совсем не головоломные. Ну вот совсем-совсем. Они даже не простые, в них вообще думать не приходится - находишь, подбегаешь, жмешь в нужной последовательности, идешь дальше. Вот как-то так.

Плюсы:
- оригинальная необычная визуальная подача;
- прекрасное музыкальное сопровождение;
- оригинальный подтекст.

Минусы:
- невероятно простой паззл.

Итого: моя оценка 3 из 5. Будь в игре интересные паззлы, заставляющие хоть немного поднапрячься, поставил бы 5 из 5.

Bueno, comprado en rebajas, estaba en deseados bastante tiempo, habia leído muy buenas criticas sobre este juego y cual es mi opinión una vez terminado...
Un juego que para mi fue un parentesis en lo tipico que encuentras en el mercado ultimamente, ni un tito, ni barra de vida, solo el juego y tu ingenio , que no es poco.
El juego me ha encantado, graficos correctos, musica muy buena para acompañar y puzzles justos de dificultad, tirando mas bien a lo facil.
Lo recomiendo, obviamente compra en rebajas.
Duracion corta, pero para los que como yo, andamos justos de tiempo, ideal tambien por esto.
La historia, ya habreis leido miles de analisis, es algo nunca antes tocado de esta manera en el mundo gamer, y me parece algo a tener en cuenta , ya que nos pone, o nos acerca, imaginarnos ya creo que es imposible, en la piel de los maltratos y problemas por los que paso el autor.
un saludo.

24052538.review:
Довольно странно,что данная игра очень уж не популярна не то,что бы в игровом сообществе,да даже среди инди игр о такой редко слышишь,хотя видно,что сделана-то игра старательно. Papo & Yo -это одна из тех игр,которую нужно рассматривать целиком, и если раскладывать на отдельные части,то она и не особо-то кажется уникальной.Ну,почти. Разумеется первое,что бросилось мне в глаза,так это стилистика и визуалка.Очень мало нынче игр,которые цепляют таким одновременно простым,но красивым стилем,который заключается в комбинации предметов и окружения реального мира с каким-то "белыми рисунками " и сюрреалистичными частями окружения .и смотрится это чудесно,хочеться любоваться и любоваться всякимим решениями на уровнях. Геймплей тут не особо-то и фантастический. В основном,всё укладывается в систему "нажми кнопку отута,сделай что-то отама и сопоставь" .каких-то архи сложных задачек тут нет,есть ,правда, одна ,на которой я заступорился,но это уж я тупой,да и потом, на локации всегда есть коробка,которая расскажет ,как всё функционирует.Сюжет ,вот, я не знаю,как сказать,он как бы хороший,но если убрать подачу,то он прост как дважды два.Догадаться,что из себя представляет история не трудно,и когда тебе рассказывают,что "а оно ,оказывается,не так ,как ты думал,ага" ,ты  вообще не удивляешься,но зато концовка весьма сильная,хоть и не особо понятная.Музыка...ох,ну вот музыка поистине чудесна.Особенно она врезается в память в этой самой концовке,ибо напряжение,все дела, да и во время всей игры она нехило так делает атмосферу всей игре. 
Вообщем,если говорить в целом,то игра определённо стоит своих денег. Да,короткая, да, не ААА проэкт,да,вы вряд ли захотите перепроходить её несчётное кол-во раз,но определённый осадок она после своего прохождения точно оставит,и жто определённо прекрасная игра,которая пробуждает эмоции вполне простыми способами.

23603381.review:
Finally got around to finishing this game; it is absolutely wonderful. The puzzles are challenging, but even though I got stuck on one of them for a while, they never felt impossible, and once I got a hang of the mechanics (which was my problem), I really enjoyed trying to solve the puzzles.
But the biggest thing this game has going for it is the story; the game tackles some heavy themes, and the story it tells is very personal to the Creative Director, Vander Caballero, and that really comes across very strong. It does a very excellent job of exploring complicated inter-personal relationships.
And while I had no problem picking up on the metaphors for addiction, abuse, and the other themes, the game still explains itself at the end, and I really really loved that.
It gets emotional; I ended up crying. The only downside to it is that I don't see a lot of replayability, since the game is so very story driven.
But all in all, a wonderful game that is both beautiful, personal, and fun and engaging to play.

23597095.review:
A beautiful game in every meaning of the word.

Aesthetically Papo & Yo is so beautifully designed and rendered that it almost needs nothing else to recommend it. But then it brings so much more to the experience.

This is a game that has me writing - and erasing - and re-considering - and re-writing. This game is simply that powerful.

At GDC2015 I spoke about the power of games to engage - and change - minds and Papo & Yo is one of the games that I used as an example. The relatively simple narrative is transformed when combined with the game mechanics into something very powerful: Papo & Yo reveals the ability of games to be something much more.

This is not to say that the narrative and associated emotions will necessarily speak to everybody, but if they do then: watch out. 

Although I've finished the game, I only have around half of the achievements and don't plan on returning to the game. As beautiful and engaging as it is - the emotional impact is something that, although I am glad I experienced it, cannot go through again.

(If you ever hear an art / movie / book critic scoff about "games as art" ask them to play this game. [b]The interactive nature of digital games offer an emotional experience like no other medium.[/b])

23506662.review:
[h1] Overview	[/h1]

Papo & Yo or Father and I markets itself as a puzzle, action, platformer set in a dream world of a Brazilian favela.  You play as Quico a boy who has to help a monster who has a strange addiction to poisonous mushrooms that enrage the beast upon consumption.  The only way to temporary calm down the monster is to feed him some blue, rotten fruit.  Following the advice of a mysterious girl named Alejandra, you must navigate the favela by manipulating buildings with chalk magic and bring the monster to the temple to cure him of this unfortunate addiction. 

Papo & Yo is also tagged as story rich, but it isn’t shown on the steam page and I truly believe that is the greatest asset of the game.  Papo & Yo is not only about escaping the big bad monster and rescuing the femme fatale, but also contains lots of metaphors and symbolism.   


[h1] The Good	[/h1]

One of Papo & Yo’s bestselling points is the amount of visuals.  I’m not only talking about graphics options and textures, but also about the backdrop and wall art.  Throughout the game there are some amazing looking graffiti art, which I can only guess is a digital rendition of something that already exists in the real world.  Each piece of art is not only eye candy, but also contributes to the game experience because the art follows the progression of the story.  If one takes the time to look at the graffiti, while making connections to the game, the game as a whole becomes much more pleasant and enjoyable upon completion. 

The game is also linked and joined together really well.  There are no ‘fade to black’ scenes and the whole game seems to be made on a single map.  The goal of the game is simple enough, with level progression usually locked away by a metal gate, out of reach, or just requires the weight of the monster on a pressure plate.  Camera work is superb when it takes over control from the user, and it really does the map justice with its long pan-overs and high angle shots.  This is also an extremely important step because it allows the player to quickly look at the layout of the map since there in no in-game mini-map.   

In terms of audio, the accompanying composition features 2 main soundtracks.  One with the slower ‘wild’ music that plays when monster is calm which really fits in with the Brazilian favela setting and the rushed rapid drumming music when the monster is poisoned by the frogs.  In particular, the latter sound piece is composed in such a way that actually promotes urgency.  The quick fade between the first piece and this other composition, along with the rapid change in colour scheme of the map when the monster becomes enraged really feels like something out of Pompeii.  
 
The voice acting was great and you could really sense the great sense of urgency in the tone of the voices between Aljandra and Quico.  I personally think going with subtitled text was the much better option in terms of localization rather than a voiceover since there are often certain vocal ticks that can’t be transferred from one language to another.  That is why I always prefer spoken dialogue in its original intended language even if I don’t understand what they’re saying.

However, Papo & Yo’s greatest selling point is the story.  It’s definitely not a story everyone can relate to, but it definitely shines a lot more light on some real life situations that are still happening in this day and age.  If you hadn’t guessed what the story and the metaphoric actions meant throughout playing the game, you will find out at the end as the story crosses between the two realities that it exists in. 


[h1] The Bad [/h1]

Since the game is story-driven, and it tells you pretty much everything in the last chapter, the game loses out on replayability value, even if the option is given in the menu to start from every single checkpoint save.  

Another thing I really disliked about this game was the puzzle aspect of this game.  This game had nearly no puzzle aspect.  It wasn’t like the Talos Principle or the Portal series, but more like a point and click game.  You just had to trial and error to find the next gear or pressure plate that allowed you to advance to the next stage of the game.   Ultimately, the game was more of a walking simulator mixed into a movie for me.  I would have finished it much faster if there weren’t a lot of forced ‘walking back and forth’.


[h1] Overall Score [/h1]

I give Papo & Yo a score of 9/10.  I truly enjoyed this game because I am a huge fan of strong story based games that make you think and make connections to real life scenarios.  Apart from mediocre puzzle and some useless features a la the ability to walk in the game, this is one of the best games I’ve ever played and is definitely worth a buy just to play if not just for the art and music.

23353721.review:
Sem dúvida uma obra de arte, cenários com gráficos simples mais com auxilio da mecânica se torna espetaculares. Os puzzles são simples mas de uma criatividade e beleza impressionantes e juntamente com a história são os pontos altos do jogo.

A história de abuso infantil do pai alcoólatra contada através do mundo imaginário da criança criado para fugir e achar uma forma de lidar com a sua dura realidade, não é apenas um jogo é uma história interativa feita para emocionar seus jogadores.

Os gráficos são bem simples mas que não influência em nada e como já citei o que falta em gráficos sobra em criatividade. A jogabilidade é um pouco travada mas também não influência muita coisa no resultado final.

É um jogo para quem quer mais do que apenas um jogo, um jogo para se emocionar, para se interpretar e para se admirar com a criatividade nos cenários (será que já falei isso?).

22835622.review:
[*il numero delle ore segnalato non è quello reale in quanto ho giocato in modalità offline]
Se siete giocatori/giocatrici emotivamente sensibili dovete assolutamente giocare questo titolo.
Finire Papo & Yo è stato emotivamente faticoso. Iniziando l'avventura si comprende che il tema di fondo è [spoiler]l'abuso familiare (da parte di un padre), andando avanti si intuisce che si parla di una dipendenza, arrivando all'atto conclusivo è palese che la dipendenza del mostro è l'alcol.[/spoiler]
Nonostante il tema trattato l'opera narra tutto per metafore e iconografie. Nella sua drammaticità il titolo si avvicina in quanto a poesia a opere immani quali Ico o Shadow of the colossus.
Solo nella parte finale si elimina per pochissimo tempo il filtro delle icone, senza metafore tutto fa più male. 
La scelta finale [spoiler]del protagonista di abbandonare "il mostro" al suo destino potrebbe sembrare ai più una doverosa autodifesa, eppure quando si è a contatto con situazioni di dipendenza non puoi che provare una forte fitta allo stomaco nell'essere spinto dal gioco a organizzare una trappola che porterà inevitabilmente e inconsapevolmente il mostro ad essere abbandonato a se stesso, tra le nubi di un uragano che rappresenta in modo piuttosto drammatico il desiderio di allontanarlo da se e lasciarlo in balia del suo destino.[/spoiler]

Il gameplay è piuttosto divertente, l'ambientazione affascinante ed è fatto davvero un uso interessante e diverso dell'Unreal Engine. I controlli sono buoni, le animazioni un po' macchinose, la colonna sonora adatta al contesto e avrete voglia di riascoltarla anche dopo.

Perché giocare a questo titolo?

+ storia forte e drammatica ma narrata in modo poetico e metaforico
+ la storia non viene narrata con stupide cutscene ma facendovi agire in-game
+ ambientazione interessante
+ bella colonna sonora
+ artisticamente e visivamente diverso dai soliti giochi
+ gameplay da puzzle ambientali interessante ma non cervellotico
+ ottimo utilizzo dell'unreal engine

A charming little indie game with nice presentation and art direction. The music is lovely and fits the scene perfectly. The graphics are technically average, but still look great. This game is fairly short, but about the right length for a game of this type.
Most of the gameplay is simple puzzle platforming, but the style and atmosphere stops it from getting boring. The puzzles are well designed but fairly casual, so don't expect a challenge. This game would be suitable for young children, although they may not understand the adult message (which is fine).

After enjoying “Brothers – A tale of two sons” (an amazing indie game), I searched for some more indie games that I hoped would be similar, and found this. While Papo & Yo is not quite as good as Brothers, it is still decent and I recommend it.

22591950.review:
"Papo y yo" es un juego muy bueno del tipo puzzles-plataformas. Para avanzar en la historia, el personaje deberá activar engranajes, llaves o tirar de determinadas cuerdas. Todo ello hará que el escenario se modifique en mayor o menor medida (las tuberias giran, las casas se desplazan, aparecen escaleras, el suelo se pliega.....) originándose así nuevos caminos para llegar al punto deseado. Durante gran parte del juego, acompañando al personaje principal, aparecerán un robot y un monstruo. La interacción con ambos será necesaria para superar las pantallas, aunque habrá que tener cuidado con este último, ya que en algunos momentos puede llegar a atacar al personaje principal. 

El punto fuerte del juego, no es tanto la historia, sino la forma de contarla. Siendo un tema delicado, han acertado de pleno. Además el aspecto visual y sonoro es muy bueno.
Como puntos negativos hay que decir que el juego es muy corto (4-5 horas) y  muy fácil (imposible bloquearse). Además habría estado bien que el personaje fuera un poco más ágil e hiciera saltos de mayor distancia (el apartado de plataformeo lo agradecería). 

"Papo y yo" como muchos otros juegos tiene puntos fuertes y débiles. Sin embargo, la originalidad del título hace que merezca la pena, sin lugar a dudas, hacerle un hueco en deseados. Nota 7,5

Papo & Yo  มันคือเรื่องราวที่สะท้อนปัญหาใหญ่ในครอบครัว...

หลังจากได้ค้นเกมส์ที่ดองไว้ ก็ได้พบเจอเกมส์ผจญภัยแก้ปริศนาที่ชื่อ Papo & Yo ต้องบอกว่าผมพลาดมากที่ดองเกมส์ดีขนาดนี้แล้วเพิ่งมาเล่น เกมส์นำเสนอเรื่องราวของเด็กชายและสัตว์ประหลาด ที่สะท้อนปัญหาใหญ่หลักๆในครอบครัวที่มีสาเหตุจาก"เหล้า" เราจะได้เห็นภาพสะท้อนของ Quico เด็กชายผิวสีที่ต้องเอาตัวรอดจากปีศาจร้ายที่อยู่ในตัวพ่อของเขาหลังจาก Quico โดดเข้าไปในสัญลักษณ์ที่นั่น Quico ได้พบกับเด็กสาวปริศนาที่คอยนำทางเพื่อจัดการกับปีศาจร้าย....

Baseado na vida do próprio roteirista Vander Caballero, um jogo que retrata muito bem um problema social grave, o alcoolismo. 

O jogo é relativamente curto, porém as lindas experiências trazidas pela enorme criatividade de Quico, o personagem principal, te fazem esquecer do tempo e você apenas curte os puzzles e se diverte.

A história entre pai e filho é poéticamente desenhada pelo grupo da Minority na engine Unreal, com belas paisagens de uma típica Favela da América Latina. 

Nota: 9/10 (Por eu já ter passado dos 30 e sentir novamente a magia da infância)

Mas até ele chegar no seu objetivo, terá que andar muito pelo mundo surreal, mágico e cheio de quebra-cabeças que existe em Papo & Yo.

Jogo fantástico.

Game 10/10

It's the kind of game that grabs you while you play and sticks with you long after it's done. It's not a happy or even fun game by any stretch. But it's a powerful game that delivers worthwhile messages about addiction, life and learning to grow up.

21572357.review:
父親からDVを受けて育った作者が自身の経験を元に綴った自伝的ストーリー。このようなゲームは俗に「共感ゲーム」と呼ばれているそうです。

[h1]ゲームプレイ[/h1] 
3Dプラットフォーマーとパズル…と言うよりはボタン探しゲームと言う側面が強く、歯ごたえのある難易度を求めるゲーマーには少し退屈に感じると思います。足場から足場へ飛び移ったりモンスターから逃げるアクションゲームとしての側面を見ると、キャラクターはかなり素直に動いてくれるおかげで操作の面でストレスを感じることはないでしょう。落下によるやり直しはありますが、ゲームオーバーというより直前からやり直しですぐに再開するのでさくさくと進めると思います。

パズルもさほど難しくなくパズルのキーはレバーを引く、ネジを回す、紐を引っ張る等直感的でわかりやすく、ブラジルで貧民街を意味するファベーラに魔法を織り交ぜた世界観も相まって難しくないもののそれらをトリガーにゲーム世界が変化する動かして楽しいパズルになっています。私はちょうど飛び出す絵本や知育パズルをやっているような感覚を受けました。
また、各地にはかなり多くのヒントが散りばめられていて、詰まった時もまずはクエスチョンマークが描かれた箱を探すとかなり答えに近いヒントを貰えることも少なくありません。
対象年齢は6歳以上といったところでしょうか。最近は3歳位からスマートフォンでゲームを楽しむ子供も結構いると聞きますので、コントローラーを握られれば誰もがプレイできるかもしれません。
上記の通り大人、特にゲームに慣れ親しんだ層から見れば「バカにしてんのか！」と思う難易度かもしれませんが、このゲームのメインテーマはそこではないのでストーリーを楽しむ余裕のある難易度だと納得していただければ良いと思います。

[h1]美術[/h1] 
まずはファベーラ、ブラジルの貧民街の風景を見てもらうとより楽しめると思います。現実と非現実が入り交じる世界観、特にパズルと魔法のチョークによる世界の変化は目を奪われるものがあります。前述のとおりスイッチを押した前と後でダイナミックに世界が変化する様はデザイナーの高い実力を感じずにはいられません。ストーリーの盛り上がりとともに現実と非現実の比率が徐々に変わっていく点も含めて私は大変気に入っています。

音楽は同じく南アメリカの作曲家が担当している通り非常に”それっぽい”音楽が要所要所で流れます。詳しくないので迂闊なことは言えませんが大きくまとめてラテン音楽というジャンルで良いのでしょうか。ストーリーを盛り上げるためのものであるため、ノリの良いダンスミュージックと言うより情緒たっぷりの音楽が耳に残っています。

[h1]ストーリー[/h1] 
まずこれは冒頭の通りDVを受けて育った人間がそれと向き合って作ったゲームであるということを念頭においてプレイして頂きたいと思います。勧善懲悪でなければ成功体験でもなく、必ずしも頑張った結果大団円が迎えられるという保証はどこにもありません。ゲームという媒体を使いエンターテイメントの範疇を抜け出さない範囲で自身の体験を綴るバランス感覚を考えれば本当にギリギリのラインを渡りきり「よくぞ描き切った！」と思う気もしますが、個人的な欲を言えばせっかくAAAタイトル開発から抜けて独立したのだからもっとパンツを脱いでも良かったのでは、とも思います。

このゲームは苦難を乗り越えた人が同じ体験をした人に対して過去と心の傷との向き合い方への一つのヒントを提示するような内容でもあり、そういうものを期待していない人には少々説教臭さを感じるかもしれません。それでも単なる自己啓発のような臭さを感じないのはひとえに個人の経験の発露とエンターテイメントとしてのバランスを考慮した結果であると言えるでしょう。

[h1]総評[/h1] 
プレイ時間は3～4時間、それでもストーリーが盛り上がるまでは若干退屈を覚えるところが難点だと言えます。ゲームが盛り上がりメインテーマが窺い知れるまでには少し時間があるのですが、そうでない前半を乗り切るための導線が魅力的な風景だけというのはこのゲームの少々弱いところだと感じます。パズルもアクションも序盤はかなり退屈ですし。そこさえ乗り切ればストーリーの盛り上がりとともにゲームプレイ自体もそこそこな難易度を持ってきます。
何かを表現し、それを小さな子どもやゲームに親しみのない人を含めた多くの人に感じて欲しいという思いが確実にゲームに反映されています。

コントローラーを握ってプレイするゲームとしてみると内容は平々凡々、それに期待してあえてこのゲームをやる理由はどこにもありません。それでもなおこのゲームをおすすめするにチェックを入れているのはひとえに自身の半生を実直に語りきった最後にプレイヤーである私の心に何かが残った感覚を他の人と共有したいからに他なりません。

Bazı oyunlar var, aslında bu oyunları yaratan insanlar bir mesaj vermek istiyorlar. Oyunun zorluk ayarlarını biraz kısıp yaşadıklarıyla alakalı vermek istedikleri mesajları kısa bir oyunla aktarmak istiyorlar. Bakın bu sanattır!

21500533.review:
Recommended, but only if it's on sale (I think $5 is fair).

The game looks very nice and has an awesome fantasy favela setting, but the puzzles are by and large simple and with one single course of action to be taken each time. It's annoying because there are some great ideas set up but they're never combined to make anything challenging. The only time I got stuck was at the very end, when I spent 30 minutes trying to figure out what I was supposed to do before discovering that a scripted event hadn't triggered as it should have.

Story-wise, the monster is apparently our friend, but this is only kind of implied because he doesn't object to us bouncing on his stomach while he's asleep; he never actively helps us. He ignores us unless we're bringing him a coconut, and hates us when he eats frogs, until we find him some rotten fruit to calm him down. But even when he's in angry flaming mode he's not much of a threat, just an annoyance. You can't die in this game, so he just throws you around, frustrating your attempts to solve the timed puzzles.

With a more engaging story and some more interesting puzzles, or even a co-op mode, this could be something really cool. It's like a long introduction to the game's characters and mechanics, but then once you're starting to get into it, it's all over. I know this review makes it sound like I didn't like it, but I did enjoy playing it. I was just disappointed that by the end it felt like less than the sum of its parts.

21490681.review:
这个独立小游戏的背景是发生在南美洲的一个贫民窟，主要是讲贫民窟里的小男孩和他的伙伴与怪兽之间相爱相杀的故事。游戏的解密要素还是很简单的，解密的方式也是很独特有趣的，比较新颖，手柄操作也很流畅，闪躲跳一些关卡也不是很难。本来这个游戏是可以在3—4个左右的时间通关，但是我觉得一个2013年做的游戏，把南美风情景色做的惟妙惟肖，画质也不差，着实让我有点边看风景边玩的心态，并没有急着通关。

玩着玩着你会觉得这个游戏是有一定的深意的，为什么怪兽吃了雨蛙以后会变的暴躁，开始攻击小男孩，为什么感觉怪兽吃了就睡睡了就吃，说实话，怪兽并没有主动做任何事，全靠小男孩拿食物拿足球来引导，这些食物足球雨蛙又象征着什么呢，小男孩的伙伴们为什么会说那些话呢。。当你玩到最后一章，快结束的时候，玩家仿佛终于明白了什么。

明白了什么呢，怪兽是爸爸，雨蛙是酒精，小男孩的小伙伴就是他最珍爱的玩具和他的妈妈，食物和足球是玩乐。你再回过头看，原来就是一个喝醉了酒的爸爸，回家后肆意家暴妻子和孩子的一个故事。小男孩内心里觉得爸爸就是一头野兽，不管喝酒还是没喝酒。没喝酒的清醒时刻，还可以陪小男孩一起玩。喝完酒后，完全就是黑化的一个狂野暴怒的怪物，任何人都无法接近，接近的人都将被野兽的袭击，并受到伤害。

纵观结尾，小男孩是讨厌他的爸爸的，甚至是想杀死他爸爸的，最后也的确杀死了爸爸。因为在小男孩的在内心深处是希望家里没有这样的一个爸爸的，这样的爸爸让人不安和恐惧，带给小男孩的只有无尽的伤痛和悲伤。这样的一个想法，说实话，是不该出现在一个将近10岁孩子身上的，可是再回归游戏的背景和地区，你不得不说有些特殊现象在某些特定的区域是属于普遍现象，他们习以为常，甚至引以为傲。就像鲁迅说的那样“哀其不幸，怒其不争”。

游戏制作方也是希望不管世界上哪个国家的儿童和妇女，都能生活在一个正常健康和谐的家庭环境中，批判和声讨家暴对于一个孩子一个家庭乃至一个地区的恶劣影响。就像结尾中，当孩子将怪兽推入无底深渊的时候，阳光也照进了他灰蒙已久的心。但是，相对来说，他解决了怪兽，本身也是一件很残酷的事情，让他一辈子也走不出杀人阴影中。你说小男孩是否是真的赶走了阴霾迎来了阳光呢，那个阳光又是小男孩真正需要的阳光吗？都是值得让人深思的。

好啦，现在跳出游戏的故事，让我想到最近玩的几款独立小游戏，虽然都不是什么大制作大经费的大厂商做的游戏，但都是很有诚意的，引发并同玩家一起对社会乃至世界上存在的一些社会人文宗教伦理等矛盾问题思考，让玩家在玩的过程中不止是玩游戏的本身，而玩的是一种文化，让自身价值观得到扩展和并引发思考。这是一件很棒的事情。

最后，虽然结局比较致郁，但是仍不失为一部剧情画质都很棒的游戏，游戏里面的壁画各种房屋错落的细节将当地人的生活形态表现的很到位。真的很推荐这款游戏，你值得拥有。

Papo & Yo,

The soundtrack is OK.
Conclusion, a game worth playing for 3 hours of fun, interpretation and will to discover.
