21114731.review:
Papa & Yo est un jeu qui s'inscrit dans la lignée des jeux indés qui tentent de faire sortir de l'émotion des joueurs, plutôt que de créer un gameplay unique, ce qui n'est absolument pas un mal en soi vu les perles du genre qui sont déja sorties.

Le problème ici est que Papa & Yo n'est ni intéressant en terme de gameplay, ni touchant avec sa mise en scène et son scénario. Et pourtant on sent bien l'effort des développeurs pour essayer de nous mettre a la place du protagoniste qui essaye tant bien que mal de gérer le monstre qui symbolise son père... 

Mais la mayonnaise ne prend pas, l'ennui prend le dessus lors des phases de gameplay lourdes et redondantes, et les cinématiques ne font lacher qu'un soupir d'exaspération sur un scénario lourdingue qui s'emmèle les pinceaux avec un final très convenu.

Enfin au final le jeu nous propose "subtilement" un new game plus totalement inutile bien que totalement indispensable pour les chasseurs a succès,.. Gonfler la durée de vie de son jeu ? Mais non, quelle idée........

21101160.review: много багов сдаю обратнор в целом игра не плохая!

21093718.review:
Papo & Yo é um choque de realidade que nos faz perceber que algumas pessoas tem a vida realmente dura. Comecei a joga-lo pesando se tratar de uma aventura com puzzles e plataforma, mas pouco tempo depois, percebi estar enganado.

O jogo acontece em uma favela, em que o protagonista Kiko, uma criança de aproximadamente 10 anos, passa a confundir seus sonhos com a realidade como um truque de sua mente para se esquecer de problemas familiares.

Conforme a trama se desenvolve, Kiko encontra o monstro, uma criatura dócil e carinhosa, mas que foi amaldiçoada, podendo se tornar agressiva em determinadas circunstâncias. Seu descontrole pode causar dor e sofrimento a todos a seu redor, inclusive Kiko.

A sutileza está na dedicatória “À minha mãe e meus irmãos e irmãs, com os quais sobrevivi ao monstro em meu pai”, que somada aos acontecimentos finais do jogo, levam a concluir se tratar de uma espécie de autobiografia diluída entre os saltos e quebra-cabeças.

[spoiler]Desta forma, cabe a Kiko tentar ajudar o monstro, e livra-lo de sua terrível maldição, ou falando mais claramente, ajudar seu pai a se livrar de seu vício.[/spoiler]

O jogo não faz bonito apenas na história, e traz gráficos muito bons levando em consideração se tratar de um jogo indie. Também merece destaque a ambientação das favelas criadas com detalhes em arte de rua, além da trilha sonora bem acertada, que transmite um ar de tranquilidade.

Uma coisa chata é que a mesma originalidade encontrada na história e ambientes faltou na hora da criação dos puzzles. É que apesar de bem feitos e até mesmo bem aproveitados com os elementos plataforma que o jogo oferece, é possível encontrar mais de uma vez a mesma mecânica em várias partes do jogo, tornando-o por vezes repetitivo.

No geral, Papo & Yo é um grande jogo com uma narrativa única e bastante emocionante. Seus puzzles e plataformas são apenas uma metáfora para ilustrar as dificuldades de uma criança passando por uma infância traumática. É uma experiência bastante diferente daquelas a que você está acostumado e vale a pena conferir. EXCELENTE (9/10).

21087815.review:
Sencillamente precioso. 

Aunque sea de situaciones duras vividas por un niño la manera que tiene de mostrarte la historia es única, tierna y a la vez dolorosa de una manera mas sútil.  Puzzles sencillos que te van adentrando en lo mas profundo del ser del protagonista, un compañero que lo dará todo por ti y una banda sonora perfecta para cada momento.

21086512.review: Anyone who's ever shared a home with an abusive person knows that the management of the aggressor's precarious mental state is key to everyday survival. You're always walking on eggshells, never trusting periods of respite, for you know all too well how little it takes to tip the balance. It's a dangerous tango that, in a morbid way, lends itself rather well to gamification. "Monster", the lumbering, troll-like form the violent father assumes in the child's imagination, must be carefully guided and appeased in order to navigate the game world. It'll have you fooled with its ungainly cuteness, only to erupt into (literally) flaming rage the instant it tastes blood. Make no mistake, this is no game for children. The presentation may be beautiful and the core platforming joyous, but the final act in particular takes a turn for the guttingly sinister. Definite recommendation, but be prepared to be challenged emotionally.

21072070.review:
Papo & Yo è un gioco con sfide di livello medio basso, non è un gioco che mette alla prova l'abilità del giocatore, ma è realizzato bene. E' pieno di paesaggi belli da vedere, è divertente in alcuni punti, ma il suo punto di forza è senz'altro la trama. E' uno di quei giochi che tende principalmente a narrare la storia del protagonista, storia che, ahimè, nella realtà è capitata a più persone di quanto possiamo pensare (senza fare spoiler). Se vi piacciono i giochi di "narrativa" dove ci vuole un po' di fantasia per andare avanti, e apprezzare la storia, questo fa per voi. 

6/10

21042938.review:
Un juego indie bastante especial, no esperaba gran cosa y me ha dejado muy buena sensación, vamos allá...

En principio estamos ante un plataformas 3D bastante simple, funciona como un juego infantil donde nos muestran una acción y tenemos que repetirla, además nuestro personaje es un niño, así vamos avanzando por unos escenarios que son completamente atípicos, están basados en una especie de favela llena de casas pero estas no tienen un orden e incluso se pueden desplazar, es decir, el universo creado en este juego no sigue las normas conocidas, da la sensación de que todo es mágico pero se mezcla de forma confusa con un entorno bastante realista gracias a un uso excelente de su motor gráfico. Las mecánicas son también simples, se controla con solo 2 botones aunque más adelante se añaden 2 acciones más. Y todo va mejorando, los escenarios cada vez son más complejos en diseño, nuestro cometido siempre será algo concreto pero toca pensar en resolver puzzles más elaborados, otros personajes hacen aparición y nos van situando un poco en la historia, que hasta ese momento es algo confusa. Destacar la banda sonora del juego, es simplemente excelente, puede gustar más o menos pero "hace" todo lo que una banda sonora debe, buena presencia, acompaña bien, da enfasis a las escenas, logra crear sentimiento, y es bastante dinámica, sin duda uno de los puntos fuertes del juego. Por otro lado el juego es relativamente corto, pero suficiente para lograr todo lo que se propone, sin hacerse tedioso. Decir que el juego está completamente en español pero nos tocará leer casi siempre por que los personajes hablan una especie de dialecto, y lo hacen casi siempre. El final del juego tiene sentido completo y termina de cerrar la historia, sin duda vale la pena terminarlo.

Como véis no le pongo nada negativo al juego, no es un AAA pero cuando un juego te sorprende y entretiene vale mucho la pena recomendarlo.

21016980.review:
I want to see more games like this. In fact, playing this game makes me want to make a game like this. I can tell you exactly what the message of this game was (I won't, for those who haven't yet played it). I can tell you how the characters struggled, how the story affects us in real life, and the core lesson we learn from this game that allows us to better ourselves outside of it.

I believe games like this will define the way people will view this medium in the future. Just as there are books and movies that really have no real value other than being a fun ride, most games today are played simply because they are enjoyable. But when something like this comes around the corner and gives you a story that challenges your opinions and so clearly mirrors the pain we see in our lives, I have to take notice. This is a small story that mirrors the Big Story, and it's asking us to listen and learn. 

So go ahead. Play it with an open mind, and reflect on what you find. This game has a lot to say.

20544555.review: Poignant and creative. The puzzle design is charming and imaginative, evoking a sense of childlike wonder. The allegory is rather blunt, but effective. 20535556.review:
Wow. Finishing this game really brought a lot of self reflective questions on life. Papo & Yo is a short 3 hour game that follows a young boy and a monster. This monster has it's own desires and vices that can be manipulated. However as the game progresses on, the story becomes more chilling and dark. 
Gameplay was minimal classical puzzle platformer. Interactions with the monster was part of the puzzles and I enjoyed how the game interwined the story metaphor directly into your actions.
The environments were decent - for both the urban areas as well as the surreal areas. 

I really enjoyed the story's metaphor and meaning, however my issues with the game were that the puzzles were too short, and parts of the story weren't clear in their meaning.

I would recommend this game : 9/10

20496547.review:
Voilà un superbe jeu indépendant que je ne recommanderai jamais assez. Il se termine assez rapidement : 3 ou 4h tout au plus, mais le dépaysement est total. 

[b]Enigmes : [/b] Pas vraiment difficiles, elles sont surtout là pour pimenter le jeu et faire découvrir d’intéressants petits artifices. L’une des premières énigmes à résoudre introduit des sortes de cartons blancs à déplacer sur le sol, et qui correspondent à des maisons dans le monde physique. Tout fonctionne autour de l’imagination de Quico, le jeune protagoniste, qui essaie d’échapper au stress de son enfance. On tourne des manivelles pour donner des ailes à des bidonvilles, on tire des ficelles pour créer des plateformes, dans des traits 2D « effet dessinés à la main », etc... Vraiment sympathique et  joliment animé !

[b]Bande son : [/b] Très inspirée de la musique africaine, elle est adaptive et s’enrichit au fur et à mesure que vous complétez une énigme. Je suis une grande adoratrice du procédé, qui marche parfaitement pour donner de l’entrain. Il n’y a pas vraiment de thèmes musicaux définis, mais ça ne dérange pas : l’atmosphère est parfaitement décrite.

[b]Histoire : [/b] C’est là l’un des points les plus intéressants. Tout est métaphore, et même sans lire le synopsys, vous comprendrez vite de quoi il s’agit. Je m’étais lancée dans l’aventure sans lire de résumé, personnellement, et l’expérience n’a été que meilleur. Il suffit de lire un peu l’espagnol, d’un côté… « Papo y yo » est facilement replaçable dans son contexte.
On suit un parcours "initiatique" avec un Monstre, ma foi adorable quoiqu'imposant. On l'attire à nous avec des fruits jaune, on l'utilise pour résoudre des énigmes... Mais gare à ce qu'il ne mange pas de grenouilles... Sinon l'enfer se déchaîne. Et c'est douloureux de voir le petit Quico se faire jeter à l'autre bout de la rue et tituber pour se relever. Ces passages là sont vraiment intenses. 
La fin est géniale et tout à fait lucide vu le thème traité. C'est une bonne catharsis. Tout comme pour Journey ou Brothers : a Tale of two sons, on n'en ressort par indifférents.

Petit bonus : La mise en scène et le travail de cadrage. Certains passages sont magistraux et tout en finesse (le gravissement de la tour en surplace, pour ne citer que ça… Magnifique.)

Je recommande ? Bha oui, à 100%.

I really wanted to be able to recommend this game, even if only as an experience. It ticks all the boxes I look for in an interesting game - It’s developed in a country not known for their dev studios, it discusses a very real and very important question and it’s technically well executed. 

But I can’t recommend it as it makes the cardinal error for an interactive experience - it’s plain boring. The theme of parental abuse is overstated and the metaphors crude, but all that could be forgiven if it was only fun to play. As it stands it’s a run-of-the-mill 3d puzzle platformer with unimaginative puzzles with no story telling. 

Should be played by hardcore explorers of the modern gaming medium due to the reasons in the first paragraph or if you need to write about it. Otherwise stay away.

20335389.review: Più che un semplice videogioco, Papo & Yo è un'opera videoludica. Il perchè è presto detto: siamo alle prese con un gioco il cui tutto quello che ci viene posto davanti è una metafora dell'adolescenza, abbastanza difficile aggiungiamo, del game designer Vander Caballera (qui sotto le spoglie del protagonista, un ragazzino di colore di nome Quico). La nostra avventura vedrà muoverci presso le favelas, ma con un tocco magico: vedremo infatti palazzi spostarsi, piccole case che prendono il volo, rimanendo sospese nel vuoto e ingranaggi e chiavi immaginarie con cui interagire. Per tutto il gioco avremo a che fare con Mostro, una enorme bestia apparentemente innocua ma in grado di diventare furiosa una volta ingerite delle rane. Papo & Yo è essenzialmente un platform con enigmi abbastanza semplici da portare a termine ma che, nella sua scarsa longevità che si attesta sulle 3 ore, tenta di raccontare una storia difficile (il padre alcolizzato di Quico) e che lascia dei postumi anche una volta raggiunta l'età adulta, con dei fantasmi interiori ancora da esorcizzare.

20258897.review:
Papo & Yo is a platform/puzzle game by developers Minority about a Brazilian kid, Quico, and his efforts to live alongside a big and dangerous monster, Papo.

Your objective is to guide Quico through the city and paving your own way to the following area each time. In order to do this, you can interact with switches and levers all over the landscape, use your personal toy robot companion (Lula) to activate remote buttons or glide for a short time and, finally, use Papo to your advantage with the right tools. Other sequences from the game revolve instead around fleeing a rampaging Papo and try to calm him down somehow.

It's worth mentioning that Papo & Yo is a very short game, being beatable in under four or five hours, but is't nevertheless a very charming game in its own right and something you should consider buying during sales

20195358.review:
I can honestly say Papo & Yo is one of the most amazing games I have ever played.

The idea is simple, you're a young lad that has to solve puzzles and challenges using the everchanging surroundings.
The gameplay is fairly easy, and everytime it starts to get repetitive something new is added in. However the main reason I'm recommending this game is the incredible storyline behind it.
Without spoiling anything, the storyline shows the problems and fears the boy has excellently, even though it never directly mentions it until the ending.
All of the characters are unique and easy to understand. For example, the monster can be your best friend, and the next minute he's turning against you.
This game grabs you emotionally. After a while you start to connect with the boy and feel how he feels through the parts of the game.

Definite recommendation to anyone who wants to waste 4 hours or so (until you play it again).

20184773.review:
[h1]Nice premise, but the slow pace killed it for me.[/h1]


[b]Gameplay[/b]
All you have to do during the game is jump, push and grab. Not complicated and nicely done. Aiming a jump was at times a bit difficult during the first playthrough. But during the second I was doing well, so I guess it was just a matter of practice.
  

[b]Puzzles[/b]
Mainly easy but every now and then there was one I had to spend more time on. It may get tedious trying to resolve a puzzle when you are in A and go to B to pick something, return to A only to discover that whatever you picked was useless, go to C, return to A and then go to B to continue to the next puzzle.

The puzzles also mark very clearly the different stages in the game, 1 stage // 1 puzzle. For me this was one of the things that impaired the pace of the game.


[b]Cinematics[/b]
During the game the cinematics are generally very well executed, meaning you can still control your character while watching them. I feel this is a very pleasant thing to be able to do.

However, there are times where a short cinematic would have been welcomed instead of a long sequence of doing nothing but waiting ([spoiler]when going to see the shaman, in the floating isle [/spoiler]). It was pretty frustrating being able to do nothing but turn in circles and playing with the camera.

There were times also, where I had the impression that the use of cinematics was unnecessary. There's a puzzle composed of 3 parts near the end of the game ([spoiler]when reviving Lula [/spoiler]) and after each part there is a cinematic telling you that yes! I had beaten that part yay. I know I have done it, I've just did it. Tell me I did well the first time if you want, but not all of them please. 


[b]Characters[/b]
[u]Quico[/u]
Main character, nothing much to say about him.

[u]Lula[/u]
Quico's favorite toy. Her (I'm going to assume she's female) first appearance presents her as a guide, she tells Quico how she can help him and how to make use of the new discovered abilities. But that is the only piece of dialogue she gets during the whole game and she becomes more of a tool than a friend.

[u]Alejandra[/u]
Girl that teases Quico into following her and helps him to deal with Monster.

[u]Monster[/u]
Big lumbering creature that burdens you throughout the game. You must make use of him in order to resolve most of the puzzles.

[spoiler]The death of Lula and Alejandra seemed forced, the character were killed because they acted stupidly, Lula could have dodged Monster and Alejandra shouldn't have stood jumping with and enraged Monster behind her. Although I feel those deaths were important, I believe they could have been implemented differently in order to appear more credible. [/spoiler]


[b]Achievements[/b]
Hats, why?


Although I gather the game has a lot of value I had not a great time playing it, and I'm sorry but a cannot recommend it.

Papo & Yo est un petit jeu de plate-forme poétique et touchant. On incarne Quico, un jeune garçon qui débarque dans un univers imaginaire. Intrigué par une jeune fille il doit parcourir plusieurs niveaux afin de progresser. On saute, on grimpe, on déclenche des mécanismes, on "joue" avec Monstre pour arriver à ses fins, le jeu est assez simple mais très sympa à faire.
Les graphismes sont plutôt jolis, le gameplay on ne peut plus simple, la musique agréable et le scénario tourne autour d'un thème fort illustré entre l'imaginaire de Quico et la réalité des choses.
Je conseille Papo & Yo, c'est un bon jeu, de préférence soldé ou en bundle, car il reste un jeu court qui ne vous donnera pas forcément l'occasion d'y revenir une fois bouclé.

19972807.review:
Sviluppato attorno alla storia d'infanzia del direttore artistico del progetto, il cui padre era un ubriacone manesco, il gioco è una specie di viaggio nella mente di un bambino che vede la sua famiglia subire violenze ingiustificabili.
Nella sua fantasia il padre diventa un mostro -pacifico normalmente, ma iroso e violento una volta che mangia una dele rane sparse per i vari livelli (metafora della bottiglia)- la sorella una specie di ragazza con dei poteri in grado di aiutarlo e il suo fedele robot giocattolo, utile come jetpack.

Il gioco, dipersè, è un blandissimo puzzle game in terza persona, in cui bisogna premere bottoni e indirizzare il mostro in modo da continuare.

Le ambientazioni sono semplicemente bellissime: essendo ambientato nelle favelas e visto con gli occhi di un bambino, il mondo di gioco è coloratissimo e pieno di 'robe strane': case che camminano, che vengono spostate, che si aprono, usate per far ponti, terreni che vanno su, giù, buh e insomma tutte robe post-viaggione che affascinano non poco (complice anche la bellissima, seppure a volte un po' ripetitiva, colonna sonora).

In pratica, pur essendo linearissimo e privo di trovate geniali di gameplay, riesce a distinguersi per il suo stile molto particolare e ad intrattenere fino alla fine senza annoiare (si parla di un paio d'ore, niente di che).

Inutile dire che la storia di fondo è pesante, ma ottimamente raccontata, sopratutto nel finale, straziante.

9/10

19908303.review:
One more game to demonstrate that telling stories without hurting interactivity (generally done using lenghty cinematics) is entirely possible, if not much more powerful.
Here the non-litteral story is distilled progressively through various clues: short dreams allusion, characters relationship and interactions and a few metaphors. It just works.

As for the actual gameplay, this is a kind of ICO-like gameplay, using different mechamisms (with the usual switches, levers and the like...)
The nicest thing about almost all puzzles is the ability to manipulate the scenery, which is almost a living thing.

This game is short (3~4 hours, more if you want to collect stuff), which is not a problem afaic, because why should story-focused games *need* 40 hours to tell a simple story ? Ihmo this game is no shorter nor longer that it should be, but, most importantly, the story ends in a logical but not quite expected way you will not easily forget.

19896224.review:
[h1]В каждой сказке лишь доля сказки[/h1]

[i]Все мы были беззаботными детьми. Не многие об этом помнят, но это так. В некоторых из нас тот самый ребенок до сих пор живет. И ждет интересных приключений, историй, сказок. Эта сказка Стим-сообществом незаслуженно не замечена. А зря. Это необычно поданная, прекрасная история. В своё время произведшая на меня сильное впечатление. До сих пор вспоминаю и всё сжимается внутри. Настолько она глубокая и личностная. Она пройдена мною давным-давно. Мне, для того чтобы пережить её внутри себя, прочувствовать, уложить в голове по местам и найти подходящие слова понадобилось время. Но теперь готова поделиться.[/i]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=199096721
Это история-метафора, красивое сюрреалистичное приключение, насыщенное интересными и несложными загадками, где детали являют собой отражения нашей с вами действительности и конкретных событий из детства одного из создателей игры. Здесь - живой и яркий, звучный и напевный, по-своему уютный, необычный мир красочной сказки. Доля правды в которой тяжелая. Не ко всему, что может произойти во взрослом мире, дети готовы. От некоторых вещей хотелось бы их оградить, защитить, что не всегда возможно.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=199434968
Но мы забываем важное. Дети имеют ценную способность -  жизнелюбие. Они всей своей доброй душой тянутся к красоте, богатой фантазией, забавными выдумками, изобретательными играми наполняют этот мир яркими красками. Пусть и в воображении. Иначе не объяснить появление этого большого, теплого, персиково-молочного монстра. Он лучший друг мальчика. Вы увидите это. Увидите любовь мальчика к нему, связь между ними. Почувствуете его заботу. Между близкими людьми ведь так и должно быть. Вы же знаете - никто не идеален. Мальчик, хоть так мал, но многое чувствует, понимает. Он принимает все изъяны монстра и полный самоотверженности, невиданной храбрости он готов потратить все силы, да хоть пойти на край света, затем, чтобы помочь родному. Беда не приходит одна. А ведь так хотелось бы остановить череду потерь и изменить всё к лучшему.

[b]Для меня эта игра настоящее сокровище. Необычное психологическое приключение, переживание и сопереживание. В виде такой красивой и яркой сказки. От того, наверно, так больно это чувствовать. То, что прячется внутри.[/b]

[code]
Тем кто любит, когда игры оставляют в душе и памяти свой след. Тем, кто способен понять и почувствовать другого, проникнуться ими, или просто наслаждаться временем в такой прекрасной и необычной игре.

Категорически не рекомендовано лицам циничным, чёрствым, лишённым  способности к эмпатии.
Головоломки покажутся простыми, от них удовольствия не получите, а содержания не поймете.[/code]

Думаю, оценка в процентах, дробях и классных предметах не требуется. Игра замечательная, это очевидно.

19836301.review:
Obra Maestra, con una história buenísima tan espeluznanate como enternecedora. Basado en la vida del creador del juego, nos meteremos en su mente, en un viaje por un lugar parecido a las Favelas de Brasil en busca de algo imposible(lo entenderás si lo juegas).
Es un juego de plataformas y puzzles (no muy complicado) en el que el escenario se irá modificando conforme vayamos desvelando los puzzles. Los gráficos són de 10 con unos grafitis de fondo increibles y la banda sonora te hace meterte en la história aún más si se puede. 
Este juego dá para meditar bastante, y si en algún momento de esos en los que inevitablemente te paras a psicoanalizar el juego notas un nudo en la garganta, és normal, somos humanos...

19665139.review: A beautiful and surreal game that explores the topics around chemical abuse in a constructive manner which helps one connect/relate to the characters within it. I'm really enjoying this game because of how it handles this complicated and destructive topic, as I have experienced issues of alcoholism as well as drug abuse within my family. I really wish games like this would have existed when I was a child as it would have helped me cope, fortunately I had a supportive and understanding family. 19636186.review:
Papo & Yo is a great puzzle-platformer. It's far from perfect - imprecise controls and some bugs regarding animations and clipping hamper the experience a little but not to a severe degree. This is a beautiful story, tackling subject matter that is important but very rarely dealt with, especially in video games. The art is colourful and unique. The soundtrack is good. The puzzles are maybe a bit easy but I think the difficulty in playing this comes from the topics at hand rather than progressing through the levels. You're meant to feel good about completing stuff because the story itself is quite dark. Overall, I think Papo & Yo is a great game that does a lot of things right as a puzzle-platformer, and that's impressive because it tells a unique, emotive and personal story while doing so.

8/10

Une bonne claque, voilà ce qu'est [i][b]Papo & Yo[/b][/i]. Du moins pour ceux d'entre nous qui inclinent à la compassion. Sans aller jusqu'à dire qu'elle vous ménera au bord des larmes (encore que, pour les plus émotifs, sait-on jamais), attendez-vous à ce qu'elle vous laisse les joues rouges. On a la gorge sérrée, on est un peu choqué et encore tout frissonnant. Son empreinte est tenace ! Mais, rassurez-vous, l'opération est indolore. En fait, on croirait presque l'avoir rêvée...

Toujours pas convaincu ? Bon, tant pis. Ma dernière cartouche, alors : le premier jeu qui m'est venu à l'esprit en parcourant les favelas de [i][b]Papo & Yo[/b][/i] est l'un des chefs d'oeuvre de [i]Fumito Ueda[/i]. [i][b]Ico[/b][/i], pour ne pas le citer. La même magie. La même innoccence. Le même onirisme. Et si cette référence plus qu'élogieuse ne fait pas sauter les barrières de votre scepticisme, je ne peux plus rien pour vous... Mais sachez que vous passez à côté d'une expérience extraordinaire.

[h1]Verdict : 4,5/5 - Excellent, à acheter les yeux fermés ![/h1]

18952264.review:
This game has its flaws, I won't deny that. Puzzles are often too easy, somewhat repetitive, and not everyone will like the overall game design and favelas. Also, the game is short. 

But it doesn't really matter. This game plays on its strongest card, its story and the way it is presented. Gameplay and design are not bad, but they are here only as a way to tell a very serious story, and not really a pleasant one.
What I find great is the way story is presented - nothing is actually said to the player, often it is just hinted and the player will see what is happening on his own. Using an imagined world, playful world where imagination bends reality to present a darker truth - a trauma - is a great idea. And it works so well, because most of the time you will feel trapped, knowing that something is about to happen, and not really being sure what to do about it.

Spoiler alert :

Showing the father as a monster and at the same time as a friend is probably the hardest thing to do. He saves you when you make a mistake in one puzzle, he plays with you when you have the football, and even laughs when you make a skilled move with it. Seeing this, and knowing what happens in the rest of the game is really unsettling. 

/Spoiler alert

Finishing the game will make you sad, and the overall tone is quite depressing. But it couldn't be different in a story like this. 
Game that is revolving around a serious topic like this in such a clever and emotional way can be forgiven for some flaws. It's a great one, although I'd wait the sale always.

18911977.review:
This is one awesome game! 

I especially love the different ways in which you can change your environment "magically", pulling stairs out of a wall, stapling buildings on top of each other like cardboards, tilting and twisting rows of buildings, it's a highly imaginative and fantastic journey. Even more so because the actual scenery would otherwise be rather depressing to behold (except for the colorful graffittis).  

The gameplay itself demands a bit of action and right timing, additional to the puzzles, but is still not really hard to cope with. Just explore your surroundings and try out a few things, watch what's connected to what, and you'll get it :) There actually are optional hints to discover somewhere within the sceneries most of the times too. 

Each level is a bit different from the ones before, getting more and more dream-like, and a few times suddenly turning into short sequences of nightmares that are symbolic but obvious at the same time, and will leave a lasting impression. The soundtrack does it's best to underline the atmosphere and never gets annoying. 

It might not be a very "long" game, and it makes you wish for even more levels and more of all these amazing ideas how one can toy in a virtual dream-like reality with an otherwise ordinary cityscape, but it's still well worth it's price :)

18867532.review:
Papo & Yo lets all of its secrets go from the start, and that doesn't seem to matter. The lack of mystery surrounding Quico and Monster's relationship doesn't seem to diminish the power of its imagery at all. Where in other games the meaningful juxtapositions would act as a big reveal, Papo & Yo uses them to ram its point home even further, to remind the player of the context of the their actions. The puzzle solving convention of only looking for a way to move forward has been twisted, putting the player into the position of a child who's taken on fixing his parent as a necessity to righting his life without ever considering an alternative.

It is perhaps due to this forgone conclusion being the cornerstone of the plot that it was so difficult to invest in the secondary characters. That concept is so central to the plot that Alejandra and Lula don't end up being fully developed characters so as much as representations of the mental roadblocks in between Quico and the inevitable truth about his relationship with Monster. Even the whimsically beautiful visuals and the complexity of the puzzles themselves take a backseat to Quico's journey toward some kind of meaningful realization; they are blotted out entirely by the story of a young man and his father.

18255298.review:
[h1]A volte la mente maschera la realtà e crea un'alternativa al peggio[/h1]
Esistono giochi che ci aiutano a passare il tempo, giochi che mettono alla prova le nostre capacità logiche o reattive, e ci sono giochi che raccontano una storia. Questo, signori miei, è uno di quelli e racconta una storia triste come pochi hanno fatto.
Il protagonista di questa storia è Quico, ragazzino braziliano che si ritrova all'interno delle favela dopo aver attraversato un misterioso tunnel luminoso all'interno del suo armadio, dove si era rifugiato per nascondersi da un "mostro". Proseguendo all'interno di questi quartieri multicolore incontreremo una ragazzina, con dei disegni sulla pelle stile sciamana, che dovrete inseguire per poter proseguire nella vostra avventura. Faremo anche l'incontro di Lula, l'amico robot che ci permetterà di fare un doppio salto e che ci aiuterà ad azionare gli interruttori più lontani, e del mostro, che ci accompagnerà fino alla fine ma che dovremo far muovere noi utilizzando dei frutti sparsi per la mappa ed evitare che mangi le rane se non vogliamo farlo infuriare.
Il gioco non è molto duraturo, si parla di meno di 5 ore ma se volete completare gli obbiettivi dovrete rigiocarlo, poi ha un gameplay molto semplice, ma non per questo brutto o noioso, e gli indovinelli sono veloci ma non tutti, alcuni richiedono un pò più di ingegno e pazienza. Perciò, come vedete, non ci sono troppi punti differenti da tanti altri indiegame; in fondo si parla sempre di giochi dalla durata limitata con puzzle risolvibili senza esagerati problemi. Quello che lo differenzia e lo rende un gioco d'impatto però è proprio la storia che vi racconta, la trama che si spiega dinnanzi a voi e che si fà sempre più chiara arrivando verso la fine. Sarà difficile che non rimaniate colpiti da un punto forte come questo.
Per concludere, consiglio davvero questo puzzle/adventure perchè sà differenziarsi nel mare degli Indiegame rendendolo un titolo indimenticabile.

Als ich mir das Spiel gekauft habe, wusste ich rein gar nichts. Ich dachte es geht eben um diesen Jungen der mit einem Monster unterwegs ist und mich würde etwas Jump 'n' Run - Sidescrollermäßiges erwarten, aber Pustekuchen! Es kommt GANZ anders als man denkt. Und das ist auch gut so! Ich hatte keinerlei Erwartungen an dieses Spiel und habe doch so viel mehr bekommen, als ich zunächst vermutet hatte. Eine GRANDIOSE Erfahrung! :) Und eine klare Kaufempfehlung! 

Mit nicht einmal fünf Stunden ist Papo & Yo sehr kurz, aber das ist genau richtig. Es ist kurz und knackig und ist genau das was es sein will, einfach nur genial! Sein Geld und das, was das Spiel einem vermittelt, ist es auf jeden Fall wert. Ich werde es definitiv noch einmal durchspielen! :)

18227226.review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*][b]Game Name:[/b] Papo & Yo
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2013
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Adventure; Puzzle-Platformer; Atmospheric; Short  
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 4-7 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Game atmosphere connoisseurs; Casual gamers
[/list]

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Papo & Yo[/b] is a highly atmospheric, third-person puzzle-platformer that will embark you on an imaginative and enthralling adventure.  The game is quite short; but it boasts an undeniable charm that makes every hour played, however few, rather enjoyable.   

The metaphorical narrative is mostly told through the emotion in the atmosphere and the styles of the puzzles, rather than lines and lines of dialogue.  The enchanting soundtrack and imaginative environments serve to create a stimulating atmosphere that tells the story through its interpretation.   This approach to storytelling in video games can be hit-or-miss, but I think [b]Papo & Yo[/b] is a good example of how it can be quite effective.

The gameplay boils down to three-dimensional, environment-based puzzles that can be solved mostly through exploration and experimentation.  Due to this style of gameplay, the game is quite linear.  It will usher you from one location to the next, each with its own puzzle to solve.  The puzzles are mostly challenging without becoming needlessly frustrating, although some of them can be a little tricky to figure out without any hints or direction.

As I alluded to, the game is fairly short— topping out at a handful of hours, depending on how quickly you can solve the puzzles.  To add a little supplemental depth, there is also a decent set of collectibles to search for (i.e.: hats) that can add a little more to the game for players who choose to pursue that.  That said, I personally felt the length of the game was perfect and that it helped create a [i]short-and-sweet[/i] appeal to the game, instead of allowing it to grow stale.

I thoroughly enjoyed my playthrough of [b]Papo & Yo[/b].  I definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys atmospheric games and/or puzzle-platformers in this style.  Further, I feel this is a game that can also appeal to gamers who don’t normally play this type of genre, due to the fact that it is intriguing and short enough to give someone a taste of something different without overburdening them.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

-----------------GAME MADE IN HEAVEN!!!!!!!-----------------

Was mit einem fragwürdigen "Rätselspiel" beginnt, endet in einen der "schönsten" Momente, die ich jemals in einen Indietitel, wenn nicht sogar in einen Videospiel gesehen habe! 
Man kann so viel in das Spiel hineininterpretieren. Vorallem selbst nach dem spielen denkt man immer noch darüber nach, da Fragen offen bleiben oder man selber sich die Antwort noch sucht bzw zurecht interpretiert.

18059796.review:
Em Papo & Yo somos apresentados a dois mundos que nunca vi antes em jogos eletrônicos. De um lado temos a dura realidade das favelas, com seus casebres empilhados, seu esgoto exposto, seus dramas, um protagonista criança e negro. Do outro lado, temos esse mesmo universo reformado com um olhar lúdico que apenas a imaginação seria capaz de conceber. Foram dois mundos que gostei de verem representados em meu monitor. Aquelas construções, os grafites, conheci de perto, do lado da minha casa, ainda que não tenham sido minha infância.

Apenas por essa representação, o primeiro título da autoral Minority Media já merecia destaque. Por seu aspecto interativo e tridimensional, os jogos eletrônicos permitem um grau de imersão e, consequentemente, empatia que poucas mídias conseguem (talvez a infinita liberdade da literatura e das imagens mentais que você mesmo conjura). Aqui, você se coloca no lugar do outro em um ambiente esquecido da sociedade.

Mas Papo & Yo vai além ao executar alterações nesse cenário que brincam com nossos conceitos de cenários em mundos virtuais. Nada é o que parece ser e nada é o que pode ser. Quico, nosso protagonista, viaja por uma versão Alice no País das Maravilhas desta favela, alterada pelos riscos da mente em sua busca por uma fuga da realidade. Outra comparação aceitável seria com o filme O Labirinto do Fauno, em que outra criança também se refugia dos horrores da vida cotidiana em uma realidade paralela sedutora, mas igualmente perigosa.

Você vaga por esta favela onírica em busca de um novo deslumbre, uma nova maneira jamais vista de superar seus obstáculos. A própria perspectiva se torna um brinquedo nas mãos da história e o resultado final é puro encanto.

Entretanto, Papo & Yo não é um jogo feliz. Por trás deste universo lírico se esconde um horror extremamente cruel e real. Não apenas real no sentido do mundo real que transparece no jogo, mas real no sentido que infelizmente ocorre e ocorre com muita frequência no nosso mundo real. Não sei se ainda existe alguém que tenha ouvido falar do jogo e não sabe sobre seu tema principal, mas, na dúvida não irei mencioná-lo. Prepare-se para o impacto emocional.

O verdadeiro protagonista do jogo é o Monstro. Uma criatura que você não controla, mas depende dela. Uma criatura que não controla nem a si mesma e pode virar, de repente, seu único inimigo dentro do jogo. Com sentimentos ambíguos em relação a ele, você traça uma jornada procurando entender o que é o Monstro e como lidar com ele. As respostas são todas amargas. É um dos raros personagens de jogos eletrônicos que você sai da história incerto sobre como proceder. Pena, afeto, medo, ódio? Tudo isso?

Usando de poesia, uma jogabilidade deliciosa e uma trilha sonora arrebatadora, Papo & Yo consegue abordar um assunto pesado e sem soluções fáceis.

E ainda reclamam da falta de diversidade temática nos jogos eletrônicos. Pois reclamam de boca cheia.

Originalmente publicado em: http://blog.retinadesgastada.com.br/2015/09/jogando-papo-yo.html

18043538.review:
Papo & Yo is a beautiful game with a dark side. You play a kid who uses an imaginary world to escape his alcoholic dad. In this fantasy world you can survive any fall, you can jump longer and higher and, most importantly, you can use hidden mechanisms to alter the city around you.

I loved this game. The story is hooking, the scenarios are just beautiful and the game mechanics are simple but manage to stay interesting. Through a world that follows kid-logic, you'll get to find the moster endearing when it protects you, or extremely scary when it hunts you down. A peek on how the world of child abuse may feel like. 

The puzzles are pretty easy and intuitive, and the platformer part of the game was attractive and smooth even to me (I HATE platformers), so even if this is not your typical kind of game, I'd tell you to give it a go: you'll be greatly surprised.

17952350.review:
Not perfect but a game that should be played. 

Papo & Yo is about a boy with an abusive father who escapes into a fantasy world where he needs the help of a brutish monster named Papo to help you slove platforming puzzles.

This game is very pretty.  bright, colorful, and atmospheric.  The tone and art style gradually changes as the story progresses and grows darker.  

Most of the game involves using Papo to help you get around by lifting obsticals or tossing you to high ledges and then you need to manipulate the enviroment so Papo can follow.  There are also slugs that Papo really loves but cause him to go into a rage and attack anything near him including you.  Sometimes you need to keep him away from the slugs sometimes you need to let him eat them so you can solve a puzzle.  It's hear were your relationship with the monster begins to mirror your relationship with your abusive father.  

The game does have some flaws.  its not the longest game, sometimes the physics are a little wonky and there could be a bit more variety in the game play but its not enough to be a deal breker

This is a fairly simple puzzle platformer with appealing visuals and does a good job of letting the narrative and charm bleed into the gameplay.  It also explores a topic not offten tackled in video games.

17544693.review:
Le thème est [b]original[/b], c'est d'ailleurs ce qui m'a poussé à acheter ce jeu. [b]Mais chut !!![/b] Je ne dévoilerai rien à ce propos dans cette évaluation, et vous conseille d'éviter de trop vous informer avant achat. Je pense qu'il vaut mieux ne rien savoir, et se laisser porter par l'aventure pour le découvrir. 

En lui-même, ce jeu est simple et distrayant. 

Simple, car il est composé d'énigmes qui ne demandent qu'une réflexion très limitée. Décevant ? Non, car en fait, ce ne sont pas vraiment des énigmes. Disons que le chemin est parsemé de "boutons" qu'il faudra trouver et actionner. Les effets engendrés sont souvent surprenants, agréables. Certes, au final, on en revient toujours à ouvrir une porte ou lever une barrière, mais ce jeu le fait avec classe. 

Simple, car il suffit de se laisser guider et suivre le chemin indiqué. Pas de route bis. Pas de recoins à fouiller. Pas d'items à collecter. Pas de réelle liberté. Ce jeu est-il donc terne ? Non, c'est juste reposant - car paradoxalement, j'adore flâner dans les routes bis truffées d'items cachés à collectionner. Ici on suit une histoire, on se laisse porter par l'aventure, les mécanismes du jeu, on découvre cet environnement qui a une certaine identité. Voilà pourquoi je qualifie ce jeu de distrayant : il ne casse pas trois pattes à un canard, ce n'est pas la révélation de l'année, il n'a pas une "âme" comme certains jeux, mais sa simplicité associée à son originalité le rendent appréciables. 

Pour ma part, je ne regrette ni mon achat (durant les soldes par contre), ni les 3 heures que j'ai passées dessus avant de le boucler. 

A faire un soir, au calme, tranquille dans le canapé.

17472886.review:
Artystyczna opowieść. Piękna w swoim zaangażowaniu tragicznym tematem. Uroczo wykreowany świat mieni się żywymi kolorami w słońcu i przybiera szaro-bury odcień w deszczu. W tle przygrywa nastrojowa muzyka doskonale odzwierciedlająca południowoamerykańskie realia. Kierujemy małym chłopcem, rozwiązujemy proste logiczne zagadki. W podróży towarzyszy nam tajemnicza dziewczyns (jako przewodnik), potwór (na którego poczynania wywieramy wpływ podrzucając mu różne przedmioty) i Lula (mały robocik, ulubiona zabawka Quico). Rozgrywka nie jest szczególnym wyzwaniem, poziom trudności nie odrywa nas od wchłaniania magicznego świata przedstawionego. Za pomocą narysowanych kredą elementów nasz protagonista przemieszcza pokaźne fragmenty otoczenia (budynki a nawet większe ich skupiska). Można powiedzieć, że poza sytuacjami gdy ekran przybiera piekielną barwę panuje sielanka.
I tak w sumie to wygląda. W takich grach jak Papo & Yo ważne jest jednak coś więcej niż sam gameplay. Kolorowy, magiczny, dziecięcy świat kontrastuje z rodzinnym problemem alkoholowym. Wzruszające, refleksyjne, dobrze wykonane w każdym aspekcie. Oderwać się od odmóżdzających strzelanek i uruchomić tam czasem emocje.

17454727.review:
[h1]◆ 雰囲気重視[/h1]
少年キコくんが不思議な世界を冒険する三人称アクションパズル｡
頼りになるおもちゃのロボットと､見た目は怖いが大人しい怪物の
助力を得ながら､謎の少女の導きに従って散策していく｡
そもそもこの世界は何なのか､行く先には何があるのか……｡
まるで絵本を読み進めていくような､アーティスティックなゲーム｡

[h1]◆ 児童文学感[/h1]
ゲーム内の街並みは､作者が幼い頃に見てきた貧困街を参考に
ファンタジー調にしたものとのことで､雑然としつつも幻想的｡
例えば､ネジを回せば建物に羽が生えて飛んで行ったり､
箱を持ち上げれば付近の建物まで持ち上がったり､
パズルを解いていく工程が視覚的にダイナミックで気持ち良く､
自然とその美しい世界観に惹き込まれていってしまう｡
残機などという概念はなく､制限時間の類に追われることもないので
ゲームの難易度自体は易しいが､最終的にはシリアス路線になるため
癒やしだけを求めて買うと後々辛くなるかも｡
ゲーム性は単調と言えば単調だが､世界観を楽しむ作品故に問題なし｡
2周目は基本的に同じことの繰り返しになるので多少辛いものの
5～7時間ほどで比較的手軽に全実績を獲得できる｡

[h1]◆ エンディングは意味不明だが……[/h1]
エンディングの意味がわからず､プレイヤーに解釈丸投げゲーかと思い
釈然としなかったので考察等のキーワードでググってみたところ
全てが腑に落ちると共に､改めて作品のテーマの重さを
痛感させられることになった｡むしろこのググる作業をこそ
作者は望んでいたようにすら思う｡
以下､未プレイ者が読んだらきっと後悔する全力全開ネタバレ｡
[spoiler]
[h1]◆ 元ネタは作者の幼少期の実体験[/h1]
Papo & Yoは南米の言葉で「パパとボク」という意味だそうで
実はストア画像の時点で盛大にネタバレしている｡
作者はアルコール依存症の父親から日常的に虐待を受けており
おもちゃやゲームで遊んでいる時だけ現実逃避ができていたという｡
作者の体験談から推察するに､ゲーム中の怪物は
彼の実際の父親よりも随分と良心的に描かれているように思う｡
中盤以降､怪物の危険性を思い知らされつつ､それでも
怪物を踏み台にしてジャンプしないと行けない箇所があったりするが､
これもただのアクションではなくメタファーを含んでいると解釈すると
意味合いが変わってくる｡サッカーボールを投げ返してくれるのは
作者と父親の数少ない楽しかった頃の記憶なのかもしれないと考えると
悲しくて切ない気持ちになる｡最終盤､怪物を奈落の底に葬り去るシーンは
作者が16歳の時の､父親の葬儀の様子を元にしているそうで､
これを終えて現実世界へと戻っていくという物語の帰結は
主人公のキコとその投影である作者自身が
トラウマと向き合い克服していく決意を意味するものとのこと｡
散々な目に遭いながらも最後まで怪物を治そうと奔走するキコの姿に
作者自身の優しさと､叶わなかった理想に対する無念さが窺い知れる｡
現在､作者には幼い子供が居り､平穏無事に暮らしている｡
彼はこの作品を通じて､自身の幼少期を追体験してもらい､
何かを感じ取ってほしいと語る｡作者の人生の最も濃密な部分を
ゲームという形で見事に凝縮させた本作は
また一つ自分の中で心に残る作品となった｡[/spoiler]

17381292.review:
Возможны спойлеры. 

Papo & Yo - красивая в своей простоте игра. Она прекрасно погружает в атмосферу детской фантазии и снов. Дарит чувство искреннего восторга своей непосредственностью и проникает под кожу будоража чувства своей музыкой. 

Это история маленького мальчика по имени Кико (Quico). У него нелегкая судьба, она связана с тираном отцом, который часто в пьяном угаре приходит в ярость и бьет своего сына, нанося ему не только телесные повреждения, но и душевные. И именно эти травмы мы наблюдаем в игре, погружаясь в выдуманный Кико мир, где он пытается скрыться от проблем, а в дальнейшем найти средство сделать отца прежним. 

В своем воображении Кико использует рисунки механизмов и рычагов, нарисованных мелом для передвижения. Иногда это может быть лестница, иногда уступ, иногда дом, а иногда целые массивы строений которые поворачиваются под любым нужным ему углом. В качестве подсказок нам дают... Картонную коробку где подробно описаны действия и схемы, а для того чтобы увидеть все это, нам нужно одеть ее себе на голову ) 
Вообще, в игре много всяких странностей, и по началу игроку мало что понятно. Это самое понимание, а точнее адаптация к миру происходит после некоторого времени проведенного в игре. Лично я настолько "залипла", что потеряла счет времени и просидела за ней до самого конца. К своему сожалению я обнаружила, что она не настолько продолжительна как мне хотелось бы, что с другой стороны является верным и правильным решением.
Во время своего путешествия мы встречаем неизвестную девочку, которая помогает нам подсказывая путь. Мне кстати кажется, что я поняла кто она, но промолчу.
Чуть позже нам встречается монстр из снов Кико. Он большой, сильный и добродушный, и у него есть две страсти: ягоды и лягушки. Объевшись ягод он засыпает, но съев лягушку его охватывает гнев, в котором он не помня себя может навредить Кико. В дальнейшем мы понимаем, что монстр это отец Кико в его представлении, а лягушки - алкоголь, отравляющий сознание.
Есть еще и игрушечный робот Лула, она висит на спине у мальчика и дает ему дополнительный толчок при прыжке, а так же активирует те части механизма, до которых он не может добраться самостоятельно.

На протяжении игры мы словно продвигаемся сквозь воспоминания Кико, иногда нам показывают картины из его прошлого, которые он тщательно старается забыть. И очень быстро его путь из веселого и беззаботного превращается в грустную историю, несколько депрессивную, но все равно прекрасную. 
Некоторые особенности игры действительно меня зацепили. И я, как человек крайне эмоциональный, очень сильно прониклась сочувствием к этому ребенку, к его ранам и его хрупкому мирку, который своей незаполненностью словно олицетворяет его переживания, страхи и психологическое состояние. 

В конце я даже всплакнула от переизбытка эмоций. И в очередной раз скажу, мне действительно жаль, что таких игр выпускают очень и очень мало в сравнении с другими ежегодными проектами, которые "пипл хавает" не смотря ни на что.

17018006.review:
Put simply: Papo & Yo is one of those games that gives you something to think about (if you're paying attention). Those just looking for another brain-bending puzzle game on the level of Portal will likely be dissapointed as the puzzles only seem to stump those who don't immediately grasp the full scope of what can be done with the gameplay mechanics (raises hand...). If a pretty puzzler with a unique aesthetic and healthy dose of introspection into how children deal with fear and familial violence is your bag, then buy and download now. (No that's not a spoiler. The live action trailer and the opening dedication when you start the game pretty much give it away.)

Without trying to sound hyperbolic, the game's message might be too on the nose for those players who have dealt with the issues being explored, but then again that might be the whole point here. That aside, I often found myself stopping to admire the simplistic yet beautiful visuals of what I assume was inspired by the infamous favelas of Brazil. More than once I stopped to take screenshots of the various pieces of street art (to call it graffiti would be to sell it short) on display, something I haven't done since my time with Spec Ops: The Line. 

It's a short game and only sticks around long enough to make its point known (about 3 hours) which might turn some players off. If however you're someone who likes to repeatedly ask themselves, "What is the game trying to tell me here?" during a playthrough, I think you'll find a lot to love (and hate, but in the good, engaging kind of way.)

16923749.review:
I'd like to put an asterisk on my recommendation. It is a good game, in my opinion worth buying and playing, and I enjoyed every moment of it.

However, here's the caveat: it's not a challenging game. It's very much Railroading: the game, with a few obstacles to get you more invested in it (still better than "Dear Esther"). To me, that's not a problem, because the game's atmosphere, music and visuals are excellently designed, and the brazilian voices (I'm assuming it's brazilian) are a delight to listen to. For some however, this might be a problem. 

If you need a proper challenge to enjoy a game, this is definitely not for you. As mentioned, the puzzles are simple; just find the next switch to open the path to the next setpiece. A few puzzles require a bit of fiddling to solve, in particular a basketball court that took me a few reloads to get back on track, but it didn't make me use my head as a scratching post.

It's a short game; as you can see from my play counter, it was completed in less than 4 hours. It's short, but sweet, and I'd argue that's its selling point; it doesn't drag out the overarching theme about substance abuse ad infinitum, and while the ending didn't grab me, that's not a fault of the game. It's nice to see such work put into telling the message of substance abuse seen through the eyes of a young boy, as it is quite a serious problem in the world today, and the game is just beautiful, as I've already said. Buy it for the experience, not for the challenge.

16846764.review:
A gorgeous and interesting 3D puzzle platformer with a subtle story which is told through the gameplay. Papo & Yo offers up a great looking, fun game with a depth of story substance which never once interrupts the great gameplay. The game treats the player with enough respect to draw their own conclusions and is never overt or crude in its approach. It's a hands-off story which compliments the gameplay, and it's wrapped up in a gorgeous world with good mechanics.

[h1]Highlights[/h1]

The best parts of Papo & Yo come from it's strong commitment to the story in the form of real elements rather than text or purely cutscenes. Everything is focused around that, and at times gameplay choices have been limited or altered to compliment the subject, and vice versa. There's one puzzle, for example, where your goal is to move the Monster to a new position while he's sleeping on a wooden centipede. After figuring out the mechanics of the puzzle and moving him into position, he catches a frog which results in your progress being reset and having to start again. In any other game this would be frustrating and forced, but here it's a subtle allegory of trying again and finding an alternative approach after you fail in the name of progress. Even things like the music of each puzzle serve to compliment the spirit of the story.

If you remove the story though, Papo & Yo is still a very good 3D puzzle platformer on its own, and just playing through it without thinking about the content matter is pleasant fun.

* The art style and set design is another compelling reason to play this title, the streets and buildings have a strong South African/Brazilian look and feel, and add to the fantasy
* Puzzle design occasionally feels wobbly, but for the most part is unique, interesting and wonderfully different to the approach most other games would take

[h1]Mistakes[/h1]

There are no real gameplay problems to speak of in Papo & Yo, and everything is done pretty well. However, there are some minor annoyances and technical problems that will jar the experience for some, but overall wont really take away from the experience as a whole.

* Movement and controls are a little less responsive than I'd like, and it's common to fall off a ledge or have to repeat a step a few times to get something right
* Due to the unique design and style of some puzzles, it's sometimes unclear what the game wants of the player next, despite the useful help system
* For some, the story is too obvious and the flashbacks give too much away at the start of the game for the ending to have any impact

[h1]Recommendations[/h1]

Priced at £10.99/12.99€/$14.99 at the time of review, Papo & Yo doesn't feel overpriced, but is very short, with just 4-6 hours play time. It routinely goes on sale for -75% or less, and waiting for a sale to get the most value out of this one is a good idea.

There's an achievement for playing through the game without using any of the hint boxes, and another for collecting all the hats in the game which only becomes available after completing the game once. These two achievements make playing through the game again some time in the future more compelling [spoiler]https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=49&v=U9_0Q9CAU1w[/spoiler]

* Looking for similar 3D Puzzle Platforming with story elements? [spoiler]You may also want to check out [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/224460/]Contrast[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/sub/7932/]The Portal Series[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/205910/]Tiny and Big: Grandpa's Leftovers[/url] and the second version of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/239430/]Q.U.B.E.[/url][/spoiler]
* Papo & Yo means [spoiler]Father & I[/spoiler]

16780278.review:
Papo & Yo, primer juego del estudio canadiense [b]Minority Media Inc[/b], en su salida en 2012, el juego fue exclusivo de la consola PS3 y se encontraba disponible en formato digital en PlayStation Store, más tarde, el juego fue portado a PC en 2013 y distribuido en formato digital mediante Steam.

[h1][b]HISTORIA[/b][/h1]
El juego narra las aventuras de Quico, un chico que vive en un barrio de favelas de alguna ciudad de Brasil, el cual tiene como amigo a Papo, un monstruo de aspecto temible que sin embargo no representa peligro alguno para Quico, pero Papo tiene un problema, lo que más le gusta en esta vida es comer ranas venenosas, pero cuando las come, Papo cambia radicalmente su forma de ser, atacando sin contemplaciones a cualquiera que se cruce en su camino, sea amigo o no.

Durante la historia también conoceremos a Lula, un robot que siempre va en la espalda de Quico y que le ayudará a superar distintos obstáculos que ira encontrando en su camino, así como a Alejandra, una niña de la misma edad de Quico, que hará todo lo posible por ayudarle a encontrar una cura para Papo, aunque al principio se mostrará distante y esquiva.

Hasta aquí un resumen del argumento a simple vista, como el juego trata un tema muy delicado y tampoco quiero desvelar gratuitamente a nadie el trasfondo real del argumento del juego, dejo mi opinión al respecto en el siguiente [b]spoiler:[/b]

[spoiler]Ante todo, hay que tener en cuenta que es un juego autobiográfico de [b]Vander Caballero[/b], y ese es precisamente el punto más fuerte del juego, la forma en la que se trata un tema tan delicado y difícil como es el [b]alcoholismo[/b] de un progenitor, que por desgracia, casi siempre suele ir acompañado de [b]malos tratos[/b] al resto de la familia, para mi, merece todo mi respeto y admiración, ya que no es algo que sea fácil de dar a conocer en el entorno social que a uno le rodea y menos aún, realizar un juego sobre dicha temática dejando claro desde un principio, que tiene mucho de autobiográfico cuando eres una persona bastante conocida en tu sector profesional.

Por otra parte, la forma en que el guión nos muestra la verdadera relación que hay entre Quico y Papo, es formidable, pequeñas pinceladas que poco a poco desvelan la realidad de Quico y como este, a pesar de todo, hace todo lo que está a su alcance para ayudar con su grave problema a su querido Papo, mostrando que el ser humano es capaz de realizar los actos más aberrantes, pero al mismo tiempo, es capaz de lograr las mayores proezas y más importante aún, perdonar lo imperdonable y seguir adelante.[/spoiler]

[h1][b]DESARROLLO[/b][/h1]
[b]Papo & Yo[/b] nos plantea un recorrido que mezcla magistralmente las plataformas más puras y clásicas con la resolución de puzzles, los cuales no presentan reto alguno, ya que todos son bastante obvios y fáciles de resolver, además, contamos con unas cajas repartidas a lo largo de los escenarios que componen el juego, que ofrecen varias pistas sobre como resolver cada situación.

Esto podría parecer un impedimento para el juego, pero hay que tener en cuenta que el objetivo principal del juego es desvelarnos su historia poco a poco, y precisamente por eso, la dificultad a la hora de avanzar por los escenarios no resulta un reto, porque esa no es su intención.

Para resolver los puzzles y poder avanzar en el juego, habrá que usar al robot Lula el cual es capaz de activar interruptores a distancia y dotar a Quico del importante "salto doble", por otra parte, la interactuación con el entorno es la nota del juego, ya sea activando distintos engranajes dibujados con tiza situados en las paredes, tirar de cuerdas para revelar una plataforma nueva, activar llaves, todo esto con el fin de avanzar junto a Papo, el cual tiene un papel importante a la hora de resolver ciertos puzzles, puesto que habrá que hacer que se sitúe sobre ciertos interruptores, usar su barriga para alcanzar ciertos lugares o darle ranas venenosas para que se transforme y otras situaciones que descubriréis a lo largo de la aventura.

[h1][b]MOTOR GRÁFICO / DISEÑO ARTÍSTICO[/b][/h1]
El motor gráfico usado por [b]Minority Media Inc[/b] no es otro que el excelente y reconocido [b]Unreal Engine 3[/b], aunque todos sabemos lo que este motor puede dar de si, el trabajo realizado con el port a PC es sencillamente perfecto, el juego ofrece muy buenos juegos de luces y sombras (sobre todo cuando Papo come ranas venenosas), un framerate constante, presentar en pantalla el mundo colorido (y a veces plagado de sombras) donde se desarrolla la historia sin presentar en ningún momento tediosos tiempos de cargas, rotaciones de cámara suaves, un motion blur fantástico y otros detalles que hacen de [b]Papo & Yo[/b] una experiencia visual increíble.

En cuanto al diseño artístico, el juego nos presenta un mundo colorido, muy bien trabajado en cuanto a diseños de personajes y escenarios se refiere, nada desentona o estropea la atmósfera del juego, todo encaja perfectamente; por otra parte, el estudio ha sabido reflejar muy bien el entorno necesario para una historia como la que se narra en este juego, aún estando ambientado en una favela, el que un niño sea el protagonista, hace que se nos muestra una versión más amable y colorida de las favelas de lo que en realidad son.

Mención a parte merecen los graffitis que aparecen en las paredes a lo largo del juego, el tomar una captura de cada uno de ellos, debería ser obligatorio dada su belleza.

[h1][b]BANDA SONORA / SONIDOS FX[/b][/h1]
La BSO de este juego es tan buena como el diseño artístico, creada por [b]Brian D’Oliveira,[/b] hay presente una mezcla de instrumentos muy diversos como flautas, guitarras, violines, chelos..., en la que se fusionan melodías, ritmos y sonidos de distintos países sudamericanos, pero también tiene influencias de África e India y hasta de la primera música barroca europea.

[h1][b]COLECCIONABLES / EXTRAS / REJUGABILIDAD[/b][/h1]
Una vez terminado el juego, en la segunda partida podremos conseguir 25 sombreros para Quico durante la aventura, eligiendo el que queramos en cualquier momento de entre los encontrados hasta el momento, siendo el único aliciente real para volver a disfrutar del juego.

[h1][b]VALORACIÓN FINAL[/b][/h1]
Papo & Yo es un juego distinto, donde no prima tanto la jugabilidad (que es muy buena) o la duración, que apenas es de 4 ó 5 horas, sino que lo que aquí realmente importa es la historia que se cuenta y lo que ello conlleva, lo que nos hace sentir y pensar.

No es un juego para los más pequeños de la casa, no entenderían bien su trasfondo, este juego está dirigido a un público adulto que sepa apreciar lo que oculta y como se desvela, toda una muestra de como se puede hacer un videojuego de temática adulta sin introducir en ningún momento violencia, sexo o drogas de forma gratuita, algo que aunque no es lo normal en el sector, si es muy de agradecer.

[h1][b]NOTA: 10 sobre 10[/b][/h1]


[h1][b]SINCERO AGRADECIMIENTO[/b][/h1]
Agradecer a [b]Vander Caballero[/b] el valor y coraje que ha tenido al realizar este juego, él es una muestra de lo que pretende enseñar este juego, refugiándose de una realidad que ningún niño debería vivir, con videojuegos como Super Mario Bros., no sólo consiguió eludir el monstruo que en su casa cada día le atemorizaba, sino que también descubrió la que hoy en día en su profesión, permitiendole crecer como persona y compartir con los demás sus duras experiencias mediante este videojuego, demostrando que sólo si uno mismo quiere, el pasado, es un pesado monstruo que se puede dejar atrás para seguir adelante.

16568807.review:
Papo and Yo originally invented for the PS3 is renowned for it's role as an empathy game. One of the few games on the market aimed specifically to evoke an emotional empathy response from it's player, this is largely because the developer Vander Caballero found here... http://www.weareminority.com/ has decided to use the expression of game art to exercise his own personal demons.

While it was largely inspired by the game 'ICO' there is a more larger similarity to the game 'Among the Sleep' and 'Brothers' in the way that the developer has chose to use cute characters and backgrounds to handle some adult touchy subjects such as alcoholism and physical abuse.

The story revolves around a young Brazillian boy named Quico who cowers in his bedroom closet while his father storms past. He then escapes into a magical slum world he creates where he finds a girl Alejandra who at first sees Quico as a threat, but who eventually aids him in his adventure. He is also joined by a robot toy named 'Lulu' which always has his back and a monster who is usually somewhat love-able who sleeps a lot and you can have fun bouncing off his belly, but when he ever has French Cuisine he launches himself into a rampaging devil. All set out on a magical journey which ends both bitter and sweet.

The amazing slum background which would have Salvador Dali jumping up and down on a cat in excitement is sheer magical and enchanting to explore. While the puzzles aren't that sophisticated, some can be challenging on the basis that they are slightly vague and will have you scurrying either for a hint box placed in the game which you can don on and run around in or for a youtube walk through. In truth you've probably just missed something obvious like the fact that you can move the buttons as well as press them.

Your first run through will be greeted with a metaphor of what happened in the developers personal life, you will also be challenged to go through the entire game a second time, this time without the need of a hint box and the further realization that 25 collectible hats have been hidden in the game.

So what are the metaphors in the game? Unlike other games which often be coy about the matter and leave it open the gamer's digression. The developer here wants his story to be told. (Spoiler Alert) The developer (quico) grew up with an abusive father (monster) who was an alcoholic due to the fact that he had accidentally hit someone in his car and killed them. The developer's mother (lulu) always was there for Quico until one day when the monster seemed to have killed lulu (severe abuse) eventually she did get better though through the help of Alejandra (a mixture of the developers first love and his literal little brother) .They at first tried reasoning and hiding the frogs (alcohol) which was making the monster angry. But after one severe abusive bout which took the life of Alejandro Quico eventually realises that he cannot cure this monster and instead has to let this monster go from his life for good. As Quico grows up he drifts away from his dependance of Lulu and pushes the monster away from his life for good after what he witnesses with his attack on Alejandro.

The game is well made, because the puzzles aren't that difficult no severe feeling of accomplishment is ever made and so the moral of the story is some what less victorious in feeling. The monster in the game just tosses you about too and is not really that fearing enough to make you sympathise as much as you do in 'Among the Sleep'. The biggest enemy of the game though is it's price. With such a noble meaning and story to a game you would think that they would lower the price so that more could enjoy as the game is also hardly long enough to warrant a large sum. However it should be noted that making games can be a very expensive journey. When asked why he chose frogs to represent bottles of alcohol, the developer replied that it was largely to do with cost. They originally wanted chickens to represent bottles of alcohol in the game, but to put chickens in the game would have cost them $15,000. Since they already had frogs in the game they decided just to go with the frogs and scrap the chickens idea. I have many question marks with that last statement???

Anyway the game is seriously worthy of a glance especially if it goes on sale...

16553773.review:
Papo & Yo est un plateformer à la troisième personne très sympathique.

Points positifs :
- L'ambiance musicale et graphique.
- Une originalité bienvenue et vraiment appréciable.
- La thématique traitée est intéressante et rarement développée dans le jeu vidéo en général. La métaphore de la grenouille est bien trouvée et le comportement du monstre fera forcément écho à celles et ceux qui ont vécu pareille situation.

Points négatifs :
- Les énigmes qui agrémentent le jeu son un peu (trop) simples.
- La durée de vie (environ 3h30) est bien courte pour un jeu vendu 15€ au moment d'écrire ces lignes. Une fois fini, vous débloquez des collectibles (chapeaux) qui n'apparaissent pas lors de votre première partie à aller chercher dans le jeu. Les collectionner et débloquer tous les succès ralongera certes la durée de vie du titre mais ce jeu ne s'apprécie vraiment que la première fois.

16516992.review: 这个《贫民区历险记》流程不长解谜也不难，但是内涵深刻，怪物是主角奎科的父亲，因为主角曾经遭受家暴产生了心理阴影。更确切说怪物是奎科对于父亲的怨恨而产生的心理投射，这就可以解释为什么游戏最后的圣火说怪物（怨恨）只能放下。游戏中的青蛙暗指酒，那个小女孩就是奎科的姐姐，奎科的父亲喝了酒就发酒疯殴打他们姐弟。

16515274.review:
To be honest I'm surprised there are so many positive reviews for this game. It is an okay game, and I mean that in the nicest way possible. It is incredibly accessible and heavily story driven so anyone can get through it with relative ease and experience the story. 

However, that is probably the root of my largest complaint. My main gripe comes with the fact that almost all the "puzzles" in this game are not very clever and feel more like a chore. I never once had an "aha!" moment because it was always incredibly obvious what one needed to do to proceed. This isn't necessarily a negative for all people, but for me it is. For the most part they are just repetitive tasks you must complete to advance to the next zone. 

Most people rave about the story, and I thought this would be enough to redeem the game for me. Unfortunately, it wasn't. The ending came as no surprise as I thought they were very in your face from the beginning about the identity of the monster. I did however find the meaning of the frogs and their effect on the monster to be used in a way that was well done. 

Indeed, it wasn't all bad. The game did a good job of easing you into the mechanics and slowly building upon them as the game progressed. I also liked how when the monster became enraged the whole environment shifted and the monster came at you at just the right speed, This was enough to build tension most times I was caught off-guard (not realizing there was a frog around).

Lastly I want to say I did enjoy the music and art direction within the game. And a few of the levels (especially towards the end of the game) did some very visually interesting things which made me wish that same creativity could have been used to increase the difficulty of some of the puzzles. 

In conclusion, I do not recommend this game for the current price of $14.99. However, if you happen to find it dirt cheap (perhaps around or under $5) you might want to give it a go. It is certainly a little adventure, but not one that I would probably take again.

16486888.review: A very beautiful game. I played this back to back with Portal 2 and at first I was a little disappointed with Papo & Yo's puzzles by comparison. As the game went on though I came to appreciate that Papo & Yo has different goals than Portal and as a result different puzzles. Papo & Yo, to me at least, is a metaphor for navigating family dynamics. Its goal is to put you in a child's shoes, to oscillate between the calm and terror of having an alcoholic father, not to offer arbitrary brain teasers.

Mal juego: aburrido, con mecánicas jugables simplísimas, puzzles sin gracia alguna, y una historia que no es ni la mitad de impactante o enternecedora de lo que pretende ser. Los escenarios, todos ellos vacíos y anodinos, parecen ser clones unos de otros, y solamente existen para contener dos o tres rompecabezas de la complejidad de un pedrusco rural. Es el sopor hecho videojuego; bostezos digitalizados en unos y ceros viajando directos a tu cerebro. La triste historia de un niño idiotizado, con la fuidez de movimientos de un animatrón, bajo la patria potestad de un monstruo somnoliento y barrigón. El drama del juego indie fracasado, tanto en lo jugable como en lo meramente narrativo. Una historia de alcoholismo y mugre hipster. 

Pero qué Papo ni que Popo, a dónde quieres llegar con tanta tiza mágica y tanta casa voladora, palurdo. Papo&Yo es mejor que un dolor de muelas, pero peor que Papo rompiéndote las bolas a base de barrigazos, el muy imbécil.


3/10.

15897404.review:
Papa and Yo is not Subtle. It takes its abusive father metaphor and beats you over the head with it. I applaud what the creator is trying to do; even more so knowing its based on his childhood but, I think the game needs a better writer.

Plot:
The plot is about you letting go of your abusive and alcoholic father. Its not a bad place to start but thats all the game has plot wise. Very little character building or reasons to get attached to the characters. The only other npc is a girl that helps/hinders you who may be your sister but is unliklely due to the lighter skin color and almost no resemblance to you. *spoiler* She dies... or just gets abused. 

I have to say, I hate ambiguity. Not that ambiguity itself is bad, but few people know how, and when, to use it. Papa and Yo uses it as a crutch because 'I guess' the writers could fill the gaps with something they thought was interesting? I dont think the ambiguity is needed as much as they used it. 

Gameplay
The gameplay consists of puzzle platformers. They are very simple puzzles and it gives you hints if you get stuck. Pretty bog standard as far as these things go

Aesthetic
This is where I feel the game wins. Its damn beautiful with creative use of the environment to assist the puzzles. With the exception of a few technical pop ins, the game looked great. 

Sound
The sound was... alright. It did the jobs but nothing really stood out. There were also moments, like at the temple when you make the monster angry, a short music piece plays over the normal music and it doesnt sound good.

Length
Its 2 hours. Im not sure if thats good or bad considering I wasn't really having fun, or an interesting experience. I feel like any more and I would have just stopped playing. At least I beat it because of its short length?


If you really like puzzle platformer and non subtle plot threads strewn with ambiguity, then this game is for you. If not; give it a pass.

15884128.review:
Papo & Yo est un jeu d'énigmes à la troisième personne dont l'action se situe dans des décors de favelas surréalistes sur fond de drame familial.

Vous incarnez le jeune Quico qui va un jour s'échapper de la vie réelle par une porte magique et se retrouver dans un monde onirique où il rencontrera un monstre. Celui-ci est amical et Quico parvient à le guider le long de la route mais lorsque Monstre avale une grenouille sa [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=444608113]colère devient incontrôlable[/url]. Quico devra donc s'adapter aux émotions de Monstre et en jouer pour avancer et chercher le temple où Monstre pourra être guéri par un chaman.

C'est un jeu que j'ai beaucoup apprécié et cela pour plusieurs raisons. 

Tout d'abord derrière cette jolie histoire d'amitié à double tranchant entre un enfant et un monstre se cache en réalité un drame familial. Dans ce jeu tout est imagé et bien que certaines scènes révèlent qui est le monstre, si on ne le sait pas au départ ce n'est qu'a la fin que le jeu prend tout son sens et c'est pourquoi je ne dévoilerais rien ici. Mais sachez que c'est un thème que je n'ai jamais vu abordé dans un jeu vidéo et de le faire avec de tels sous-entendus et un monde surréaliste reflétant l'imagination de l'enfant victime est une très bonne idée.

Cet aspect du jeu est très important mais lorsque l'on joue la première chose à laquelle on est confrontés est le gameplay. Rassurez-vous cet aspect-ci est tout aussi maîtrisé. Papo & Yo est un jeu à énigmes où vous avancerez par étapes et vous devrez utiliser ce qui vous entoure pour y parvenir. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=443734599 Par exemple vous devrez vous servir de Monstre pour actionner des mécanismes, utiliser votre jouet robot pour sauter plus loin, tourner des clés, tirer sur des cordes...etc. Il s'installe une sorte de coopération entre l'enfant et le monstre et résoudre les énigmes est très intéressant tant elles sont bien construites et intelligentes. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=444607717 L'univers du jeu est surréaliste à souhait et il est très agréable de jouer avec les lois de la physique pour faire apparaitre des plateformes ou créer un pont.

Les énigmes ne sont pas d'une très grande difficulté et si vous vous retrouvez bloqués des indices seront disponibles. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=443733648 La [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t2X4cq6nRqg]musique[/url] du jeu est elle aussi une réussite même si parfois on aurait aimé qu'elle soit plus présente lors de la résolution des puzzles. On sent qu'un vrai travail a été fait quant aux bruitages et aux instruments choisis. Tout cela nous plonge dans un endroit imaginaire qu'on situe en Amérique du sud.

Au final ce jeu est magnifiquement bien réalisé et abouti, bien qu'il soit un peu court (environ 5h pour ma part) on l'apprécie de bout en bout de par sa direction artistique fabuleuse, sa musique qui nous transporte dans ce monde incroyable, ses énigmes originales et surtout son message caché, triste mais touchant. 
Je recommande vraiment ce jeu qui est trop méconnu, il mérite plus de reconnaissance, bien plus...

[quote]Lisez d'autres avis sur ma page de curation : [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9002662/]Kitsune's Guide[/url][/b][/quote]

15879120.review:
Papo & Yo выглядит как платформер, но это не платформер. Да и какая разница? Важно, что в игре есть несколько по-настоящему пронзительных моментов, после которых и хочется сказать что-то там про искусство в видеоиграх.

Quico gets help along the way from his little robot Lula and a girl named Alejandra who is quite mischievous at times. Gameplay: semplice e funzionale enigmi molto facili, la cosa più difficile sono gli achievement che danno anche una davvero buona rigiocabilità poiche per finirlo al 100% va obbligatoriamente finito due volte. La trama è la indiscussa protagonista del gioco.

Complessivamente raccomando il gioco, il prezzo è abbordabile e la trama merita davvero anche se solo con il finale si capisce a pieno cosa voleva raccontare il gioco. Ho trovato alcune idee molto originali. Consigliato.
