10085235.review: Papo y Yo is a textbook example of "Games as Art". In terms of gameplay, you won't get much and it's incredibly short; I beat it in less than 3 hours. However, the concepts/ideas and visuals are nice and there was one or two surprises that I didn't see until right before they happen. The development team is fairly creative and they do succeed in capturing child-like wonder and exposition though atmosphere, though that's their only major successes. The "big reveal" is blatantly obvious halfway through the game and it should have balanced more on the characters/backstory than just the message. My biggest complaint is that there is no real payoff to all the buildup; it kinda just sits unresolved and quite frankly, is unsatisfying. While that may have been the intention, the rest of the game isn't satisfying enough to justify leaving it that way. Overall, the game is simply "pleasant". Don't go out of your way to get this game, but if it stumbles upon you for cheap, it's worth a single afternoon.

10023783.review:
In Papo & Yo ("Father and I") you play a young Brazilian boy, accompanied by the normally docile Monster, a large, pinkish demon type thingy. With the help of Monster, a voodoo girl and a robo-puppet you'll be exploring some (surprisingly beautiful) favelas and learn about the boy's past.

The world is mostly dominated by puzzles and platform jumping elements. Neither of them are particularly challenging.
Only when Monster decides to stop being a saggy sleepyhead, then things can get a little intense.

Ars Technica explains the plot brilliantly: "The game does an admirable job of telling its story through its environments and dreamlike situations, rather than belaboring the point with overly explanatory dialogue."

If you've got two hours to spare and want to be immersed into the playful imagination of a Brazilian child, check out Papo & Yo.

I finished Papo & Yo last night. It joins "Brothers" on the short list of "beautiful games with fun and innovative mechanics and an ending that made my 4-year-old daughter cry lots."

At Sony's giga-booth at E3 last year I saw a screenshot of a boy running up a path made of buildings lying down, but there was no indication of what game it was from, and I really wanted to play whatever it was, and I was happy to discover that it's from Papo & Yo (and that section is even cooler than that screenshot led me to hope it would be).

9965748.review:
Today I played through Papo & Yo (Minority Media Inc.﻿), an action adventure (mostly 3D puzzle platforming) about a young boy who escapes the abuse of his alcoholic father into a surrealistic Latin American–esque slum, where he embarks on a quest to cure "Monster" of its addiction to poisonous frogs. The monster (a very clearly indicated metaphor for the protagonist's father) is both a helpful aid it surmounting obstacles and progressing through the game's environment, but also the game's only true "enemy" (when under the influence of frogs), who becomes not only a danger to others, but also the protagonist himself, who in the end discovers that there is no cure for "Monster". So, it's basically a journey of acceptance and letting go.

An enjoyable game—not very difficult, but the environments and puzzles were interesting and non–repetitive. There were occasional glitches and I had to replay one section when Monster got stuck on the environment and blocked progress, but nothing game–breaking. Notable is that the character you play as is non–White and non–Western (although there is no explicit nationality or ethnicity), and also non–English speaking (but not Spanish or Portuguese, either—some sort of constructed or conglomerate language is used in the game's limited dialog). Sad that playing as something other then a White male American is "notable", but that's how it is…

Un producto agridulce.
Y, en el fondo, me sabe mal no recomendarlo; pero en mi opinión el juego está sobrevalorado, quizás por la empatía que se puede llegar a sentir sobre el protagonista y su historia.


Como he dicho, una buena historia. 
El drama de un niño que vamos descubriendo a lo largo juego con alguna obviedad y otras cuantas insinuaciones que no llegan a concretarse, dejando al espectador obtener unas conclusiones de lo que pudo ser.
Desde luego, la historia es lo mejor que puedes encontrar en este juego.

Por otro lado, un juego de plataformas en 3D con una escasa duración (unas 5 horas de juego) y unos puzzles relativamente fáciles de resolver que te dejan con ganas de algo más.
Eso sí, tiene algunos escenarios y fotografía bastante llamativos.

En resumen:
> Como historia notable.
> Como juego suspende.

Como última defensa, diré que quizás es un juego destinado a un público más infantil.

9886288.review:
This game is a real treasure.  Obvious comparissons to Brothers: A tale of 2 sons are appropriate.  Both are puzzle, platformers set in imaginative worlds with fantastic music.  Brothers though I had a few problems with that this game doesn't.  This game does not force you to use a controller and while the single player coop was unique, this game opts for creative puzzles not ones that require adept controller work.  Also the camera here is pretty much free and the levels are less linear though the game is still quite linear.  Also the length is about 4 hours which is about the same i believe in both cases.  Also the levels in this game, as is the story is very imaginative and where brothers had some unique set pieces and puzzles, this game blows it away in imaginitive and non, done before fantasy setting, etc.  

The story to me also excels.  I will say that i like morals, meaning in storys.  Brothers seemed to piss me off to no end in what the struggle and sacrifice of the story is all about.  In this game your father is the main driver though in a different way of saving him.  In the end sacrifices, etc are about your character and his progression, not the forced emotional &jY&$3# that was brothers.   

So yes i keep bringing up brothers, and this is because the games are more alike each other than any other games i've played.  I would recommend this for a fan of that game or any player who likes a moving story, imagination, and non bang-your-head puzzles.   The way the puzzles work in this game are some of my favourite ever in my decades of gaming.  Hell even the hints are in game and require you picking up a box, placing it over your head and turning the 4 sides to see 4 panels of hints.

Get this game-- the 4 hours of your life will thank you!

9791187.review:
Игра о вреде пьянства. После этих слов так и ждёшь что кто-нибудь тебе заедет по роже канделяброй или как минимум устроит факельное шествие под окнами за такие то спойлеры. Но! Автор игры по каким-то непонятным мне причинам сказал об этом в предисловии, и этот сюжетный поворот может стать сюрпризом разве что для тех кто к концу игры забывает всё что было в начале. Ну типа меня. Впрочем у игры ещё будет чем вас пронять.

Papo & Yo дебютировала как загружаемая игра для консоли PS3, и для загружаемой игры выглядит более чем. Основное достоинство, помимо сюжета - это разнообразные элементы геймдизайна. Забавные лягушки, коробки аля MGS, граффити (нарисованные специально (?) известными (?) мастерами своего дела), сама концепция видоизменяемого города. А ещё тут есть шляпы. Одно это приносит игре оценку в два гейбена (из двух возможных). А вот монстр и связанная с ним часть игры скорее утомляет и раздражает. Геймплей сам по себе тоже обычен. Саундтрек же хорош, тут описание в магазине не врёт

В итоге мы имеем небольшое, но небезинтересное преключение, пусть с графикой и геймплеем уровня не выше среднего, но с занимательным геймдизайном и жизненными темами.

9760889.review:
ถ้าให้ Papo & Yo นับเป็นเกมละก็คงไม่ให้ผ่านอย่างแน่นอน เพราะปริศนาที่ค่อนไปทางง่าย เกมที่โคตรสั้น (3 ชม) เกมเพลย์จุกจิกน่ารำคาญ (เช่น สัตว์ประหลาดไล่งับเราทำให้เสียอารมณ์มาก)

แต่ถ้าให้ Papo & Yo จัดเป็นงานศิลป์ละก็เป็นอีกเรื่องนึง ตัวเกมจัดเป็นสไตล์สัญลักษณ์ ที่ทุกอย่างในเกมเป็นตัวแทนของสิ่งหนึ่ง องค์ประกอบ งานศิลป์ การออกแบบ เพลงประกอบ ล้วนจัดว่าทำออกมาได้อย่างดีเยี่ยม ไอเดียการให้เมืองเคลื่อนไหวได้น่าตื่นตาตื่นใจมาก

สรุปคือถ้าคาดหวังว่าจะเล่นเกมนี้ในฐานะเป็นเกมเกมนึงคงผิดหวังอย่างมาก แต่ถ้าคาดหวังว่าจะได้อะไรๆที่ทำให้เราคิดตามละก็ เกมนี้ตอบโจทย์ได้อย่างแน่นอน (แถมไม่ค่อยลึกแบบ Braid อะไรพวกนี้ด้วย มันยังพอเดาๆอะไรได้บ้าง)

9750260.review:
8/10

Enredo:
Tirado de sua realidade, Quico ainda que num lugar familiar, lá não lhe traz qualquer lembrança, a única outra humana lá é uma desconhecida garota que desenha e distorce a realidade, talvez ela seja a única que pode indicar a saída.

A arte: na história é tocante, um drama recorrente e realista, envolvendo o descontrole de um monstro que mesmo tão benevolente, é descontrolado, é violento, é o motivo das lembranças de Quico terem partido.
Enquanto se passa em favelas latino-americanas, mesmo tão precárias, são frutos de trabalho humilde, que lhe trazem um certo conforto apesar da frequente marginalização, com esgotos e materiais impróprios para construção de moradias. Que são distorcidas através dos desenhos com giz, que tornam reais escadas, engrenagens, cordas, chaves, tesouras etc., transformando cenários inteiros, em uma mescla de branco com textura de giz com a contrastante realidade.
A trilha sonora é grande parte da experiência desse belo jogo, complementando com ritmos bem típicos a região sul do continente americano, bem feitos e bem encaixados com o clima de cada momento.

O jogo: produzido na Unreal Engine, o jogo se concretiza de forma interessantíssima, controles intuitivos, que respondem bem e que dão a liberdade se o jogador quer ou não um tutorial - coisa que não precisa. Os gráficos tornam a arte do jogo possível e gostoso de se ver. Entretanto a expressão facial dos personagens deixa MUITO a desejar.

A equipe: indie e claramente empenhada, consegue surpreender fantasticamente. Dando várias opções de linguagem, oferecendo a compreensão desse grande jogo a uma gama maior de jogadores estrangeiros. Não menos importantes, claro, os beta testes, mesmo com a distorção de realidade do jogo, quase nenhum bug aconteceu de modo que atrapalhasse o desfecho de tudo.
Sensata a equipe também encerra o jogo antes de se tornar enjoativo e repetitivo nos puzzles, ou até mesmo antes que apareça alguma distorção que não encante o jogador.

9745344.review:
Es gibt wirklich nur selten Spiele, die ich so bedingungslos weiterempfehlen kann. Die Spielwelt ist wunderschön gestaltet und an eine Favela angelehnt, gleichzeitig aber auch sehr fantasievoll umgesetzt. Die Rätsel sind abwechslungsreich und intelligent, aber immer lösbar und das Gameplay funktioniert makellos. Die Grafik ist dabei unerwartet gut (Unreal Engine) und die musikalische Untermalung passt immer perfekt zum Geschehen.
Das Ende war leider ein wenig vorhersehbar und nach 3-4 Stunden ist der Spaß auch schon vorbei, aber in der Zeit wird man einfach super unterhalten. Was mir auch richtig gut gefallen hat, ist, dass das Spiel ohne großartige Story oder Cutscenes so viele Gefühle vermitteln kann - besonders, was das Monster angeht.

9742990.review:
파포앤요는 어떠한 이유로 옷장에 갇힌 소년의 환상으로 시작되는 이야기로 게임 내내 분위기를 지배하는 남미풍의 아름다운 건물배경과 음악이 신선했었고 인디게임이라고 생각하기 힘든 짜임새있고 아름다운 그래픽을 보여주는 어드벤처 게임입니다.
플레이하는 내내 분필로 그은 듯한 선을 통해 발동되는 특이한 판타지적 요소와 초현실적인 배경의 움직임이 인상적이였습니다.
3~4시간 정도의 짧은 볼륨이 아쉽지만 오히려 이정도의 분량이였기 때문에 전달하고자 하는 바가 명확할 수 있었던 것 같습니다.
단순하지만 생각보다 난이도가 있는 퍼즐이 길을 막지만 각 퍼즐마다 존재하는 힌트박스 도움을 받으면 난이도가 많이 하락하므로 막힐 때 마다 이용하면 진행에 막히는 일이 크게 없을 듯 합니다.
엔딩까지 도착해도 명확하게 풀리지 않는 몇가지 요소의 의미가 아쉬웠으며 후반부에 충격적인 스토리 전개가 있습니다.
마지막 장면의 배경을 봤을 때 마냥 기분 좋게만 끝날 수 있는 엔딩은 아니였던 것 같습니다.
마치 인디판 앨리스와 같은 느낌이였네요. 아 그리고 플레이 후에 상점페이지의 게임정보를 한번씩 읽어보시길 추천합니다^^

9735622.review: História magnífica, sonorização maginífica e ambientação magnifíca. Jogabilidade ? Básica, mas compensada pelo enredo.Papo & Yo com toda certeza se você jogar prestando atenção na história vai se interessar e encantar.Parabéns para a desenvolvedora. Recomendo!

9727679.review:
Papo & Yo diente dem Autor vor allem in einer Sache: Der Verdrängung von Misshandlungen durch den eigenen Vater, die dieser in Kindheitstagen über sich ergehen lassen musste. Seine Lebengeschichte übertrug dieser in das Spiel und in ein Armutsviertel eines südamerikanischen Staaten, den Slums.

Hauptcharakter Quico litt jahrelang unter der Alkoholkrankheit seines Vaters und versteckt sich eines Tages im Wandschrank, um der Wut seines Erziehenden zu entfliehen. Ein geheimnisvoller Riss führt ihn in eine Traumwelt, doch die Flucht vor der Realität gelingt nur in geringen Maßen. Das 'Monster', ein Wesen aus diesem Universum, hat eine Vorliebe für Frösche - doch genau diese lösen in ihm eine Wut aus, die sich auf Quico auswirkt. Wütend stampft Monster so auf den Jungen zu und versucht ihm den Garaus zu machen, die Übertragung der Realität auf die Traumwelt.

Quico macht sich auf den Weg und versucht das Monster im Monster, klingt komisch ich weiß, zu besiegen, um aus ihm ein friedliches Wesen zu erschaffen. Gelöst werden die einzelnen Etappen mit Hilfe von Rätseln und kleineren Kniffen, die jedoch  nicht sonderlich schwierig zu lösen sind, in geringen Maßen jedoch auch eine Herausforderung darstellen können. Insgesamt habe ich knappe 4-5 Stunden für Papo & Yo gebraucht, weshalb ich den Titel im Vollpreis nur bedingt weiterempfehlen kann. Aber bei einem Sale sollte man sich das Spiel unbedingt kaufen. Empfehlung.

9720777.review: Gra się bardzo przyjemnie. Produkcja opiera się na dziełach wyobraźni, równocześnie sugerując nam, że najbardziej rozbudujemy  wyobraźnię sięgając do książek. Gra logiczno-zręcznościowa. Naprawdę zachęcam sięgnąć po ten tytuł.

9622725.review:
At its core, Papo & Yo is a reasonably simple puzzle-platformer, that takes around 3-4 hours to complete (with perhaps another hour or two if you feel like going for all the achievements).

The imaginative and magical take on the already colourful environments (including some awesome artwork on the buildings and walls) are fantastic though and the soundtrack really adds to the whole experience.
However the metaphorical storyline is where it shines through, delivering a mature and poignant plotline.

Works well with a mouse and keyboard.

9605865.review:
[h1][i]"Father and I"[/i][/h1]

Игра о детстве некоторых детей, о том, как оно проходит, в каком окружении.

В данном случае не в лучшем. Как это иногда бывает, когда отец, в этой игре "под лягушкой", ищет на ком бы отыграться, а сын в это время прячется в шкафу. И, чтобы избежать неприятный момент, парнишка рисует свой собственный мир, где его возможности практически безграничны, где он может рисовать предпятствия или же наоборот - убирать их с дороги, где твои лучшие игрушки оживают и могут говорить с тобой.

-[u]Геймплей[/u]- этим мы и будет заниматься на протяжении всей, не большой по продолжительности, игры. Мы попадаем в фавелы, где все окружающее вокруг становится головоломкой, решить которую нам придется, чтобы пройти далее по сюжету. Но головоломки, стоит отметить, очень простые, к каждой даже прилагается способ решения, если уж совсем никак не идет. На этом пути нас сопровождает монстр, который является неотъемлемой частью каждой загадки, с ним мы идем до конца игры. С ним можно взаимодействовать, а в свободное время даже поиграть в мяч.
-[u]Графика и музыка[/u]- во время всего путешествия мы слышим отличную, динамически изменяющуюся музыку, правда графика не всегда радует глаз, тени не очень красивы, а картинка целиком иногда скачет, но это возможно какой-то баг.

Но если забыть об этих небольших недостатках, в игру стоит играть. Все же не всегда из такой социально значимой проблемы получается сделать красочную и красивую историю.

[h1]A Strange New World[/h1]

9597033.review:
Papo & Yo is a puzzle game, however that is also where it fails the hardest. The puzzles in the game seem to be designed in such a way to waste as much of your time as possible, not because they're difficult (which none of them actually are), but because of the massive amount of running around that is required for solving each and every single one of them.

The second major fault of the game is the clunky way of trying to control the monster to do what you want him to do, the mechanic is contrived, again simply to add to the play time.

The storyline is very thin, the game tries to allude to things, however everything is already blatantly clear long before the conclusion of the game. And the soundtrack is almost equally nonexistant, most of the time there is no background music playing at all and the rest of time it's only sometimes interesting.

All in all Papo & Yo Desperately tries to be much more clever than it actually is.

However despite all its faults the game had me mildly entertained throughout, the atmosphere it tried to create was enough for me to finish the game, and because of the short play time and more importantly without any major setbacks there was nothing stopping me from doing so.

5 / 10

9588512.review:
If you have ever wondered what a game would be like that was crafted like poetry instead of a normal story, this game is the answer. Instead of following a plot, you wander through a beautifully crafted dreamlike, sometimes surreal environment, slowly unravelling a gut-wrenching past.

One word of warning, though, if you seek puzzles for the challenge, this is the wrong game. The puzzles are nicely done, but not very complex or difficult. They fit the pacing of the game very well, however, so I don't see this as a negative, just a bit different from what I initially expected.

I recommend playing the game through before you even look at the list of achievements, as sadly one of them contains a spoiler in its description.

9576025.review: Wiecie, trudno jest mi ocenić Papo & Yo. Widać wyraźnie że całość jest bardzo osobista, że autorzy faktycznie włożyli w całość kawałek siebie. Świat przedstawiony faktycznie sprawia wrażenie wziętego wprost z dziecięcej wyobraźni, zaś grafika i (zwłaszcza) muzyka są na bardzo dobrym poziomie. W czym więc jest problem? W tym że metafora relacji z ojcem-potworem jest banalna, oczywista, nachalna i bardzo płytka. Problematyczny jest też gameplay - zagadki logiczne (a na nich gra jest zbudowana) są banalnie proste, nie stanowią wyzwania. Mimo wszystko warto się z grą zapoznać (najlepiej podczas wyprzedaży, bo trzy i pół godziny rozgrywki za 11 ojro to jednak przesada), niczego innego bowiem o takiej tematyce nie znajdziecie.

9510792.review:
Papo & Yo è un capolavoro, di quelli che escono raramente negli anni
E' un gioco di avventura che vede protagonista Quico,un piccolo ragazzo di colore che in si ritrova in un mondo del tutto fantastico. Il giocatore dovrà guidare Quico nel viaggio che lo attende,attraverso enigmi e puzzle-games,il tutto in compagnia del suo fidato robottino Lula. Inizialmente il giocatore si ritroverà disorientato e farà fatica a comprendere i motivi di questo viaggio e le stranezze che lo circondano; ma con un pò di pazienza la trama del gioco si aprirà davanti ai nostri occhi e saremo pronti ad aiutare il piccolo ragazzino a raggiungere il suo più grande obiettivo della vita.
Nonostante la poca longevità del gioco che per il suo completamento non richiede più di 7-8 ore,Papo & Yo riuscirà a farci immergere in un mondo parallelo,fantastico,immaginario da cui difficilmente riusciremo a distaccarci
Il gioco ha una trama molto profonda e nasconde dietro di sè significati che inizialmente saranno ai nostri occhi oscuri.
Pronti a vivere un'avventura al di fuori della realtà? Quico vi aspetta!

9510542.review:
At first i found the story to not really go anywhere. Yes Quico has some troubles with his father, yes we can see how they show it ingame. So the first 1/3 of the game i found myself asking why i was doing these (very pretty) puzzles. But after that, the game got more interesting. The story showed the connection more clearly towards the gameplay. In the end, the story is not THAT special, but it is very well presented.

The gameplay is basically a puzzle platformer. A rather easy one at that. The puzzles requires not much thinking to figure out, so hardcore puzzle addicts won't get their fix with this. But the puzzles where very pretty. I was happy to see a lever so i could see the environments transform. These environment transformation is the biggest half of the puzzles, and also the most impressive to see. The other part is Monster, you have to lure him around to complete puzzles. 2 other small roles are Lulu and Alejandra. Lulu is a little robot you can throw at switches or use to do a doublejump/hover kind of deal. Alejandra is a little girl that taunts you around the gameworld, moving the gameplay/plot forward in some places.

The graphics where pretty good, not much to say here. The game looks pretty, runs smooth and no loading screens other then the initial startup one. Might not be the best looking game ever, but there are hardly any complaints other then the glows around objects being pixelated.

Another downside is the length, it runs for about 3 hours. Which is long enough, but i found that the story at the end went fast forward. The entire plot/metaphore of the game is revealed in the last 5-10 minutes. While it ain't that bad, it might have been better to get to the point of the story sooner in game so that they could handle the reveal a bit more subtle.

All in all, even if it runs short and the plot might not be the next shakespear, the game is still good. I enjoyed the 3 hours it took to finish, the puzzles, simple as they are, are pretty satisfying due to the environment transformations.

9438178.review:
I wish Papo & Yo was the first game I've ever played.

There's something about it which envokes a childlike wonder within players - the entire game is reminiscent to an interactive Pixar experience, the feelings we used to have as kids watching Toy Story or Monsters Inc. This lies in the wonderfully magical aesthetic of the game - the colours are vibrant, the music is playful, and the world feels magical, displaying a beautiful level of imagination.

At its core, Papo & Yo is a third person puzzle platformer, but I would never dare use this as a description for this game. The puzzles are all very well paced, providing the slightest challenge, which although may be offputting to some, the previously mentioned magic within the world makes up for it. Quico (the main character of the story), the young boy who travels inside his own imagination will be picking up boxes and causing houses to move on little legs. He will make staircases pop out of the side of houses, or rotate a building inside of itself to reveal a new path to further advance in his goal. Each time I found myself with a new interaction in the environment, my eyes lit up with glee as the Pixar effect of discovery, imagination and beauty played off on screen. Quico is accompanied by three other characters; Lula, Monster and Alejandra. 

Lula is Quico's helpful pet/toy robot. She rides attached on his back, constantly hugging him and allowing Quico to do a double jump thanks to her rocket booster legs. Lula can also be used to flip switches out of Quico's reach. Alejandra is the first character we meet, and the only one we don't really get to interact with. She is a metaphor for Quico's growth throughout his journey, and not much can be said about her without spoilers.
Lastly, there's Monster. A giant, fat, bulky, horned creature who either sleeps, eats, or looses himself in rage attacking anything in sight. He brings a majority of the puzzle elements in the game, as Quico has to manouver Monster via the usage of fruit, which Monster loves and will run up to one if he sees one, in order to advance to the next area. Monster also loves to eat frogs, but upon doing so he will enter a state of rage, charging at Quico and attempting to kill him.
This brings me into the game's strongest point - the story.

The story in Papo & Yo is based on real-life experiences of it's director amd designer Vander Caballero. The Monster is a metaphor for an alcoholic and abusive father, and the world Quico finds himself in is his imaginary escape, picturing his father as Monster. Without spoiling much, you will understand the effect and impact of this metaphor especially towards the last 20/30 minutes of this game.

The game is rather short, as displayed on my profile it took me just three hours to beat, but I also haven't had the chance to explore every nook and cranny to find the collectible "hats" in game. When considering Papo & Yo, please don't let it's length turn you off the game. It is a beautiful, heart-touching, childlike experience unlike any other I've seen in video games so far. Due to Papo & Yo's easy difficulty, no deaths or death penalty, a story which is well suited for everyone - children will love the aesthetic; the characters; the environments; the puzzles, whereas older audiences will love the metaphor and the meaning behind the game, I simply have to recommend this game to everyone.

TL;DR: Beautiful aesthetic, very deep and emotional story, envokes childhood memories and feelings 10/10 recommended for everyone.

9408787.review:
Papo & Yo es una estremecedora historia llena de metáforas, donde primarán la emociones antes que el gameplay.
El juego gráficamente correcto y con una buena jugabilidad.
Papo & Yo nos lleva dentro de mente de Quico, el protagonista, donde estará unido a Papo (monstruo), en lo bueno y en lo malo. Lo necesitará para ir avanzando, pero Papo es una arma de doble filo y será también nuestro mayor enemigo.

El juego mezcla una muy buena jugabilidad entre plataformas y puzles, que en algunos momentos se puede hacer repetitivos, pero lo que prima en este juego es su fantástico apartado artístico con las emociones que transmite.

Creo que es la primera vez que juego a un videojuego donde se tocan temáticas tan duras como los malos tratos y las adicciones. Generalmente estamos acostumbrados a juegos que se alejan de la realidad o que la traspasan bruscamente. Aquí se explica una dura historia sobre la relación entre un padre y un hijo; y se entremezclan sentimientos de amor y complicidad con la otra cara de la moneda como es el alcoholismo y los malos tratos. 
Todo esto bañado en un mundo colorista en las fabelas de Brasil, donde contrastan los colores con la dura realidad que allí se vive.

Papo & Yo es un magnífico juego de plataformas y puzles donde su punto fuerte se esconde en una dura historia que te emocionará y te hará reflexionar sobre temas que aún son tabú en el mundo de los videojuegos. Nos acerca a un título de autor donde su director se inspiró en su dura vida personal.

Un título que pese a su corta durabilidad, la compensa con emociones que pocos juegos saben transmitir.

9404336.review:
Очаровательный платформер с глубоким сюжетом о тяжёлом детстве.

Плюсы:
+ История. Побег от жестокой реальности в мир фантазий.
+ Дизайн уровней. Здесь прекрасно всё - от граффити на стенах до окружения, которое во время прохождения используется как конструктор.
+ Этническая музыка. Редкий пример звукового сопровождения, не надоедающего до самого конца.
+ Отсутствие насилия. Игра на редкость позитивная, несмотря на большого и страшного Монстра.

Минусы:
- Незначительные баги. Подтормаживания в определённых местах. Предметы иногда проваливаются сквозь текстуры.
- Отсутствие сохранения вручную, редкие чекпоинты.
- Линейность. Единственный недостаток головоломок.
- Концовка. Реальные воспоминания так и остались нераскрытыми, что делает их появление на протяжении игры бессмысленным.

Вердикт: маст хэв. Papo & Yo рассчитана на детскую аудиторию, однако взрослые также найдут для себя много интересного. Одна из лучших инди-игр, что мне встречались.

9400938.review:
Papo & Yo es un juego de puzzles y un poco de plataformas bastante original.

Somos un chico brasileño y nos situamos en las favelas de Brasil.

Los puzzles son bastante novedosos y el diseño un tanto peculiar.

El juego es muy lineal y se maneja con 2 botones (a parte de los de dirección y cámara).

Nos desplazamos por un escenario, en el cual, debemos de activar diferentes "llaves" que cambiarán el escenario para que podamos avanzar.

También tenemos a un monstruo, el cual debemos hacer que nos siga.

La mecánica del juego es bastante simple e intuitiva, pero no por ello debe ser malo.

9391191.review: Despite being a short game (it took me less than 5 hours), you aren't left wanting more after finishing Papo & Yo, and that's not necessarily a bad thing. Think of a TV series that finishes after two series or so while it's still fresh and the stories are worthwhile, instead of dragging on season after season trying to wring every last penny out of the idea. Papo & Yo communicates some very strong emotions and makes sure it gets the point across and then it ends. Simple and perfect. The graphics aren't exactly mind blowing, but if you're looking for graphics you're in the wrong place - Papo & Yo is about story and, more importantly, emotion. My thoughts go out to the developer of this game, and I hope creating it helped to provide closure.

9382055.review: Such beautiful and inventive visual design is wasted on a game so protracted. You're in for a long haul without any real resolution. While it seems deep in metaphor, very little about the absurdity of many elements of play has any real meaning, and the gameplay rarely develops complexity beyond simplistic, albeit pretty puzzles. It's stunning how good design can be wasted without a good story to tell with it with. 5/10

9380319.review:
What is a monster?  What is a frog?  What if your best friend was a monster?  Papo & Yo is truly a remarkable adventure, puzzle platformer which may make you rethink these questions.  Truth be told, Papo & Yo only caught my eye after a good friend of mine added it to his Steam Wishlist.  As many of you may have done, I waited for this game to go on a 75%+ sale when it was released as Humble Indie Bundle X's beat-the-average tier.  Luckily for me, rather than leaving this game to sit in my Steam Library to collect dust, I downloaded and decided to try it out.

What I discovered was one of the most captivating games I have ever played or watched.  From the first scene, a black screen with white text: "'To my mother, brothers and sisters with whom I survived the monster in my father.'  Vander Caballero," to the ending of the credits, this game does not disappoint - it simply gets better.

Verdict: Papo & Yo is simply an absolutely stunning game.  It is symbolism at its finest and storytelling at its greatest.  It is a visually gorgeous game loaded with an immense amount of creative ingenuity.  In order to not reveal any spoilers, all I can say is "this game is a must-play."  You know a game is good when all you can do is sit in awe, thought, and understanding through the entirety of the credits after you complete it.

9337310.review:
First of all, let me just say it got this game through humble bundle about a month or two, but never had the time to play the game until recently. i have not watched any review or let's play of the game, but heard of it through a friend who enjoyed it. other than that, i was completely clueless to what this game could be. also this review is [b]SPOILER FREE[/b].

Papo & Yo focuses heavily on story (according to me) and tries to connect it with the surrounding enviroment both in terms of immersion and key elements in gameplay. This sounds great in theory... however the game itself is a mess. The art alone is wonderful and i would definitely recommend Papo Y yo as an art exhibiton rather than as a game. This is because the controls feels very clunky and slow and i personally feel that the lack of "ledgegrabbing" could be... mildly infuriating. Not only that, but the puzzles themselves could be a bit painful due to backtracking without any other mechanic than simply "walking", "climbing" or the painfully slow "getting a box  2 feet away to an adjacent square in the ground".

However as i mentioned earlier, Papo & Yo wants to (i think) focus on story and immersion, not the gameplay. When i got the humble bundle, i also got another game that did the same thing and it was called "To the moon". To the moon had half the staff and budget (probably) that Papo & Yo had, but delivered in so many more ways in that. 
What im trying to say that Papo & Yo doesn't have a story good enough to "carry the game". It feels very rushed, and the immersion just isn't good enough because of it's poorly designed gameplay. There are so many other games (such as "To the moon") which does story much better than Papo & yo, so if your looking for that, i suggest another game.

That said, the game has some beautiful art and some great tracks. if you find a deal where you get the game AND the soundtrack, like humble bundle, it could be worth a dime. Buying the game solely on it's own? Not worth it.

Bulmaca oyunlarına tahammülüm yoktur. Farklı oyun türlerinde ufacık bir bulmaca olsa bile acayip canım sıkılır. Çünkü bana göre bulmaca çözmenin zevkli bir tarafı yoktur. 9276594.review:
[i]„Proč jsi na mě zlý?“[/i]

Tato hra od studia Minority Media vypráví příběh o malém chlapci a velkém monstru. Hra vychází z osobních zkušeností jednoho z autorů a jeho vzpomínek na dětství, které nebylo vůbec jednoduché.

Hlavní náplní je řešení prostorových hádanek a skákání po plošinkách. Hádanky jsou celkem snadné a jejich řešení vám většinou zabere maximálně pár minut. A kdyby náhodou ne, můžete využít nápovědy v podobě papírové krabice, kterou si nasadíte na hlavu. Ano, na hlavu. Něco se vám na tom nezdá? Aha, já vám vlastně ještě nic neřekl o místě kde se hra odehrává...

Chlapec Quico žije v chudinské čtvrti jihoamerického města, v jeho očích je to ale magické místo plné malých pohyblivých domečků. Muže je posouvat pomocí koleček a klíčků, které jsou namalovány na zemi a na zdech. Jeho cílem je najít způsob, jak  z jedné ulice přeskákat do další.

Není ale sám, většinu času mu bude dělat společnost obrovské monstrum. Není tak nebezpečné jak vypadá, je vlastně docela mírumilovné. Jen se prochází a žere ovoce na které narazí, nebo spí. Problémy nastávají ve chvíli, kdy najde žáby. Moc mu chutnají, ale po jejich spolknutí se z něho stane nebezpečná ohnivá stvůra. 

Musím také zmínit atmosféru hry. Prostředí je tvořeno mnoha malými domečky které mají nevýrazné barvy, aby mezi nimi vynikaly zářivé čáry, sloužící jako vodítko k dalšímu postupu. Narazíte ale i na mnoho krásných pestrobarevných obrázků a malebných zákoutí. Vynikající je také klidná hudba, která neruší při řešení hádanek.

Hra trvá přibližně tři hodiny a po celou dobu mě bavila. Pokud máte náladu na něco nenáročného se zajímavým tématem, pak máte mé doporučení.

[i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861342/]Další recenze na mé kurátorské stránce[/url][/i]

В основе игры лежит хорошая сюжетная задумка, показывающая отца мальчика в виде монстра, который временами опасен, но которого маленький герой хочет спасти. Такая себе семейная драма, тема в играх не избитая, и вообще здорово, что автор её поднял (как я понимаю, на основе личных воспоминаний) и показал нестандартным образом. Ради этого на игру, как минимум, стоит обратить внимание. Одна беда, геймплей не задался: обычный платформер, сменяющийся не самыми интересными головоломками. Первый час более менее интересно, дальше одолевает скука, я заставил себя допройти только из-за того, что было интересно узнать концовку. Благо игра короткая, всего около 3 часов.

За интересный сеттинг и нестандартный сюжет игру все же порекомендую, но так как играть в нее не особенно интересно, возможно достаточно будет посмотреть ее на YouTube.

9226003.review:
First off, this friggin game should come with a trigger warning for abuse victims before the later levels. And personally I wouldn't let a 10 yo anywhere near it, cute though the beginning might be. I know we've all already murdered a million people in games, but games like this come around and manage to use a simple as anything game mechanic to give you goosebumbs, to put it mildly. (Yes, I'm talking about the darn lifeless "dolls" - 'nough said.)

It's not about the puzzles. Don't come to this game for the sense of accomplishment a difficult puzzle platformer gives you. There is no place for competitiveness here, it's storytelling by playing. It's not a walking simulator either though (and I am using the term as a descriptor, not as a curseword). The gameplay is simple without being simplistic, and the puzzles are well, one could say they're easy, but I felt they were appropriate. Basically the puzzles play like the platforming elements do: They flow comfortably, at a natural pace, an average player won't have to stop anywhere long. The atmosphere and the visuals are fantastic, the music and the voice acting are beautifully done. Everything, including the rythym of the gameplay, just flows well and all elements work together to tell a simple story, albeit one we don't often hear in games in this manner.

And btw, it's so insanely refreshing to see minority and lower class protagonists, languages and aesthetics so uncomrpomisingly portrayed in a game.

It's not flawless, but its flaws are totally secondary and besides the point. It deserves every penny we can throw its way, because these developers should be encouraged to try again and do more. So yes, buy it. As for whether you will enjoy it, well, if you aren't coming to it with an all macho "harcore" attitude, then yes, you will get something out of it. I don't know if you'll love it, and personally I wouldn't play it again, but it's definitely a game worth meeting and a little journey worth taking.

9224408.review:
This is not really a challenging puzzle game, and the story may not be appealing to most younger people.
However, the game is still very well worth playing through if you're in it for the experience.

The levels are incedibly well done. They will twist your mind and are beautiful to a point where you will find yourself staring at the graphics... simply because they're great to look at.
The story is really sad, and the music underlines this nicely.

The game seems solid and well play tested. It is very playable and you will not be frustrated by bad controls, bugs or bad design. 

The game is truly a work of art and is definitely a "must play" if you're looking for something else than the typical action shooter.

9184636.review:
I highly reccomend [i]Papo & Yo[/i]. The story is quite moving, particularly at the end. The game reminds me of the movie [i][url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0457430/]Pan's Labyrinth[/url][/i] in the way it uses a fantasy world as a metaphor to address a serious real-world problem. I don't have any personal experience with the subject matter of [i]Papo & Yo[/i], but found it deeply affecting nonetheless.

Playing as a young Brazilian boy in a somewhat poor and run-down village is a refreshing change from the characters and settings found in most other games. The game incites a giddy sense of child-like fun despite its dark underlying story.

The game contains beautiful and mesmerizing graffiti artwork on display on various walls in the game. [url=http://blog.us.playstation.com/2012/07/31/graffiti-in-papo-yo-is-part-of-the-experience/]Here's an article on [i]PlayStation Blog[/i][/url] about it by the game's director Vander Caballero. From the article:

> It’s worth noting that these are real works of graffiti art licenced for use in the game, taken from the vibrant street art scene in major cities like Brazil’s Sao Paulo, and Chile’s Valparaiso and Santiago.

[url=http://www.flickr.com/photos/playstationblog/7680768222/]Here's an example of the artwork[/url] (from its actual location, not the game, though the reproduction in the game is nearly the same).

I felt quite satisfied after completing this game, though it is fairly short and doesn't seem to lend itself much to replay. Still, I felt it was well worth what I paid. The story stuck with me in my mind for a few days.

The game is a unique experience and certainly worth the price.

9099052.review:
A surprising theme, tactfully done weaves through Papo & Yo. The game, while simple in its control and play, was intriguing enough that I played through the game in a sitting. While some gamers may not appreciate this game for what it is, Would have a lot more to say, but the story and the experience make this game, and I do not know that I could do it justice without spoiling it. I highly suggest at least one playthrough. 

So long as you can go more than 30 minutes without killing an alien/terrorist/animal/robot, you will find a unique experience.

[b]Storyline: 7/10[/b] - the underlying story kept me intrigued
[b]Music: 7/10[/b] - the music added to the experience, and I enjoyed it, Walking away from the game I can't say that I remember much of the music, though.
[b]Sound Effects: 8/8[/b] - simple, non-obtrusive, but felt organic to a surreal scenario- especially the 'dialogue' sound effects.
[b]Graphics: 8/7[/b] - A fairly charming visual experience. Was not hard on the eyes. :P

Overall, I give Papo & Yo an appreciative 7.5/ 10.

Don't get me wrong it is a good game. I feel the story is new and emersive taking key parts of childhood and focusing on how imagination is a beauty. But as far as a story, this is just the cover. Inside i found the controls clunky and a suprisingly annoying checkpoint system. My character seemed a little slow, although this is just a speed preference, and the turning didn't help. At parts it felt like it was aesthetically finished but still like playing a early access game. I remeber one point I got very stuk on a level and used hints to try to figure it out. I had placed a box to get to  a higher platform and it hadn't worked. I watch a walk through and my box should have been two inches to the right and none of this was clearly marked out
I know I have been quite mean during this review but on the whole it was still enjoyable. I would give it a 6/10

9087613.review:
Papo & Yo ist ein interessantes Spiel, und das in mehrerer Hinsicht.

Zum einen, und das ist auch mein größter Kritikpunkt, ist es eigentlich [b]kein Spiel im klassischen Sinne.[/b]
Die Puzzle und Herausforderungen beschränken sich auf einfache Logikspielchen oder simple "Finde den nächsten Schalter", oder "Drücke die Schalter in der richtigen Reihenfolge".

Das Gameplay ist daher extrem eingeschränkt und stellenweise eintönig.
Gepaart mit der unpräzisen Steuerung und der störrischen Kamera macht das "spielen" an sich nicht wahnsinnig viel Spaß.

Allerdings punktet es in anderer Hinsicht gleich mehrfach: die [b]Geschichte[/b] ist tiefgehend und einfühlsam, der [b]Soundtrack[/b] fantastisch und die Gestaltung der Level lädt zum Staunen ein. Man wünscht sich öfters solche Spiele.
Papo & Yo wäre definitiv besser, wenn auch das Gameplay stimmen würde.

Nichtsdestotrotz absolut empfehlenswert für Spieler, die Lust auf atmosphärisch und abstrakt erzählte Geschichten haben (vergleichbar mit z.B. [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/203810/]Dear Esther[/url]).

9076431.review:
Alcoholism is destructive. Not only for your liver but for the lives of your surroundings. Especially your family, and even more specifically, your kids. The delirious anger can inhibit a child's imagination and creativity in ways you never thought possible. The shame that comes with a parents insane behavior could possibly mentally scar a child for life. Not giving a child the proper attention, will belittle him or her to the point of extinction. Humans have a bond to their parents, a bond that is hard to break, especially when that bond is held tighter by constant attempts to catch a father or mother's attention, and failing. This need for acceptance is everlasting, and never getting it will assemble a world-view of misconstrued self-hating nonsense. Self-hatred and shame will burn inside of you with the same fire that fueled your father's anger. You will feel so insignificant and, subsequently, depressed, feelings of hopelessness will cover your interests in creative endeavors in a thick goo of inability; a lack of energy, lack of confidence, lack of belief in your own talent. These associative memories will be there however long your experiences of the world stays the same. And this is where Papa & Yo comes in. 

The game takes us through an imaginary world - where we are the co-creators and reformers. We are accompanied by our lovely companion "Lula" and eventually we meet the Monster! He seems like a lovable fellow, mostly interested in nuts and sleeping, we provide him with these life-essential things, mostly because he provides us with progression. 
Things seems to go fine until we stumble across some cute-looking "frogs". This is where our Monster scurries into a frenzy, he no longer cares about our needs of progression, he just wants to get a hold of this frog and devour it. We are left behind, until we see him coming back, but now the sky is red and our Monster is on fire: charging right at us. What does this mean? We don't have long to think before he grabs hold of us and throw us to the ground with a thump. Huh. This monster is not a friendly one after all, then why are we with him? We run around for a bit and see this blue/purple fruit, described as rotten. Our first instinct is to throw it at him, we do, he calms down. He is back to his pinkish, amicable and lovable form. In this form he only sleeps and eat, he doesn't hurt us, we can manage to stick with him for a while longer. Along the journey his fiery temper tantrums become more frequent and more limiting. We need to get rid of him, we need to let go, we need to move on. We need to exempt ourselves from the grips of destruction, to separate ourselves from the person that is this angry, projecting, mean-spirited Monster. Despite him being our means of progression and survival. Despite him being the reason we exist and survive. 

Papa & Yo tackles the subject of a destructive family very well. It illustrates the need to let go of your parents, in general, perhaps not just the despicable alcoholic abuser. A realization: we are separate human beings from the ones which created us, we are our own persons and have our own quirks and dreams. This game illustrates the need to escape when your family life is in shambles, in imagination or videogames. Escapism until you can finally escape it in reality. Papa & Yo gives people a way to escape and even more, it manifests a scenario a huge amount of people are in and gives them validation, a feeling of acceptance and most of all, advice is given. Good advice, helpful advice. Your family is not you, there is a world outside of this small world, imaginative or not. The world is truly yours. Sometimes you just need to let go, of whatever is holding you back.

This is a decent puzzle platformer with solid mechanics, minimal glitches (as in, if you encounter a bug it was because you were deliberately looking to break the game), a decent story hampered by its main twist being blatantly obvious, and a fairly decent play time.

However, the best feature by far is the hats. Once you beat the game, you can play the game again in order to collect various hats scattered around the levels; collecting them all rewards an achievement. However, the collection itself quickly becomes your main goal, as while the first hat is fairly normal, the second hat is a [i]soccer ball[/i] and it just gets crazier from there. You'll find yourself eagerly anticipating what Quico will next decide to place on his head.

tl;dr disregard first playthrough, acquire hats

There aren't enough superlatives to describe the feel and look of this game! Absolutely loved it. The puzzles or the platforming aren't particularly challenging - they aren't meant to be. Exploring the surreal world of Papo & Yo is more like experimenting with laws of a different reality than testing your skills in a familiar one. It's like being a kid again, getting lost in a playground full of possibilities.

Traversing the dreamlike slums as a little boy while trying to tame a wild Monster goes from enchanting to touching when you realize the Monster is a representation of the boys alcoholic father. The ending was especially powerful. Soundtrack fits the game perfectly, making the whole experience even more immersive.

I'm really curious about Minority Media's next game called 'Silent Enemy' (dealing with bullying).

Papo & Yo, encore une fois un excellent jeu qui m'a laissé sans voix, avec une histoire plutôt émouvante. :)

On incarne un petit enfant qui au début se retrouve à poursuivre une jeune fille qui le fuit mais qui finira par l'aider Par la suite vous allez être rejoins par votre robot (un petit jouet) : Lula, et enfin pour finir par "Le Monstre" un véritable monstre qui restera innofensif mais pas toujours ! ;)

Ce jeu est remplit de casse têtes plus ou moins difficiles à résoudre, en passant de batîments sur pattes, batîments volants, ou encore une maquette miniature où les déplacements effectués dessus, contrôlent aussi les batîments à échelle réelle du jeu. Et évidemment des tonnes d'autres casses têtes qu'il vous faudra résoudre ! Un jeu d'une ingéniosité unique et exceptionnelle.

Aussi un petit peu d'amusement, la possibilité de jouer au foot contre un mur si on se fait vraiment chier, mais aussi de jouer avec "le monstre", il la renvoie trrès très bien d'ailleurs ! :p

En parlant du monstre, vous contrôlez ses déplacements de manière indirecte avec les fruits ou tout ce que vous pourrez trouver pour le nourrir : noix de coco, grenouilles, ou fruits pourris, mais vous le découvriez dans le jeu, chacun à son petit effet sur lui, et des fois il faudra bien tous les gérer pour pouvoir finir le niveau (qui au passage s'enchaînent tous très bien les uns aux autres).

Une histoire composée de quelques actes, avec un petit scénario inspiré des souvenirs du créateur, mais bon le jeu en lui-même reste extrêmement plaisant à jouer, aux alentours des 3h/4h de jeu, qui passe vraiment rapidement, car on est très vite pris et on s'en lasse jamais, en tout cas c'était mon cas ! :)

Graphiquement pour un jeu de ce niveau là, j'ai été énormément surpris, car c'est d'une putain de beauté clairement, il n'y a rien à redire (je vous invite à aller voir les captures d'écran que j'ai pu faire pour le voir) ! De même au niveau de la bande sonore du jeu, de bonnes musiques, et des effets sonores parfaits qui rendent tout ce jeu comme un pur moment de détente, sincérement je n'ai jamais été aussi détendu sur un jeu, j'ai pris un pur plaisir du début à la fin.

Je vous le conseil vivement si vous voulez passer un bon moment de détente, avec une manette ça passera encore mieux, en tout cas, un jeu sans prise de tête, rapide et même tellement bon que vous resterez surement sur votre fin avec une envie d'avoir une suite ou d'attendre un autre opus voir le jour. Bon jeu à vous ! :D

8866549.review:
Papo & Yo is a delightful platformer/puzzle game with a very interesting theme. Though the game might at first look seem like a fantasy story of a boy and a monster being friends, it really is about growing up and coming to terms with your childhood. It is a game about how our imagination can help us cope with difficult times, until we are strong enough to take the masks off, see things for what they really are and accept reality for what it is.
In essense, Papo & Yo is not an extraordinary game, but it is a very good one. It has a strong and very personal message, one which I believe most people should be able to relate to one way or another. You can't go wrong with it.

The story is really touching if you can get through the crappy puzzles and the music is some of the best, especially for the style of the game as a whole.

Overall I would recommend this game if you have the spare cash. Main reason is it's got no replay value what-so-ever.

8862154.review:
C’est impossible de parler de ce jeu en lui rendant vraiment hommage. Disons que ses créateurs sont partis dans leurs idées, leurs concepts et les ont menés à bien avec talent.

L’intérêt du jeu n’est pas la difficulté des puzzles, mais l’univers dans lequel on évolue, ainsi que le sujet traité.
Il est question de mettre sous la forme d’un jeu vidéo un enfant, avec tout ce qui fait ses rêves et son innocence impliquent, confronté à l’alcoolisme de son père et les violences qui en découlent. C’est un sujet extrêmement délicat et difficile à traiter, et pourtant ils ont réussi à créer un univers sympas, fun, enfantin, et d’y intégrer ce « montre » parfois dangereux mais assez prévisible. Et ça fonctionne !

Ça sent le jeu bien pensé et travaillé dans les détails pour réussir ce défi.
C’est ce genre de jeux qui approchent les jeux vidéo du monde de l’art : à la fois ludique et intelligent.
Du coup, c’est un grand OUI, je recommande ce jeu. Même s’il a une durée de vie assez courte, il n’est ni lassant ni répétitif, très plaisant, et profond. C’est une perle du jeu indé et une vraie expérience à vivre. En tous cas, vous l’aurez compris, j’ai beaucoup aimé.
Et vous ?

8843428.review:
Papo y Yo is a 3rd person action platformer. Its basic controls and easy to understand mechanics allows its charm to shine through. The story is centered around Quico, a south american boy, that sets out to find why he is cursed. He follows a mysterious girl around in search of the answer to his quest. He comes to find that his curse is to be paired with a monster who is usually disinterested in him but will turn in a moments notice and attack Quico when presented with some mysterious tree frogs. Quico has the ability, or the task, rather of manipulating his world. The south american favela setting is both oppressive and beautiful; at times the world is vivid and imaginative. Traversing the various puzzles can drastically change them in ways you would never expect. 
As the story unfolds you come to find that the metaphors run deep and will certainly hit hard. The only complaint I have with Papo y Yo is that while the story is superb, it ends too soon. I suppose for the underlying subject matters, no spoilers, its best for this to be a short experience. 
The game is beautiful, and easy to pick up and play. It's a 4 to 6 hour romp that is worth its asking price. Go check it out.

I was gripped the moment the game loaded. From the artistic main menu, to the absolutely gorgeous look to the game, to the fluid game play and stellar control feel, this game is top notch. In fact it makes some of the other titles that I've been playing lately  all of a sudden feel mundane.

I've noticed a few reviewers have felt the game to be boring, but this wasn't the case for me at all. It was SUCH a refreshing change from the usual "gun and ammo seeking" games that have flooded the market. Trying to kill everything that moves before it kills you is not part of this game at all...you're actually trying to help someone who needs help. I suspect that those who didn't like this game fall into the COD or war gamer category, and that's not me.

If you're remotely curious about this game then dive in and get it! You won't be disappointed. 

9/10

8816240.review:
Wow, what to say about this game!  When I bought this game, I did not know what to expect.  To be very honest, I did not even know what the game was about, other than it was an action/platformer game.  The story of this game is rather deep for such a childrens style game.

I don't really want to post any spoilers, but you run around as a kid named Quico whose father is an alcoholic.  You are in what seems to be a dream world where you have to solve puzzles and platform your way across each area to progress the story.  The puzzles are not overly hard, but the game is just fun and the story is a big metaphor.

The game is relatively short, but I believe you can play through twice just for the achievements.  Overall, this was one of the most enjoyable games I have played in the last year.  I did not want to stop playing! Part of me wishes it were longer, but another part is glad it was the length it was, because it did feel just right.

Anyhow, if you are looking for a action/platform/puzzle game that has a pretty good metaphoric driven story and is fun to boot, well I think this is right up your alley!

8801280.review:
Papo & Yo is a delightful platformer/puzzle game with a very interesting theme. Though the game might at first look seem like a fantasy story of a boy and a monster he befriends, it really is about growing up and coming to terms with your childhood. It is a game about how our imagination can help us cope with difficult times, until we are strong enough to take the masks off, see things for what they really are and accept reality for what it is.
The game itself isn't very challenging, but the platformer controls can be a bit finnicky from time to time. The environments of the game are well made and it is fun to see how the world shifts as you solve the puzzles. The game is fairly short but it definitely keeps you invested in it until its very appropriate and memorable ending.
In essense, Papo & Yo is not an extraordinary game, but it is a very good one. It has a strong and very personal message, one which I believe most people should be able to relate to one way or another. You can't go wrong with it.

8799261.review: Autobiographical game and a surreal parabole about a relationship between a child and abusive parent with drinking problem. That alone makes Papo & Yo stand out. However actual gameplay consists of series of puzzles that are inventive and satisfying but never bring greater challenge as it is almost always obvious what to do. Jumping is imprecise at best and sadly there are few sections where you have to perform a double-jump in a very specific way which is not fun at all. I reccomend Papo & Yo for tackling with difficult topics and for creating a memorable experience.

8797846.review:
Me ha encantado. De primeras es un juego de puzzles infantil recreado en una favela. Su historia hace que quieras saber que ha ocurrido realmente. Aunque el juego dura unas cuatro horas, no se hace corto, pero, una vez acabada la historia, no hay muchos alicentes para jugar otra vez el juego. 
Despues de leer esto, pensarías que el juego no merece realmente la pana. Todo lo contrario, la historia que nos cuenta este videojuego dista mucho del carácter infantil de éste título. Es una historia dura, en la que el protagonista no se abre paso a tiros para salvar su país/planeta/galaxia. Es una lucha contra los recuerdos, y el dolor que provocan. Son estos recuerdos los que te hacen querer avanzar en la historia. Saber que ocurrió realmente con Quico, Lula y Alejandra. 
En definitiva es una historia que merece la pena con un apartado visual excepcional ¿Quién dice que un indie no puede tener unos gráficos buenos? 
Este mundo de ensueño está ambientado con una gran banda sonora que nos ayuda a introducirnos en las favelas. La música es muy buena, y merece la pena echarle un vistazo a la banda sonora.
En definitiva es un buen juego que merece la pena jugar, y una prueba de que los videojuegos no son solamente historias infantiles o adolescentes. Podemos encontrar una historia dura, adulta y a la vez edificante en este título.

[FAMILY]
This game is in my opinion acceptable for kids of younger age too, though I would not suggest letting kids play this alone below the age of 10, the story and puzzles are not easy enough and the Monster might scare and confuse the younger kids. Other then that, if you play this together with your children, they will enjoy it.

Quico es un niño de las favelas. Triste y en un rincón de su casa, descubre una especie de portal, que lo traslada al mundo de su subconsciente, donde sus temores se transforman en un monstruo y sus alegrías en compañeros de batalla. La parte mala, es que aparte de que no ves ningún tipo de unión entre los protagonistas y nunca parece que están juntos en el mismo carro, no te da tiempo a identificarte con ellos, por lo que en todo el juego te sentirás casi como un mero espectador.

8779902.review:
This masterpiece caught me off-guard.  I was expecting a lighthearted platforming romp through puzzles, like Portal, but instead what I got was a powerfully moving story.  The visual experience that is this game is hard to overstate.  The puzzles are unique and balance the edge between challenge and ease perfectly.  The dual-layering of everything you see and experience is really powerful, and merits a second playthrough, just to let what you're seeing sink in.

What impressed me most about the game was the incredible imagination it showed.  It's so imaginative, you really do feel like you're controlling a creative child, without it feeling too much like a children's game.  Believe me, it isn't.  10/10, best game I've played in years.

Well... yes, I was quite disappointed by the gameplay, but the story was touching, and the ending especially moved me.  Those weren't tears though, I was chopping onions last night. 8763838.review:
I wasn't expecting much from Papo & Yo but ws very pleasantly surprised.

Papo & Yo tells a very sad (and very real) story through a compelling narrative and clever gameplay. While it may seem to be a game for children, it's mature subject matter means some parental guidance would be advisable before letting them play.

While the story may not be for kids, the visuals, audio and gameplay certainly are. The environments are more less variations of the same favela theme but some certainly do stick out as particularly pretty. The audio is great and befits the environment. The soundtrack especially is outstanding; a beautiful selection of Latin American instrumentals.

The gameplay is a mixed bag. The puzzles while simple are fun to solve thanks to some unique mechanics and smart level design. The only gripe I have is with the lack of an auto follow camera forcing the player to control the camera manually all the time. The game is short but fulfilling nonetheless.

Papo & Yo is a fantastic little game masking a touching story of some real world issues. It is well worth a play through, if only to experience the story, mechanics and level design.

8733346.review:
Can't properly remember the last time i played something that good! Got a little "upset" to see this game didn't get much attention, but i'm glad i played - and i did really enjoy it - and i hope some you will play it too. 

Papo & Yo  is something between reality and dreams, hope and escapes, is a little story about a boy named Quico that suffered from his abusive, alcoholic father, and on this case the father is the "monster" that follow us. The father is really gentle, kind person, but when drinks get super violent, but on this case when the monster eats frogs - and by frogs we change for alcohol - will get very angry. 

About this 'masterpiece', with has a lot of puzzles, not very hard our to easy puzzles, medium puzzles that you can solve in 1/2 min, it also has a very good artistic side, in almost every corner you will see some graffiti with excellent art.  Although the favelas are always empty you can "sense" some loneliness but is also here some people are happy. 

The OST that follows is great, super calm, fits with the theme. Ths plot will suffer some huge twist, some happy twist and some SAD twist, and if you "connect" with the characters you will get a little sad - like i did - , but in the end is a explanation to all. 

With no doubt is a EXCELLENT game, everyone should play it and enjoy the most! Some of you will get some empathy - like me - but the story kind remember some people lives, so make a favor to yourself and play this! 

~ 10/10

8731583.review: Papo & Yo is an emotional experience about a young boys escape from the reality of his abusive drunk father via the power of imagination, told in the characters actions with the surrounding environment and Monster, the allegoral representation of his father. The story is not told with text, nor with spoken audio. It unfolds differently for each player, as you must imagine what you will as the visuals and character interactions further the narration of the story. While Papo & Yo is short in length, it delivers in excellence a touching, beautiful, and heartrending experience. Visuals are top knotch, audio is clear, and mechanics are stable and concise. While not a AAA experience, Papo & Yo far exceeds expectations both in format and design, and is an incredibly underrated title. This tear inducing social commentary in artistic form is a must have, and is well worth it's current asking price.

8724108.review: Papo & Yo is a heartfelt and deep experience that you shouldn't go without. The game follows a loveable, and to some of us, relatable young boy named Quico. Hiding in a closet out of fear of what waited on the other side, Quico suddenly witnesses a portal to another world open against the wall. Being no worse than what wrath he may face if he is found, he dives in. You are immediately immersed in a visually rich world that is seemingly abandoned yet feels wonderfully alive. The puzzles start simple but become more thought provoking as Quico, Monster, and his robot, Lula, follow a young girl further in to this strange world in a story that is sure to touch your heart. The sights, sounds, and story work together to craft a memorable, playable work of art.

8724043.review:
A mesmerizing approach to a poetic entity that leaves you with a sense of understanding about a character through metaphors.  This story will strike at your heart in a meaningful way, in which it will leave you awed at how well the world and events are put together. Aside from the simplistic puzzles and mishaps where you need to repeat yourself in a game of trial and error in some parts, you begin to establish a relationship with each character without need for many words.
The symbolic metaphors, masterful soundtrack pieces, and seeing the dark side of the story will most likely hit you at its prime, the very core of your heart, and jerk a tear right out of your existence.

8719550.review:
If this game is on sale, then I would recommend getting it. It can be finished in about 3 hours, so the price tag is a little bit high if you pay full price.

Anyway, the game is an environment based puzzle platformer with a story that both draws you in and screws with your mind. You think it's just a game that takes place inside a child's imagination, where everything is cheerful and happy, but it kinda isn't. I won't spoil it but by the end of the game, you realise that the environment the game takes place in actually reflects the rather  grim story. Definitely one to make you think.

The gameplay is quite inventive too. The environment itself pretty much bends (literally in some cases) to allow you to proceed. It is well and truly the product of a creative mind and the way you have to complete the puzzles may be simple in terms of what you have to do, but it sure as hell takes a level of thought sometimes. Thankfully, there are hint boxes for the more complex puzzles in the game. I did enjoy playing it.

One of the strongest points of this game is the beautiful and ambient soundtrack that accompanies the game's storyline; on the outside, it appears to simply be an adventure/fantasy puzzle-solving game but on the inside, it holds much more as the subtle and beautifully laid out overarching background story fills in the cavities of why the protagonist, the boy, Quico is running around seeking a fantasised asylum. Tiene una serie de problemas muy obvios. El primero, la moralina y las metáforas que al principio nos van mostrando, luego ya son evidentisima hasta un punto de sobreexplicación.

Y el tercero, es la optimización no del todo afinada (aunque podia ser peor) y los bugs gráficos. 
Pero supongo que lo compensa con sus aciertos, desde las mecánicas y controles que son fluidos en todo momento y muy naturales, hasta la ambientación rollo fabelas y fantasia, pasando por el que te hagan pensar o que dé una visión personal del autor.

8692495.review:
Только закончил игру, пишу сразу после катарсиса =D
В двух словах: великолепная инди-игра, тот редкий случай, когда хочется применить слово "искусство".
Начинается игра достаточно печально: мало того, что вы маленький негритенок(что уже само по себе херово), так еще и ваш белый папка бухает по-черному,  а потом вешает вам и всей вашей семей звездюлей. 
От подобной херовой жизни пацан уходит в воображаемый мир, полный ахреннского арта и интересных задачек, которые предстоит решать с помощью новых друзей: вредной и загадочной девочки-колдуньи, игрушечного малеького робота и здорового розового чудовища.
4 часа геймплея прлетают очень быстро, задачки интересны и не напрягающи, сюжет тянет вперед. Очень необычен подход авторов к построению уровней, вам очень много придется изменять пространство вокруг себя. Ну а сюжет...сюжет полон очень сильных метафор, отличная сказка, которая заканчивается как быль.
Шикарное приключение, не пропустите игру в humble indie bundle 10, где ее можно купить за 1 доллар.

The only thing is this game might lack some re-playability as it's easy to memorize.

8686229.review:
A violent story told through the innocent eyes of a creative child, with good music, great odd looking puzzles, intriguing characters and astonishing sceneries.

I simply loved to play this game. It surprised and captured all my attention with it's creativity and originality and the fact that its story had a deeper and real meaning made it even more special.

One thing I must add is the fact that the game, however complex it is, is still simple enough for my four year old sister to play, like and understand (with a little help here and there). She enjoys the game a lot and understood the real problem behind the game's ficticious story without scarring her while still having fun.

8685988.review: Amazing, inspiring, scary...just few of the words that describe this wonderfull game. It is really interesting and presents its story in such a dreamy way. The atmosphere is really pleasant and I should say that one of the things helping for this is the great soundtrack. Yes, the puzzles are relatively challenging and will keep you busy for a while, but I think the true meaning about this adventure game is the powerfull message it brings to you when you discover its story. Definately recommend it!

8685234.review: Surprisingly amazing game, very nice and laid back with interesting although fairly simple puzzles. The game takes on the main protagonist of Papo and delves into the true meaning of what the game is about. Its interesting as not many games are able to take on adult content such as this one and provide real impact especially one on an emotional level without just showing something in full blatant force. It feels like the game takes on adult themes in a very  subtle way which makes it more interesting as you play different parts of the game and wonder what each part truly means. The game is fairly short where I finished it in one day which feels really good as its not long enough to drag on and also shows the main focus which is a lot of story, puzzles and plat forming. For an indie game I didn't expect too much and so was pleasantly surprised to find out how great the game is. As a puzzle game its also quite interesting although can be quite simple at times. The best part of the simplicity of the puzzle is that it feels like you're always moving forward kind of like if you start a good run and you don't really want to stop. This creates a good flow to the game as I never felt that I had to just stop and think, or get annoyed and trying random things until something happened. I would definitely give it a recommendation, especially if you're looking for a fairly short and intriguing indie game.

Random train of my thoughts on this game.

I'm all for interracial marriage, but Quico and his dad seemed to be completely different races.
Is Quico's continuous shedding of clothes on his journey supposed to be a metaphor of losing your childlike innocence when dealing with abusive parents?

8669193.review: I would give Papo & Yo a 4/10. I absolutely love the concept of the game: an abused boy escapes into a world of his imagination where he grapples with Monster, a representation of his step-father. The way that the puzzles work and the idea of the white and how it works is wonderful. However, the character's interaction with the world is odd (ledges I get my feet above but still can't land on, things like that); many of the puzzles are clever and interestingly done, but once the method is discovered, the tasks become monotnous and overextended; and the end plot in which his fantasy touches his reality is portrayed in a way that I can only describe as cheesy. In short: great concept, executed poorly. I would play it if presented to me for free, but I would not recommend paying to play it.

8664808.review: Papo & Yo propose une expérience courte, linéaire mais poétique et évocatrice. Le jeune garçon fera tout pour soigner son père alcoolique, représenté par un monstre géant et lunatique, et qui servira aussi d'allié dans la résolution des puzzles. Ces derniers ont une difficulté moyenne - et des indices sont consultables, sont relativement variés et mettent parfois en avant des petites séquences de plateforme. Le point fort du titre restera la mise en scène des puzzles - je n'en parle pas plus pour éviter le spoil - et son atmosphère mixée sud-américaine/onirique. Comptez 5-6 heures pour terminer l'aventure, donc un titre que je recommanderais de se procurer en période de promotion.

8658148.review: It will make you feel.  This interactive media makes you look at pain and love.  Specifically the pain caused by an evil drunken father and the confusing love felt by a son.  You feel along with the son.  The son loves his sister and she is also in pain.  The confusion of having a father,  who's rage must be managed and avoided and who will has fun playing and laughing with you, is a discovery.  It is emotional to the point that I felt like avoiding it and then it was so fascinatingly truthful in its depth that I could not disengage.  I know more than I did before I experienced this.  I think that was the goal of the man who made it and I know he was sucessful in teaching and sharing somthing from his life.  I was sad and angry durring this experience.  I guess that is the key feature of this game.   It has fastinating visuals and surreal, reality bending puzzles but at its core this is about sharing feelings.  Thank you Papo & Yo.

8658049.review: I picked up this game in the Humble X Bundle knowing very little about it. What I found was one of the deepest, most moving, beautifully rich story experiences I've had in a game for many years. Not only is the writing and execution top-notch, but everything about this game is excellent - the tight, responsive controls, the beautiful graphics, the unique and stunning fantasy representation of the Costa Rican Favelas, the underlying themes of child abuse and living with alchoholism handled with care and compassion. An absolutely stunning experience. I cannot recommend it enough.

8657456.review:
Papo & Yo é um encontro entre realidade e onirismo, entre lembranças e escapismo. O monstro que acompanha o protagonista é uma criatura amigável até a partir do momento em que engole um sapo, formando toda uma alegoria para mostrar o relacionamento conturbado entre um pai alcoólatra e seu filho.

Através de uma maravilhosa direção de arte, temos uma favela tipicamente brasileira que, apesar de estar sempre desabitada, aparece sob um ambiente eternamente diurno, leve e sempre acompanhada de uma deliciosa trilha sonora que também carrega alguns elementos brasileiros, alegres. O mesmo cenário que, na imaginação de Quico, pode ser manipulado através de engrenagens e chaves feitas de giz para a resolução de puzzles relativamente simples, de forma que não comprometa o fluxo geral do jogo. (em outras palavras, se você é um ~rárdicóri~, provavelmente detestará Papo & Yo)

Sem dúvidas recomendo este jogo por proporcionar uma temática diferente, a qual é abordada de uma maneira sensível, bonita e madura. Ele também não é desnecessariamente longo, não dura mais do que quatro horas. Como um todo, o jogo vale muito a pena.

8653856.review:
(If you have read the review of this game by Mitch Dyer on IGN, please ignore that review. It is a horrible review and should not be taken seriously.)

Papo & Yo is a 3-D puzzle platformer by Minority Media taht was first released for the PS3, but then brought to the PC. At first, you might not understand the story, but you will understand it once you get towards the end. The story is actually quite depressing and makes you sympathize for the main character. The game is only about 3-4 hours long, but it is an amazing and well made game. I feel the length of the story is perfect for a game like this.

The game is pretty basic since it is a puzzle platformer, but there are other aspects added to the game at some points. Some of these include trying to get a monster following you from one area to the other, or even jumping on his belly to get to a higher platform. The puzzles in the game are mostly easy, though there were a couple that I had to look up, personally. I felt the music used in the game was quite good and very fitting for the game. The graphics are pretty good and can be compared to some triple a games, in my opinion.

I didn't find many issues with the game, except for occasional bad frames and it would sometimes freeze for a couple seconds, though this could have been my PC. It mainly happened to me when I walked near where a cutscene would start, or occasionally when I hit a checkpoint. I must say that this is now one of my favorite indie titles, and I hope to see more games from Minority Media. If I had to give this game a rating, I'd give it a 9/10.
